story:
Hi, our names are Courtney Bell and Anya Ranganathan. We are Duke seniors and the co-founders of Ungraded Produce, an affordable "ugly produce" delivery service that reduces food waste. 

Food waste is a huge problem because our food industry demands perfection. Produce that is deemed less-than-perfect is rejected from supermarkets due to strict cosmetic standards that have nothing to do with taste, nutrition, or shelf-life. Farmers are in turn discouraged from harvesting these ‘less saleable’ products.

The environmental and economic impacts of food waste are MASSIVE. In the United States alone, discarded food accounts for $165B of annual spending, 4% of US oil consumption, 33 million tons of landfill waste, and 16% of methane emissions. Every day, Americans waste enough food to fill a 90,000-seat football stadium!

We decided it was time to take action. In June 2015, we founded Ungraded Produce to challenge the food system’s obsession with perfection. Ungraded Produce is an online, subscription-based delivery service that distributes “ugly produce” at a discount. In line with our stance against waste, we source high quality produce that does not meet the appearance standards to sell in commercial markets due to atypical size, shape, or coloration. Nothing is bruised, old, less tasty, or less nutritious!

HOW IT WORKS

  • Customers sign up for a subscription at ungradedproduce.com. Every other week, subscribers have a box of ugly produce delivered to their homes.
  • We offer three core products: a 5 lb, 10 lb, and 15 lb box of ugly produce. Each box contains 4-7 varieties of “ugly” produce sourced from North Carolina farms. Our products are priced 30-50% cheaper than grocery store comparables.

THE BENEFITS

  • Ungraded Produce helps connect farmers with misshapen and surplus product with consumers who want high quality, low-cost fruits and vegetables.
  • We compensate farmers fairly for their high quality but atypical-looking products. Our suppliers are happy to see that their labor of love is reaching consumers!
  • Our convenient home delivery model and low prices help more people access affordable, high quality products.

OUR PROGRESS

“Even in relatively equal societies, welfare can be increased without increase in consumption by consuming differently, rather than consuming more.”

        -- Ha-Joon Chang

Since founding Ungraded Produce in June 2015, we’ve continued to remain inspired by this quote. Ungraded’s vision is twofold. First, we aim to challenge perceptions of what constitutes “marketable” produce. Second, we want to fight against food waste by diverting viable product towards buyers. By selling ugly and excess produce, Ungraded reduces inefficiencies in the farming system.

We officially launched Ungraded Produce in September 2016. During our pilot, we distributed thousands of pounds of produce to our subscribers. Since then, the demand for Ungraded Produce has grown dramatically!

January 28 will mark the beginning of the Spring 2017 subscription period. We hope to have 500 subscribers by the end of 2017, and need funding to support a growing customer base. Here is a summary of what your contributions will go towards:

  • Delivery vehicles
  • Rent for storage space
  • Integrating eCommerce, automatic billing, and delivery management into our website
  • Marketing initiatives
  • Fees for licenses
  • Legal assistance

WHY INVEST IN UNGRADED?

We want to make our service available to thousands of people throughout North Carolina and beyond, all while remaining committed to compensating growers fairly, providing an affordable and convenient product, and using sustainable practices. But in order to do this, we will need your help!

Your contributions will help us grow in a number of ways. As a startup, we currently have have limited resources to invest in delivery vehicles, e-commerce infrastructure, marketing campaigns, and additional members to add to our two-person team. But all of these are instrumental in helping us recover and reintegrate as much food back into the market as possible! 

WHAT YOU GET:

We want to thank you for supporting Ungraded Produce during our critical growth phase!

  • Donate $10 and receive a thank you note and an Ungraded Produce sticker
  • Donate $25 and you’ll receive a 5 lb box of produce
  • Donate $50 and you’ll receive a 10 lb box of produce
  • Donate $100 and you’ll receive three 10 lb boxes of produce
  • Donate $1000 and you’ll receive two subscriptions (14 deliveries total) of produce
  • **If you live out of state, we can send you Ungraded Produce merchandise and also donate this produce to a local food bank, shelter, or food insecure family

Join Ungraded Produce in the fight against food waste! Please consider donating to help us grow and improve the sustainability of our food system!

Share this campaign using Indiegogo tools, and tell your friends about Ungraded Produce!

Like us on Facebook and check us out at ungradedproduce.com

story:
A library for tools!

 

Living in a city, most of us have faced the frustrating dilemma of needing, but not owning, a tool. What if there was a space where you could borrow a drill as easily as you can borrow a book from a library? This is where the Chicago Tool Library comes in. 


The Chicago Tool Library will lend you all of the tools you wish you owned - shovels, saws, drills, but also sewing machines, crock pots, and microphones!


Here’s where we’re at: 

 

We’ve spent countless hours planning, filing paperwork, researching, writing a budget, building a business plan, and consuming uncomfortable amounts of coffee. We’ve also secured an amazing space (with cool garage door, garden space, and a loading dock!) alongside a dynamic community of makers and we’re ready to get this show on the road! 

Our new home is at:
1048 W 37th St Suite 102
Chicago, IL 60608

With your support, we plan to open our doors in July of this year!


Here’s what we need: 


We’re raising $25,000 which is what we need to secure our location for our first 1.5 years, build out our space (furniture, materials, etc), support our volunteers, and all the other little things we need to make the tool library of your dreams.

$14,338 - Rent and utilities through June 2020
$4,000 - Insurance and fees
$3,000 - Supplies and materials to build out our space
$2,000 - Tool purchases (new and used tools for our members to borrow)
$1050 - Computer software, hardware, phone, and office supplies
$600 - Operations and volunteer support

=  $24,988.


What if we don’t meet our goal?

If we don’t meet our goal we’ll prioritize our rent and operations and take a slower approach to acquiring our tool collection.

 

What if we exceed our goal??

Great question, thanks for asking! We want to hire a paid tool librarian!! It is very important to us that the library hires staff as soon as possible to provide a consistent, knowledgeable, and friendly presence for all of our library-goers. Help us make that dream a reality!

 

What’s in it for you?

 


You don’t have to donate out of the goodness of your heart: you can do it for the presents! We won't know the difference! We’ve got some awesome perks including MEMBERSHIPS to the library so you can get dibs on the floor sander and the cider press! Also what kind of fundraiser would this be if there weren’t tote bags? Check ‘em all out on the sidebar!

 

Why a tool library?


Tools can be expensive, bulky, and most city-dwellers don’t need to own a garage full of tools. Tool libraries provide affordable access to a wide inventory of tools for all of your projects, sparing you the need to purchase the tool or hire help. 

The Chicago Tool Library will be a membership-based nonprofit lending institution, like a book library, with memberships priced on a sliding scale to ensure nobody is unable to borrow tools due to their financial status. We believe tool libraries serve several important functions in a community, much like book libraries:

 

  • Sustainability - Borrowing instead of buying ensures our tools and equipment are being used to their full extent before being recycled or disposed of. By creating a library for tools we prevent needless manufacturing of tools that will be rarely used as well as senseless disposal of unwanted tools.
  • Social justice - Tool libraries level the playing field for access to resources. We believe that you shouldn’t have to be rich to build a garden or repair your home.
  • Community - Having somewhere to go to ask questions, get advice, learn, and meet folks in your neighborhood is important! We think our city deserves more accessible spaces for learning and experimentation - so we’re building one!
  • Creativity - Making tools accessible means lowering the stakes for creating! Try something new, take a chance, and make some art! Tool libraries create new opportunities for building and imagination. 
  • Well-being - If you have the desire to improve your home, your possessions, or your skills, we want to help. Tool libraries support the self-sufficiency, empowerment, and well-being of our neighbors. 

Is Chicago ready for a tool library?

We conducted an interest survey and received nearly 300 amazing, thoughtful responses from people in over 50 of Chicago's many neighborhoods who WANT A TOOL LIBRARY. Here are some highlights:

Risks & Challenges


While 300+ successful tool libraries are humming along all over the world,

Exhibit A. 

each city has unique needs to be met by a tool library. Part of our work as we grow will be to learn how to build a library that suits the needs of Chicago. As a nonprofit organization we will rely on our neighbors as volunteers, advisors, and donors to make the space sustainable and meaningful. 

We believe that Chicago will rise to the occasion to donate tools, time, and money. On our part, we will work hard to listen to your needs and create a community space you want to use.


Other Ways You Can Help!

You can help us reach our goals by donating money, but you can also donate tools, donate time, or donate your voice by sharing our project with your community on-line and off-line. 

Help us spread the word by sharing this fundraiser!

We’re so grateful for the support and encouragement we’ve received so far and we can’t wait to see what we’re able to create together! THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

 

Introduce yourself and your background.

Hi guys! My name is Alicia Miller, 33 year old female living in Royersford, PA. By profession, I am a banker. Not one of those Wall Street bankers, but an actual in branch banker, and I’ve done so since 2003. I’ve always been able to pay the bills, but  in this age of technology, the need for tellers and personal bankers is getting slim. 

“The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reported that bank tellers held 498,460 jobsand earned a mean annual salary of $27,260 as of 2015 (www.bls.gov). The BLS also reported that job opportunities for bank tellers were expected to decline eight percent between 2014 and 2024.”

Not so encouraging, huh?

I've thought a lot over the last few years about what my future will be and how to change it. 

Realtor? Eh.

Vet Tech. Eh 

Medical Assitant? Eh. No.

What do I love? I LOVE real estate. Im an HGTV junkie. Ok, what else? I love cats! How do I turn the things I love into what I do for the rest of my life? Combine the two and you get a cat cafe! Why didnt I think of this sooner?? 

 

The Campaign is pretty straight forward. Raise money to lease an amazing space in the perfect location in King of Prussia

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • The numbers are still rough, but I estimate about $100,000 needed to open my doors. That includes:
    • Leasing a building in the perfect location
    • Building the space out to accommodate a cafe as well as cats, subject to zoning laws.
    • Food / drink (coffee, milkshakes, sweet treats)
    • Cups and mugs
    • Restaurant equipment. 
    • Cat supplies (food, litter, toys, beds, houses, etc.)
    • Promo swag! Shirts, mugs

The Impact

First and foremost, your contribution will directly impact hundreds of homeless cats and kittens.

Furthermore, you will be supporting a female entrepreneur that just wants to bring an awesome space to her community.

Risks & Challenges

Risks and challenges? Well, this is my first business. I don't really know much about business. I do know that I am committed and passionate about making this a reality. I trust the process and I am confident that my passion will rub off on to others. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • SHARE this page! Any and all word of mouth helps!

And that's all there is to it.

 

 

THANK YOU for checking out my campaign!

story:
Ecolodge and camping site Mambo

 My name is Olivier Barancira,I m 39,I m burundian.I ve been traveling in East Africa for the last 2 years and I found out how beautiful it is.I am actually based in Rwanda.

 The project is to create an ecolodge and a camping site in Musanze,Rwanda,near the natural habitat of the silver back gorilla,on the Lake Burera.

Wooden bungalows will be build on the edge of the water and a camping site will be created.The goal is using a maximum of renewable energy to encourage people into eco tourism

The reason why this project is important is first of all that it will create jobs,it will educate people to consume green energy and it will show how beautiful the country is.

The amount needed is 9100 USD.It will serve to build :

  • 8 wooden bungalows with furnitures(500 USD per bungalows)
  • to create the camping site(100 USD)
  • to create the restaurant(1400 USD)
  • to buy 5 solar panels for heating water and ligths and a water pump(2500 USD)
  • Green house,permaculture,farm(1000 USD)
  • Art space,yoga,meditation(100 USD) 

 

The reason why this project is important not only for me but for you and for the world as well it is because it foster eco tourism,it will help people to realise that there is another way of visiting,enjoying tourism and being respectful of the nature

So help us achieve our goal,make a dream come true,donate and share the link with a maximum of people.

story:
Short Summary

Tiny Victory is something of a homecoming for Ian Merryman. TV is located at 506 W. Broad Street in historic Jackson Ward. This isn't his first dance in this space. In 2016, Ian was the chef of the awesome, but too short-lived restaurant, Antler & Fin (who, like mentioned...was housed at 506 W. Broad St.) There's something vindicating about returning to this space with his own project (which he co-owns with partner, Devon Halbert and long-time friend/co-worker Mark Frenier.) Antler & Fin never got to achieve its true potential, but Ian has returned with a Tiny Victory of his own...

(A hot bowl of smoked beef mami.)

  • After hitting the Richmond pop-up circuit for three years as The Jackdaw, we are opening a refined, casual neighborhood restaurant that showcases our interests and love of Filipino (and other Southeast Asian) food. We are by no means offering an authentic experience, but we want to be the bridge for people who are curious about Pinoy food. Our aim is pull you in  for a memorable experience and have you seek out the authentic cuisine that influences us so heavily. We want it to feel as comfortable as it would if you were to have stepped into a friend or family member's home. 

(Ian and Devon.)

  • Tiny Victory is helmed by Devon Halbert and Ian Merryman. Ian has been working in kitchens across the US for sixteen years. Most recently: he's been seen as a sous chef at Graffiato, chef de cuisine of Antler and Fin, head chef of Millie's Diner, and The Jackdaw pop-up series. While he has no family or cultural ties to Filipino cuisine, he remembers fond memories of being exposed to that and other forms of Asian cuisine at an early age. Ian's approach comes from a place of constant learning and reverence. This is his first solo brick and mortar venture.

(Our friend Laura Unterberg killing The Jackdaw pop-up game.)

  • We're not just looking for a piece of the pie for ourselves. We began as a pop-up. Sarah and Will over at Shoryuken Ramen gave us our first opportunity to get our feet wet in 2015. The karmic cycle has come around and it's our turn to give back. We plan on opening our doors to those who are looking to test their concepts. Our goal is to work with them and share the knowledge we've gained through the years. We're still learning and growing, but we have a fountain of useful knowledge we want to share with those looking to grow their concepts.  It's important to give back when there were so many who were willing to open their doors to us. We believe in pop-ups. We're ready to invest in others like we had people invest in us.
  • (The crew doing what they do at a recent Jackdaw pop-up.)

(Arctic Char Kinilaw)

What We Need & What You Get

  • The concept of crowdfunding is still so foreign to us, but we are opening this spot on our own. We have no loans, no huge outside investments to speak of...just a lot of sweat equity, our own money, and some help from our friends! We are looking to raise $10,000. Our lease is signed, renovations and light construction has started and we are planning to open our doors in the late spring/early summer (2018), but the minuscule details add up! We've been doing small preview dinners to raise more money. Your contributions will go towards increasing the functionality and experience of Tiny Victory. We still need to get our POS system, signage, replace one of the coolers in the kitchen, two sink drains replaced, a little bit more plate and glassware, and the kitchen could use a few more pots and pans to provide what we feel is a better experience. We're not going overboard, but we won't cut any corners either.
  • To thank you for your support, we've put together a bunch of cool perks. We hope these tokens of our gratitude give you a sense of what we hope to accomplish. The show WILL still go on if we don't reach our final goal. Everyone who contributes will still receive their perks. Your contributions will drive us closer to offering the full experience we are hoping for. Like we mentioned before, we're scrappy and industrious. There is no stopping us from opening our doors and we look forward to having you as guests in our new home!
  • We'll be constantly updating this page with photos and little blurbs for our supporters to keep tabs on. (The kamayan experience can be real for a select few donors.)

The Impact

  • Our restaurant has all the makings of what we feel is "success." We value the "people over profits" mentality. It's truly possible to achieve the numbers you need to run a successful restaurant and still invest in people. That's important to us. Little things like opening our doors to other people looking to make their mark on the city's food scene, donating money to groups we believe are making a difference, and taking care of our staff's quality of life are our biggest priorities beside ensuring our guests have more than enjoyable experiences. Offering benefits and maternity/paternity leave are things we'd love to offer our staff as the ball gets rolling. Community is just as important to us as serving up food and drink. Your contributions will help us speed along the process of being in a position to do for others instead of just ourselves.

(Our friend, Christina aka @wing.chow working on our dining room mural.)

Risks & Challenges

Opening a restaurant is risky business - and it is also a fast-moving business. In the beginning stages - money is quickly burned up in build-outs, rent due before revenue, expensive licensing processes and other bumps in the road. Delays can happen. Especially, ones beyond our control. 

This is our first restaurant, but we didn't just decide that opening a restaurant was a good idea. We've been pounding the pavement, leaving our calling card all over Richmond for the last three years. We've already pushed through a majority of our hiccups. We've already experienced most of the opening pitfalls before seeking out your involvement (securing permits, licenses, etc...) That part is out of the way! One thing we are super proud of despite all of these challenges, is that we don't owe anyone any money! Yes, we have bills and people to answer to, but we have no loans out on this business, which alleviates a huge burden that we feel crushes a lot of businesses with so much potential.We are confident that everything else will pull together with great success. After being a pop-up for three years, we’re used to being scrappy and industrious.

We've spent three years looking for the right space. We are privileged to have brought you our concept and food in the form of The Jackdaw pop-up! We are ready to be here for you six days a week!  Our backgrounds are in restaurants - and some of us have been helping other people open up successful concepts of their own for well over a decade.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that there are tons of people who are willing to support the cause but are unable to contribute financially. We feel you. There are so many awesome things (and not so awesome things, like bills) we all throw money at. We're okay with that! Feel free to spread the word and help us on our journey!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Tiny Victory is something of a homecoming for Ian Merryman. TV is located at 506 W. Broad Street in historic Jackson Ward. This isn't his first dance in this space. In 2016, Ian was the chef of the awesome, but too short-lived restaurant, Antler & Fin (who, like mentioned...was housed at 506 W. Broad St.) There's something vindicating about returning to this space with his own project (which he co-owns with partner, Devon Halbert and long-time friend/co-worker Mark Frenier.) Antler & Fin never got to achieve its true potential, but Ian has returned with a Tiny Victory of his own...

(A hot bowl of smoked beef mami.)
After hitting the Richmond pop-up circuit for three years as The Jackdaw, we are opening a refined, casual neighborhood restaurant that showcases our interests and love of Filipino (and other Southeast Asian) food. We are by no means offering an authentic experience, but we want to be the bridge for people who are curious about Pinoy food. Our aim is pull you in  for a memorable experience and have you seek out the authentic cuisine that influences us so heavily. We want it to feel as comfortable as it would if you were to have stepped into a friend or family member's home. 

(Ian and Devon.)
Tiny Victory is helmed by Devon Halbert and Ian Merryman. Ian has been working in kitchens across the US for sixteen years. Most recently: he's been seen as a sous chef at Graffiato, chef de cuisine of Antler and Fin, head chef of Millie's Diner, and The Jackdaw pop-up series. While he has no family or cultural ties to Filipino cuisine, he remembers fond memories of being exposed to that and other forms of Asian cuisine at an early age. Ian's approach comes from a place of constant learning and reverence. This is his first solo brick and mortar venture.

(Our friend Laura Unterberg killing The Jackdaw pop-up game.)

We're not just looking for a piece of the pie for ourselves. We began as a pop-up. Sarah and Will over at Shoryuken Ramen gave us our first opportunity to get our feet wet in 2015. The karmic cycle has come around and it's our turn to give back. We plan on opening our doors to those who are looking to test their concepts. Our goal is to work with them and share the knowledge we've gained through the years. We're still learning and growing, but we have a fountain of useful knowledge we want to share with those looking to grow their concepts.  It's important to give back when there were so many who were willing to open their doors to us. We believe in pop-ups. We're ready to invest in others like we had people invest in us.

(The crew doing what they do at a recent Jackdaw pop-up.)




(Arctic Char Kinilaw)
What We Need & What You Get

The concept of crowdfunding is still so foreign to us, but we are opening this spot on our own. We have no loans, no huge outside investments to speak of...just a lot of sweat equity, our own money, and some help from our friends! We are looking to raise $10,000. Our lease is signed, renovations and light construction has started and we are planning to open our doors in the late spring/early summer (2018), but the minuscule details add up! We've been doing small preview dinners to raise more money. Your contributions will go towards increasing the functionality and experience of Tiny Victory. We still need to get our POS system, signage, replace one of the coolers in the kitchen, two sink drains replaced, a little bit more plate and glassware, and the kitchen could use a few more pots and pans to provide what we feel is a better experience. We're not going overboard, but we won't cut any corners either.
To thank you for your support, we've put together a bunch of cool perks. We hope these tokens of our gratitude give you a sense of what we hope to accomplish. The show WILL still go on if we don't reach our final goal. Everyone who contributes will still receive their perks. Your contributions will drive us closer to offering the full experience we are hoping for. Like we mentioned before, we're scrappy and industrious. There is no stopping us from opening our doors and we look forward to having you as guests in our new home!
We'll be constantly updating this page with photos and little blurbs for our supporters to keep tabs on. (The kamayan experience can be real for a select few donors.)



The Impact
Our restaurant has all the makings of what we feel is "success." We value the "people over profits" mentality. It's truly possible to achieve the numbers you need to run a successful restaurant and still invest in people. That's important to us. Little things like opening our doors to other people looking to make their mark on the city's food scene, donating money to groups we believe are making a difference, and taking care of our staff's quality of life are our biggest priorities beside ensuring our guests have more than enjoyable experiences. Offering benefits and maternity/paternity leave are things we'd love to offer our staff as the ball gets rolling. Community is just as important to us as serving up food and drink. Your contributions will help us speed along the process of being in a position to do for others instead of just ourselves.


(Our friend, Christina aka @wing.chow working on our dining room mural.)
Risks & Challenges
Opening a restaurant is risky business - and it is also a fast-moving business. In the beginning stages - money is quickly burned up in build-outs, rent due before revenue, expensive licensing processes and other bumps in the road. Delays can happen. Especially, ones beyond our control. 
This is our first restaurant, but we didn't just decide that opening a restaurant was a good idea. We've been pounding the pavement, leaving our calling card all over Richmond for the last three years. We've already pushed through a majority of our hiccups. We've already experienced most of the opening pitfalls before seeking out your involvement (securing permits, licenses, etc...) That part is out of the way! One thing we are super proud of despite all of these challenges, is that we don't owe anyone any money! Yes, we have bills and people to answer to, but we have no loans out on this business, which alleviates a huge burden that we feel crushes a lot of businesses with so much potential.We are confident that everything else will pull together with great success. After being a pop-up for three years, we’re used to being scrappy and industrious.
We've spent three years looking for the right space. We are privileged to have brought you our concept and food in the form of The Jackdaw pop-up! We are ready to be here for you six days a week!  Our backgrounds are in restaurants - and some of us have been helping other people open up successful concepts of their own for well over a decade.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many awesome things (and not so awesome things, like bills) we all throw money at. We're okay with that! Feel free to spread the word and help us on our journey!

story:
A little background........

Palenville the Hamlet Committee is a local nonprofit organization that promotes community spirit and sense of place in the Hamlet of Palenville New York.

Community feedback supports these locally designed banners;  showcasing Palenville to tourists and residents alike. The banners would hang from utility poles in the commercial areas on Rte 23a and 32a, similar to banners successfully displayed in other communities.

In addition to showcasing a sense of community, the banners would also serve to slow the traffic down on both routes in a cost effective manner, a concern voiced frequently by many residents in the community. 

What We Need.........

The purchase of 35 flags with  accompanying 'hanging' hardware costs  $155 per flag.  Installation would be done by our local government and fire department volunteers.  A successful fundraising campaign completed over the next two months supports  installation in time for the Greene County Fire Convention to be held in Palenville this year.

The Impact........

Heightened interest in the Clove and the history of Palenville as America's First Artist's Colony has increased  traffic on Routes 23a and 32a.  In car and on foot,  Palenville is a destination or stop for many.  Banners serve the dual purpose of identifying  our community  while slowing traffic.

What we've done so far.......

We've confirmed that the installation of the banners can be done as depicted in the photo we have shared on our page and we have approval for installation. 

Whether you live in Palenville now or have warm memories of Palenville in times past, show your support to raise a flag for Palenville, Contribute what you can and share with others whose hearts belong in Palenville.

story:
Sponsor a Chicken is a project that focusses on enriching the lives of the chickens at Cyrenians Farm as well as giving people a chance to be educated about homelessness and the great work that Cyrenians does to help combat it.

I came up with the idea because the chickens are a unique aspect of Cyrenians Farm. Looking after them gives residents and volunteers responsibility and a focus, which is much needed when it comes to getting back on your feet.

I have been directly affected by homelessness and the Farm was very integral in my recovery. I became a resident at the Farm Community and got to gain responsibility over decisions on gardening as well as my own health. I have now moved into my own flat and am doing a 6 month placement with Cyrenians as an Artist in Residence. Sponsor a Chicken is my first project in this role and I will be knitting egg warmers and making digital hugs and mini terrariums to give to sponsors.

The money will be split 2 ways: 50% will go towards upgrading their accommodation and feed options, and 50% will be used to improve the green spaces around the Farm Community. You can find out more about Cyrenians Farm in this short film.

The rewards of donating are that you will have contributed to bettering the lives of people affected by homelessness as well as supporting the Farm. I thought this project was a perfect way of giving back to the people that helped me get back on my feet.

story:
A Different Kind of Tech Service

How often do you get frustrated with your IT Company?  Do you find that they simply don’t deal with issues quick enough? That they don’t see you as a priority? Or do you simply feel that the service you are being billed for just isn’t there? This is a common problem today; many companies believe that they are being treated poorly and paying too much for the privilege.

Here at Evolve IT Solutions, we plan to change that for good. Having been in the IT and Technology game for 12 years, we’ve seen it all and we’ve been treated badly by those IT companies. Customer service doesn’t exist with many of them and that’s what we want to change.

Evolve It Solutions is offering you a brand new deal. We are offering you high quality customer service, a service that is fully aligned with your technology needs and your business goals. We will offer you:

  • Managed services
  • Business Continuity Planning
  • Backup Disaster and Recovery
  • IT Consulting
  • On-Demand services
  • Cloud services
  • Email and Spam protection
  • Hosted solutions

And much more besides. And all of that with a professional customer service that works for you not against you. We are focusing our service on small to medium business, providing an efficient and accurate way for them to focus their attention on their business, without having to worry about the IT end of things.

We’ve done our homework. We’ve talked to CIO’s and partners of some of the bigger companies and asked them what they think the biggest source of frustration is – they all agree that it comes down to the IT company not having a true grasp of the business model and not providing what the company needs to service that business model.

Competition is rife in in the IT industry. There are so many companies that, instead of charging by the hour, they now go on a monthly contract, winning the business of companies by putting in competitive bids. We are a little more traditional than that – we’ll offer you a monthly contract and by the hour charging which means we can offer you the most competitive deal.

What We Need & What You Get

Ok, so here’s the crunch. We are already up and running, we work for two businesses in Dallas but we want to be able to expand, offer more. We want to be able to pull together the tools and monitoring systems that will help us to provide you with the service you are paying for and we want to get cloud accounts set up for standardization. As well as that, we would love to be able to hire a professional web designer, someone who can put together a user-friendly website that includes forms and easier ways to contact us.

So, we are asking for just $10,000 to help us expand our services. If we break that barrier, any money over and above our target will be donated to Big Brother, Big Sister and Homeless Teens and, once we are all set up, we will be donating to both of these charities on a quarterly basis.

For your donation, you will be rewarded with:

  • $100 will get you a personalized thank you message
  • $500 will get you will get you a personalized thank you message
  • $1,000 will get you a lifetime sponsor spot on our website
  • $2,000 will get you a lifetime sponsor spot on our website and personal video from me

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that there are thousands of people, businesses looking to get off the ground so if you want to learn more about ours, take a look at the following links. And, if you like what you see, pass the word onto your friends and families.

  • Facebook www.facebook.com/itevolvesolutions
  • Drop by our website: www.evolveitsolution.com
  • Google+ https://plus.google.com/100703483893499594456
  • LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/brandonwskinner

Thanks you for taking the time out to read our proposal and I hope that you will be able to help us.

Thank you for taking the time to read over this.

Brandon
Evolve IT Solutions

story:
Great Compassion Uganda Orphanage Fundraising

Have you ever looked at all the suffering in the world and just felt powerless?

Do you look at the starving, homeless or parentless and just despair?

Now is your chance to reclaim that feeling of power, and be able to do something.

We are building a house and it has already started, but we won't be able to finish it without your help: Building a real orphanage home video

By giving any amount to this effort you can know: "Even if I have not completely fixed the problem, I am part of the solution"!

Here's a video from Kyamudugaza who works in Uganda at the Orphanage explaining more: Life at the great compassion uganda orphanage

By giving to this cause, you can see a whole house and over 30 young children who want to live in it, be built!

You can see the power and influence you have, and be rewarded for donating.

I and some Artist/ Poet/ Musical friends of mine have and are putting our works together to offer to you as "Donation Perks", based on the amount you donate you will receive these works for your enjoyment and as a reminder of your fundraising effort to make a difference in the lives of the young Ugandan children.

By helping hungry children in need with your financial aid, or simply by spreading the word about this charity, you are making the basics of life possible; Shelter, Food, Education, you are creating a future, not just for them, but, ultimately, for their region, possibly country, and eventually, ultimately, our world...

That might sound dramatic, but if you think about how the chain of cause and effect is not broken but goes on and on and on, it's really true! :)

  • Here's a little more specific details about me and the man I'm working together with in Uganda

    I am Samuel Alder, a 26 year old Artist/Poet, you can view some of my work here: www.samueladamalder.com I have been making visual art since I was a young child and digital art for over 10 years. Poetry has also always come naturally to me, and I decided to let my heart speak through poetry seriously a few years ago.

    Kyamadugaza Denis, who works on site with the children, other staff and works together with the laborers. He manages the charity organization and is 22 years old, he is The Chief of the Charity & Organization effort at Great Compassion Uganda, you can view his website and efforts here www.greatcompassionug.com  and read more about him here Kyamudugaza's Story

  • This campaign is important to me because I wish to see people in their natural state: Happy Healthy and Whole, and because there is so much of the opposite, I want to make a difference in the world, and this is one real way I see of making it.

  • Your contributions will help us pay for building the orphanage house; bricks, land, food, all kinds of labor support. This will make a big difference in the lives of 30 children, eventually, they will become adults themselves and many lives will be effected, given time, most will have children of their own,  You can see, given time, the effects are great.

    Like the Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius once said:
    What we do in life echos on throughout eternity!

What We Need & What You Get


  • We need roughly 5000 € to fund this house building effort and see it through to completion, construction has already begun but as stated above, won't be finished unless this effort is a success.

  • Unique perks: As a reward and motivation for donating to this cause, I have put together Art & Poetry for you, you will also have my, and the children's gratitude for helping, and based on how much you donate, I will talk to you via skype, our conversation can range from coaching to art secrets to philosophy to poetry, I have a lot to offer and give.

    Alternatively I am also looking for people to sponsor me for various fitness trials, like running 15 miles, or standing on my head for 5 minutes, or doing 100 push ups a day for 10 days, things like that.

  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal:
    The funds still go to the project of building the orphanage house, as you can see from the videos and photos and our websites, this is a legitimate project and there is nothing unusual or suspect involved at all, it really is about saving and changing children's lives.

The Impact

  • Creating a future for children and helping them to grow up happy, instead of angry, miserable or despairing, creates a future for the planet... The small things effect the large, science proves this over and over again. Just think of how small a tree's seed is, and how it grows up to be so huge.

  • Stopping possible wars and other horrible things from going on, because the anger, hurt and despair have no where to go: Being proactive and giving people a home, food and clothing and education really does change the course of people's lives and starting in a small way, history
    Remember: We're all in this together :)

Risks & Challenges

  • The greatest challenge is to raise these funds and create a home where homeless children can be come and unconditionally be fed, educated and all sorts of important things can be given to them.

  • The greatest Risk is if we don't get this done people like you and I reading this right now, simply die. They die daily of a number of causes, simple, avoidable causes like hunger, clean water shortage, diseases like malaria and typhoid and so on. We can avoid these risks and overcome them by rising to the challenge :)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute any money, that's fine, you can help in other ways too!

Perhaps you can make something yourself, write something, share this via social media, make a video, make some art, sing a song, thank you for your time and effort.
story_txt:
Great Compassion Uganda Orphanage Fundraising
Have you ever looked at all the suffering in the world and just felt powerless? Do you look at the starving, homeless or parentless and just despair? 

Now is your chance to reclaim that feeling of power, and be able to do something.We are building a house and it has already started, but we won't be able to finish it without your help: Building a real orphanage home videoBy giving any amount to this effort you can know: "Even if I have not completely fixed the problem, I am part of the solution"!Here's a video from Kyamudugaza who works in Uganda at the Orphanage explaining more: Life at the great compassion uganda orphanageBy giving to this cause, you can see a whole house and over 30 young children who want to live in it, be built! You can see the power and influence you have, and be rewarded for donating. I and some Artist/ Poet/ Musical friends of mine have and are putting our works together to offer to you as "Donation Perks", based on the amount you donate you will receive these works for your enjoyment and as a reminder of your fundraising effort to make a difference in the lives of the young Ugandan children.By helping hungry children in need with your financial aid, or simply by spreading the word about this charity, you are making the basics of life possible; Shelter, Food, Education, you are creating a future, not just for them, but, ultimately, for their region, possibly country, and eventually, ultimately, our world... story:
WE ONLY HAVE ONE WEEK LEFT!!! HELP US GET THIS BUILT!!!!

As part of the Market Street Prototyping Festival, occurring from April 9-11 on Market Street in San Francisco, the Interior Design and Industrial Design departments in collaboration with the Center for Art and Public Life at CCA are bringing an initial prototype called Adaptive Playscapes to the world. In conjunction with San Francisco based KIDmob and Philadelphia based Public Workshop, CCA students led by Gregory Hurcomb have been actively designing, prototyping and engaging with local middle school students to build their vision of a collaborative and interactive fun zone; a place to dream, design, and discover.  

We are a group of design students at the California College of the Arts constructing a deployable workshop environment to promote discovery through play in the urban environment. 

As part of an ENGAGE seminar with CCA and the Center for Art and Public Life, our group of students has teemed up with local non-profit KIDmob to bring Adaptive Playscapes to the Market Street Prototyping Festival. KIDmob is a mobile, kid-integrated design firm located in the Bay Area that runs design education workshops with kids to help solve community problems. They believe that “Kids and play are some of our most powerful tools for building community and bringing together diverse populations to imagine their neighborhoods in new ways.”

KIDMob is in the process of developing their project, Adaptive Playscapes, to both empower the kids involved in the design, and engage the community through its premier at the Market Street Prototyping Festival. Our class is helping to facilitate the group of designers comprised of middle school kids from San Francisco Friends School, Everett Middle School, and the French American International School who have been working diligently over the last month to design and prototype their ideal urban playscape. 

Our role is to design an integrative structure that can provide a sense of environment for the playscapes to perform within. It will provide shade and a feeling of enclosure, the vertical element to compliment their horizontal urban obstacle course. We have been working closely with the kids so that our design can better respond to their ideas and to gain inspiration from their energy and creativity. 

The Market Street Prototyping Festival, running April 9-11 2015, is an opportunity to transform how we envision Market Street as a public space, and to promote civic engagement through design. Our collaboration with KIDmob has been selected as one of fifty unique installations, but our budget is very tight and we need to secure more funding to truly realize our combined vision!

story:
We bring to you, Market on South. The home of Dixie Dharma, Humble Bumble Kombucha, and Valhalla Bakery, as well as facilities for other local vegetarian and vegan small food providers, manufacturers, and vendors.
Basing our business on the shared market concept, and having multiple vendors under one roof, we've created a mini market. We will showcase local artists, and craftsmen, giving the little guy a place to rent a shelf to sell locally made items, without everyone having to build their own storefront. 
We will be hosting a Saturday morning farmers market, offering cooking classes, lessons on brewing your own Kombucha, as well as basic cake decorating classes. 
We currently have the space, have the equipment, but we have run into some snags with the city, and need your help to get over these final hurdles. Two of the main ones are: the ceiling needs to have additional fire rating or a sprinkler system installed, and the Hvac system needs to be upgraded. As well as many other little things that have added up to more than we can handle on our own. The kitchen is in place, the equipment is ready, we just need your help to jump these last hurdles. 
The perks offer a wide array of funding options, and we thank you for all of your support and patience as we've been building this concept. We wouldn't be here without you guys!
*** update!***
A private benefactor is going to match the campaign funds, but ONLY if we meet the halfway point.  We've added some new perks, and if you can help us make this happen, we appreciate you! Consider the tables, planters, and anything else to be named as a great advertising opportunity for your business!

story:
Short Summary

Sub-Contract Market is an online Market Place for outsourcing work and contracts of all sizes. It is a Community  where  Businesses Outsource work to each other.

What We Need & What You Get

We require £29,000.00  to enable us do the following:

1.Upgrade to current Web Platform to integrate with Mobile Application and provide better user interface and customer experience.

2.Development of a mobile application for use by Contractors (initially) to improve and encourage easier bid placement. This facility delivers two benefits in that it allows us more direct communications with the contractor, informing them of new contracts available and secondly gives us the opportunity to sell target driven advertising.

3.Sourcing and implementation of an Integrated CRM system to bring all the elements of Client details, trading history, accounts and sales planning together including IT

4.General marketing/advertising Marketing & promotion of UK operation both to Contractors and Buyers (Companies)

5.  Working Capital

6. Growing the Communinty and Creating more Jobs

The Impact

Sub-Contract Market was founded by Mark Odenore, a sub-contractor for 20 years. Mark's experiences as a sub-contractor led him to believe that there had to be a better way to connect interested buyers to professional sub-contracting suppliers. In 2006, he set up Mid-west Services (UK) Ltd, a company that specializes in facilitating sub-contracting procurement That company  has seen its turnover grow from £13,568 and to date sales of £1,869,583

Creating a trusted and efficient platform and online market for contract outsourcing to benefit both contractors and subcontractors. It willbe creating Jobs and Business Opportunities for Start-ups, SMEs and saving bigger companies millions of pounds and time.

Risks & Challenges

I have personally funded this Business since its inception, I have approached investors and they have not been helpful, failing to get funding will see such a wonderful Business disppear

Other Ways You Can Help

We will appreaciate funding in kind this can include; marketing and making our presence known in your area, sharing our information on facebook, voting for our various pitches and any other way you can assist.

story:
What's green and red and takes 6 cars off the road? 

Kathleen's Shuttle service! This useful service takes up to 6 people out of their (emitting) cars and into a roomy, comfortable van, and their transportation needs from remote areas to hospitals, appointments, the airport or family elsewhere are looked after, and at a reasonable rate. People find me an excellent driver and helpful with their needs and great to have a conversation with. I am told: "Kathleen goes the extra mile!"

I travel quite a distance, in my business, (the areas are quite huge, here), and the van has reached its limit at 500, 800 kms, And counting! I desperately need a new van, as this one is now requiring a lot of funds and personal savings to keep it going, and operating the service. 

 I am likely the only female shuttle and tours business owner and operator in the province, if not the entire Atlantic region of Canada or elsewhere. I need your support, to help my customers, to help the environment, and to help me keep going, as I strive to help other people and our world.

And you can be a big help in this campaign by donating and also telling other people about it, On your Facebook page. By tweeting, On your other networks, and as many other ways as you can think of.  Help this good service keep helping others, and doing a great thing for the environment as well. It's all good!

Thank You!

story:
Vision

Gulf South Rising (GSR) is a regional movement of coordinated actions and events to highlight the impact of the global climate crisis on the Gulf South region (TX, LA, MS, AL, FL). Through collaborative events and actions around strategic dates in 2015 GSR demands a just transition away from extractive industries, discriminatory policies and unjust practices that hinder equitable recovery from disaster and impedes the development of sustainable communities.

Our goal: to seed a unified regional movement toward equity through coordinated actions and collaborative events led by frontline communities of the Gulf South in 2015.

This year-long initiative:

1) builds regional movement infrastructure; 

2) connects and convenes frontline communities around collective healing and ecological equity; 

3) advances regional efforts of indigenous tribal and land sovereignty; and, 

4) shifts the regional narrative from resilience to resistance.


Why?

Gulf South Rising (GSR) acknowledges the climate crisis.  The extreme extraction of limited energy resources, the subsequent pollution, and the lack of corporate and government accountability has damaged the land, people and systems of democracy of the Gulf South. GSR acknowledges that the global climate crisis is rooted in economic theories that promote mass consumption of limited resources, laws that maintain inequity and social hierarchies and governance processes that limit civic participation.

  • This is a grassroots-led initiative by the communities that are hit first and worst in disasters like the BP oil drilling disaster and Hurricane Katrina.  2015 offers us a moment to tell the REAL story of recovery and the truth about the impact Climate Change has in the United States, with the Gulf Coast as its front line.
  • Funds raised will go to supporting front line organizers from LA, TX, MS, AL, FL as they coordinate events on strategic dates in 2015 across the Gulf Coast Region
  • All funds raised, whether or not we reach the overall fundraising goal, will go toward accomplishing the mission of the Gulf South Rising Initiative.


Our Values

-Honor local, frontline leadership,

-Shared liberation

-Transparency and accountability of processes: As a donor, you will be invited to join our regular Gulf South Rising National Allies conference call, to track our accomplishments.



Other Ways You Can Help


  • SHARE this campaign with others using the Indigogo share tools.
  • Like us on Facebook "Gulf South Rising"
  • Volunteer with Gulf Coast Center for Law & Policy: www.gcclp.org


The seas are rising...AND SO ARE WE!

story:
Who are we 

We are a group of friends who are part of Grupo Escala, Chiapas, which was founded in 2000, based in Tuxtla Gutierrez and San Cristobal de las Casas in the south-eastern state of Chiapas in Mexico. We have a mission to promote mountaineering and climbing in the state of Chiapas, encouarge children and adults to have more contact with nature,  and help protect natural areas around both cities for tourism and recreation purposes. Mexico is one of the countries with the highest obesity rate among children, and Chiapas is one of the poorest states in Mexico, despite being as one of the most culturally and biological diverse.  We believe that climbing is an exciting sport for young people, that motivates them to get out of their house and off the street on the weekend, to do exercise in a sociable and adventurous setting.

____________________________________________________________________

¿Quienes somos? 

Somos un grupo de amigos que formamos parte del Grupo Escala Chiapas que fue fundado en el año 2000, con base en Tuxtla Gutiérrez y San Cristóbal de las Casas en el estado de Chiapas en el sureste de  México. Tenemos la misión de promover el montañismo y escalada en el estado de Chiapas, fomentar que los niños y adultos tenga más contacto con la naturaleza, y ayudar a incrementar el valor de las áreas naturales alrededor de ambas ciudades para fines de conservación, turismo y recreación.  México es uno de los países con mayor indice de obesidad infantil en el mundo y Chiapas es uno de los estados mas pobres de México, en contraste es uno de los estados con mas diversidad biológica y cultural. Creemos que la escalada es un deporte emocionante para jóvenes, puesto que es un deporte que fomenta salir a la naturaleza, evitar la ociosidad y hacer ejercicio, todo bajo un contexto social y de aventura.


About La Roca Climbing Gym

In 2013, we opened La Roca Climbing Gym in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, in order to increase the level of skill and interest of climbing in Chiapas, and encourage people to go out and climb on natural rock in the nature on the weekends. We have employed and trained local young people, and hope to be able to provide a long term stable employment opportunity as climbing instructors.   We have never received government funding and all the investment has come from our own pockets.   There was quite alot of interest in the gym and in the first year we received many visitors; in June 2014 we organised the first bouldering climbing championship in Chiapas where 25 youths from different towns in the state competed.  However the space we have rented was quite small and restricted to bouldering routes (not very high, more technical, which is not always accessible for everyone) and the rent was too expensive for us therefore we had to close in the summer of 2015. 

_____________________________________________________________________

 Acerca de la Roca, Sala de Escalada

En el año 2013, abrimos la Roca Sala de Escalada, con el fin de incrementar el nivel de desempeño y interés en escalada en Chiapas, fomentar que la gente salga a la naturaleza, que experimenten la escalada en roca natural en los fines de semana.  Hemos empleado y capacitado a jóvenes locales, y esperamos poder proveer oportunidades de empleo de largo plazo, como instructores de escalada.  Nunca hemos recibido recursos gubernamentales y toda la inversion ha salido de nuestras bolsas. En el primer año hubo bastante interes en el gimnasio  y recibimos muchos visitantes; en junio de 2014, organizamos el primer campeonato estatal de escalada en bloque en Chiapas en donde competieron  25 jóvenes de distintas ciudades del interior del estado. Sin embargo, el espacio que rentábamos era bastante pequeño y restringido, limitado únicamente a escalada en bloque (no muy alto, mas técnico, no es siempre accesible para todos) y la renta era demasiado cara para nosotros, por lo cual tuvimos que cerrar en el verano de 2015. 

What do we want to do? 

We have found two new spaces for the climbing gyms in Tuxtla Gutierrez and San Cristobal on friends' land, who will charge a much lower rent, and they have more potential to expand. We are prepared to build the climbing gym again from scratch, including a roof and floor. We will use everything we have learnt from La Roca to build the climbing gym ourselves, and we will implement a membership system that will financially support the climbing wall in the long run.  We hope to include a sport climbing section (using ropes), where we can also practice vertical techniques. We will provide extra services such as natural rock climbing outings , birthday parties, basic climbing courses and of course we will organize the Second Climbing Championship in Chiapas! 

¿Que queremos hacer? 

Hemos encontrado dos espacios nuevos para la sala de escalada, en Tuxtla Gutierrez y San Cristobal de las Casas en propiedades de amigos, que nos cobran una renta mucho mas baja y con mas espacio para crecer.  Estamos dispuestos a construir los muros de nuevo, incluyendo una torre techada. Utilizaremos toda la experiencia que hemos aprendido de la Roca para construir el muro nosotros, e implementaremos un sistema de membresias que apoyará a sostener al gimnasio a largo plazo. Esperamos incluir una sección de escalada deportiva (usando cuerdas) donde podemos practicar diversas técnicas verticales. Proveeremos servicios extra como salidas a la roca natural, fiestas de cumpleaños, cursos de escalada básicas y por supuesto organizaremos el segundo campeonato estatal de Escalada en Chiapas!  


  


What perks do we offer? 

For your generous donations we are offerering unique La Roca Sala de Escalada bumper stickers, Chiapas climbing guides, La Roca Sala de Escalada t-shirts, your name or logo on the  climbing wall, climbing wall memberships (if you live in Chiapas) or sponsor a low-income child's climbing wall membership!  For the more generous donations, we are offering a whole free day or weekend of guided climbing on the date of your choosing in one of our many climbing zones in Chiapas, one year and unlimited memberships and a trip to the unique and virgin la Venta Canyon! 

¿Cuales incentivos ofrecemos?

Para sus donaciones generosas estamos ofreciendo calcomanías de la Roca Sala de Escalada, Guias de Escalada en Chiapas, playeras de la Roca, tu nombre o logo en el muro de escalada, membresías para usar el muro (si vives en Chiapas) o patrocina una membresia de un niño de bajos recursos. Para las donaciones generosas, estamos ofreciendo un dia completo de escalada o un fin de semana en la fecha que escojas en una de las varias zonas de escalada en Chiapas, membresías de un año o ilimitados y un viaje al unico y virgen Cañón río la Venta!
story_txt:
Who are we We are a group of friends who are part of Grupo Escala, Chiapas, which was founded in 2000, based in Tuxtla Gutierrez and San Cristobal de las Casas in the south-eastern state of Chiapas in Mexico. We have a mission to promote mountaineering and climbing in the state of Chiapas, encouarge children and adults to have more contact with nature,  and help protect natural areas around both cities for tourism and recreation purposes. Mexico is one of the countries with the highest obesity rate among children, and Chiapas is one of the poorest states in Mexico, despite being as one of the most culturally and biological diverse.  We believe that climbing is an exciting sport for young people, that motivates them to get out of their house and off the street on the weekend, to do exercise in a sociable and adventurous setting.____________________________________________________________________¿Quienes somos? Somos un grupo de amigos que formamos parte del Grupo Escala Chiapas que fue fundado en el año 2000, con base en Tuxtla Gutiérrez y San Cristóbal de las Casas en el estado de Chiapas en el sureste de  México. Tenemos la misión de promover el montañismo y escalada en el estado de Chiapas, fomentar que los niños y adultos tenga más contacto con la naturaleza, y ayudar a incrementar el valor de las áreas naturales alrededor de ambas ciudades para fines de conservación, turismo y recreación.  México es uno de los países con mayor indice de obesidad infantil en el mundo y Chiapas es uno de los estados mas pobres de México, en contraste es uno de los estados con mas diversidad biológica y cultural. Creemos que la escalada es un deporte emocionante para jóvenes, puesto que es un deporte que fomenta salir a la naturaleza, evitar la ociosidad y hacer ejercicio, todo bajo un contexto social y de aventura.About La Roca Climbing GymIn 2013, we opened La Roca Climbing Gym in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, in order to increase the level of skill and interest of climbing in Chiapas, and encourage people to go out and climb on natural rock in the nature on the weekends. We have employed and trained local young people, and hope to be able to provide a long term stable employment opportunity as climbing instructors.   We have never received government funding and all the investment has come from our own pockets.   There was quite alot of interest in the gym and in the first year we received many visitors; in June 2014 we organised the first bouldering climbing championship in Chiapas where 25 youths from different towns in the state competed.  However the space we have rented was quite small and restricted to bouldering routes (not very high, more technical, which is not always accessible for everyone) and the rent was too expensive for us therefore we had to close in the summer of 2015. _____________________________________________________________________ Acerca de la Roca, Sala de EscaladaEn el año 2013, abrimos la Roca Sala de Escalada, con el fin de incrementar el nivel de desempeño y interés en escalada en Chiapas, fomentar que la gente salga a la naturaleza, que experimenten la escalada en roca natural en los fines de semana.  Hemos empleado y capacitado a jóvenes locales, y esperamos poder proveer oportunidades de empleo de largo plazo, como instructores de escalada.  Nunca hemos recibido recursos gubernamentales y toda la inversion ha salido de nuestras bolsas. En el primer año hubo bastante interes en el gimnasio  y recibimos muchos visitantes; en junio de 2014, organizamos el primer campeonato estatal de escalada en bloque en Chiapas en donde competieron  25 jóvenes de distintas ciudades del interior del estado. Sin embargo, el espacio que rentábamos era bastante pequeño y restringido, limitado únicamente a escalada en bloque (no muy alto, mas técnico, no es siempre accesible para todos) y la renta era demasiado cara para nosotros, por lo cual tuvimos que cerrar en el verano de 2015. What do we want to do? We have found two new spaces for the climbing gyms in Tuxtla Gutierrez and San Cristobal on friends' land, who will charge a much lower rent, and they have more potential to expand. We are prepared to build the climbing gym again from scratch, including a roof and floor. We will use everything we have learnt from La Roca to build the climbing gym ourselves, and we will implement a membership system that will financially support the climbing wall in the long run.  We hope to include a sport climbing section (using ropes), where we can also practice vertical techniques. We will provide extra services such as natural rock climbing outings , birthday parties, basic climbing courses and of course we will organize the Second Climbing Championship in Chiapas! ¿Que queremos hacer? Hemos encontrado dos espacios nuevos para la sala de escalada, en Tuxtla Gutierrez y San Cristobal de las Casas en propiedades de amigos, que nos cobran una renta mucho mas baja y con mas espacio para crecer.  Estamos dispuestos a construir los muros de nuevo, incluyendo una torre techada. Utilizaremos toda la experiencia que hemos aprendido de la Roca para construir el muro nosotros, e implementaremos un sistema de membresias que apoyará a sostener al gimnasio a largo plazo. Esperamos incluir una sección de escalada deportiva (usando cuerdas) donde podemos practicar diversas técnicas verticales. Proveeremos servicios extra como salidas a la roca natural, fiestas de cumpleaños, cursos de escalada básicas y por supuesto organizaremos el segundo campeonato estatal de Escalada en Chiapas!    
What perks do we offer? 
For your generous donations we are offerering unique La Roca Sala de Escalada bumper stickers, Chiapas climbing guides, La Roca Sala de Escalada t-shirts, your name or logo on the  climbing wall, climbing wall memberships (if you live in Chiapas) or sponsor a low-income child's climbing wall membership!  For the more generous donations, we are offering a whole free day or weekend of guided climbing on the date of your choosing in one of our many climbing zones in Chiapas, one year and unlimited memberships and a trip to the unique and virgin la Venta Canyon! ¿Cuales incentivos ofrecemos?Para sus donaciones generosas estamos ofreciendo calcomanías de la Roca Sala de Escalada, Guias de Escalada en Chiapas, playeras de la Roca, tu nombre o logo en el muro de escalada, membresías para usar el muro (si vives en Chiapas) o patrocina una membresia de un niño de bajos recursos. Para las donaciones generosas, estamos ofreciendo un dia completo de escalada o un fin de semana en la fecha que escojas en una de las varias zonas de escalada en Chiapas, membresías de un año o ilimitados y un viaje al unico y virgen Cañón río la Venta!

story:
Come Grow with Us!

Come grow with us! Be part of our dream; the magic & love of chocolate made by hand in small batches.

We are Mike & Emily, the owners and creators of Lune Chocolat: Syracuse's only natural, artisan, handmade chocolatier. We have been in business since September 2011.Together we make most of the pieces that go out our door. We are dedicated to furthering its growth and success.

We take great pride in running a business where the staff and patrons feel at home and happy. Mike received his MBAin 2010 from Syracuse University and Emily is an artist by trade, who learned the art of chocolate at the Culinary Institute at Hyde Park. Lune Chocolat employs 5-8 workers (scheduling varies based on their college and school commitments) who we love like family.

Our goal has always been to work together. Our daily business and wholesale accounts both continue to grow, and for this we are thankful. This is what has brought us to the decision to run this campaign. We have outgrown our current space of 480 square feet. When you have three employees working in the kitchen, while the do-Si-do's we do are bountiful and elegant, we need more space to be more productive. This campaign will help us achieve our goal to move to a building we can (hopefully) own and allow us to work together full time.

**************************************************

What We Need & What You Get:

We are hoping to raise $25,000 in this campaign.

Money raised through this campaign will go toward new equipment, which will also allow us to bring you, our customer, NEW creations! One of those products is popsicles. For this, we will need molds and a blast freezer. Easy as pie...and then we will knock it out of the ball park with flavors...something like watermelon-basil-mango or strawberry balsamic- coconut. And don't forget chocolate popsicles! We would also like to apply part of the funds to professional fees we have incurred. It has been a long road to get to this spot. Part of what we raise will also go towards being closed for a few days while we move all the equipment and product to our new location. (Being closed. That will be super weird!)

In appreciation of your support, there will be chocolate! We will also have wine & spirits gift cards, t-shirts, hats, pens, and magnets. As well as some other very fun perks, from local spas, farmers and chefs (we will announce something new every time we reach a goal of our fundraising)..

We hope that you will join us in this journey; it’s bound to be full of adventure for all of us.

*********************************************************

The Impact:

We draw people to Manlius from all over. Our chocolate has been shipped worldwide, to Sweden, France, England, and it has traveled to The Galapagos. We have regular customers from Toronto, Schenectady, Boston, and Connecticut. We also draw people from various cities close by, Oswego, Binghamton, Bernhards Bay, and more. These people come back, the love visiting and seeing the new creations. They are excited for our growth.

This campaign is to raise money for equipment which will create new products which will bring in new customers. It will also help cover the professional fees we have from the process of purchasing a commercial property. These things include: architectural drawings, permits, signage, lawyer fees, construction costs, and hopefully some direct mail advertising to announce the opening. It will also let us breathe a little easier on those few days we have to move equipment and be closed.

**************************************************************

Risks & Challenges

We have faced obstacles along this path of growth. Originally, we were looking at another property and we struggled to get the zoning changed. This was a process of loss of time and money because in the end we had to let it go. We are not quitters. Once we let it go, we picked ourselves up and found the property we are now working on. We have started construction. We are so close.

It's so surreal, but it's so exciting. And then sometimes, it’s very scary.

We want to keep moving, to keep growing, and to keep getting things done. A recent quote I heard, "Sometimes when life doesn't seem fair and you know everything you put into it is way more than you will ever get back, just remember this, no matter how hopeless it may seem, you are still way ahead of everyone who never tried at all."(C.Clark2015) We never stop trying. That way we never stop learning.

********************************************

Other Ways You Can Help

There are all kinds of ways to help! Share this on your Facebook and Twitter pages. Send it out in your email. Show people in line while you are waiting at the grocery store. Shout it from your roof top, okay maybe not that one.

Thank you all, for your consideration and support!

***********************************************

story:
Welcome! We are the Ladies First Charity Team: Maria, Georgette, Pianca, Zulay, Yosely and Yomaris.

This is our third year coming together for our Ladies First event, which we created to raise funds to end domestic violence against women. We encourage our network of friends, family, peer professionals, brands and companies to unite and give back to help. Our annual event kicks off in March in celebration of Women's History Month.

Humbled by last year's event, we were able to raise over $2,000 from donations, event admission and raffle sales. Over 200 people were in attendance, which made the fundraiser a great success, thanks to a generous support system. 

This year, we're even more inspired and ready to work towards a new goal of $4,000!

Your online donation is 100% tax deductible! We GIVE 100% of the online and event proceeds to the Northern Manhattan Improvement Corporation (NMIC), the non-for-profit organization of record. To learn more about the Domestic Violence Project we support, please visit: http://www.nmic.org/domesticviolence.html

On March 26, 2015, we will hold our annual Ladies First event at Apt 78 in New York City. This event is the cornerstone of our program and brings the community together to raise money for domestic violence survivors.

Your Donation Will Help:

- To expand the Ladies First Emergency & Transportation Fund for women who need immediate financial assistance after leaving their abuser.

- To continue to sponsor NMIC’s Annual Mother’s Day event for the participants of the Domestic Violence Project.

- To continue to offer the “Ladies First Empowerment Package” to survivors, which is a year-round job-readiness beauty makeover resource. The program is to help domestic violence participants who are actively seeking jobs and in need of a confidence boost to their self esteem. Special thanks to our sponsoring local businesses for making it possible: Nail Lounge, Cascada Dental and Bodre Hair Studio.

- To inspire the community to give back to platforms that continue to keep the domestic violence conversation going and offer healing solutions towards ending violence against women.

Why Northern Manhattan Improvement Corporation?
According to New York Police Department crime statistics, Washington Heights and Inwood area has one of the highest numbers of reported incidents of domestic violence in New York City, with fully one-half of all reported incidents occurring in upper Manhattan. High levels of poverty, unemployment, new immigrants and inadequate housing affect the problem by limiting victims' options for escape and access to services.

If you have any other questions about the Ladies First Charity Fund or if you want to offer press coverage, volunteer or become an event or product sponsor, please send your inquiry or request to ladiesfirstcharityfunds@gmail.com. 

We appreciate your support. Thank you!

- Ladies First

story: Hi, my name is Preston, I am a young automotive technician, that is ASE certified. It has been my dream to help out other people with their vehciles of the less fortunate.I means people still need to get from point A to point B. I created this fund, because I want to build a small auto repair business for a fair price, and get the same quality of workmanship as you would get from the dealer, as well as restoring timeless classics of the 1950s-1970s. With that being said, I need to build a shop to perform repairs, I recently learned that to build and develop a LLC, the amount of capital needed is high. All funds will go towards the legal licensing, insurance, equipment, permits, and building materials and other misc. costs to get my company off the ground.

story:
Hello,
   My Wife and I Own a 1988 Seagrave Pumper Fire Truck that we wish to        re-purpose into a Mobil Wood Fired pizza business called "Wild Fire Pizza"
  The plan consist of removing The pump and 1000 gallon tank out of the truck and installing the oven @ mid ship with the large existing tank area becoming a full enclosed kitchen with a service window on the right side. The left side we want to keep the fire truck integrity as much as possible to be a real eye catcher with all the knobs, and gauges etc. plus a future photo booth in the existing jump seat behind the cab to entertain kids and adults alike,  also keeping the operational deck gun above with a mister for parties in warmer months.
  We live in a Colorado area  that relies mostly on the year round tourist industry in the small town of Woodland Park ( The City above the Clouds) on the main highway leading to the ski resorts and all the Numerous Mountain activities just outside Colorado Springs.


  We are looking for your Help and/or support in funding our new venture..............
  We currently have a experienced Pizza truck builder  lined up @ $80/hr + $9,950 +/- for one of the best wood fired ovens available......................    A Mugnaini Wood Fired  Oven Model 120  imported from Italy

We have many excellent venues already lined up and waiting including local Breweries, Charity events, Business Lunches, private parties and many public events in our area, The possibilities are Endless!............

  What we need besides the oven to get it rolling are all the basics for a commercial kitchen to satisfy the Board of health requirements, Including...................

Mugnaini Wood Fired  Oven Model 120 = $12,000 +est.
  Insurance coverage =  $2000 est.
 Pizza Prep table w refrigeration. = $1500++ est.
 Triple sink = $500 est.
  Single hand washing sink. = $100
  Misc. stainless steel (shelves & serving counter etc.) = > $2500 est.
  Serving window with full Awning = $1000 est.
  Aluminum dome type Roof built with a Rear entry door. = Cost Tbd

  On-demand hot water heater & Plumbing = $500 est.
  100 gallon fresh water tank = $100 est.
  120 gallon waste water tank = $100 est.
  Misc Led lights and electrical wiring = $300 est.
  diesel 10 kw generator = > $10,000
   We know of only a handful of other Fire truck food trucks in the country and they are all doing well and enjoy sharing their Ideas, Tips and experiences with us
  This is a very exciting project that we would Love for you to be a part of in making it a reality,  I've always loved cooking for people my whole life and especially enjoy the happy faces when someone bites into a real wood fired Pizza!
Updates will be posted on are regular basis!

Who doesn't love a Fire Truck!

PLEASE SHARE WITH ALL YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY............

Please help if you can with even a small donation!
Thank you for looking and/or your kind and Generous support! 

Thanks Again From the bottom of our Hearts,

Fred and Stephanie Urban and The WILDFIRE PIZZA COMPANY Team

other ways you can help 

You may think "This is something great but I am unable to contribute." If that's the case, Please Share this campaign with All your Friends and help spread the word!
