story:
Why are we doing this?

As Zane Lamprey said it in one of his Chug episodes, "craft beer is all about bringing people together that share a common interest."  

We used to go to the typical bars, but about 2 years ago we discovered craft beer. We started going to this little place called The Garden Café on Broadway in downtown Grove City.  We felt welcome right away and knew this was a different kind of place, not the typical bar crowd. It felt a little more sophisticated and we started meeting new people right away. The owners at the time, Will Roberts and Carol Alberts were amazing!  They made the place extremely successful and made everyone feel at home.  

Unfortunately, that little café was sold and since then things have not been the same. The entire community misses the fun little craft beer bar, the place where life long friendships begin!    So,,,,we bought the bar!

We hope to bring the locals back to the place where it all started. We hope that people will enjoy a pint, take home a growler, or just hang out for a while. 

We would also like to celebrate veterans more than one day a year since the partnership includes a 7 year U.S. Marine veteran and a 4 year U.S. Army veteran!   

How you can help “Hop Yard 62”

Before I tell you how you can help, I’d like to share with you how we came up with the name. 

“Hops — one of the key ingredients in craft beers — was grown in Ohio until the early 1900s, until pressure from disease and insects caused farmers to give up growing the crop.  Today, an estimated $4 million worth of hops are imported into Ohio.  But thanks to a two-year specialty crop grant from the U.S. Department of Agriculture and Ohio Department of Agriculture, as well as interest by growers across the state, there is faith the crop can be revived.  As a result, a Hop Yard Plot is being tested in Wooster, OH.  The Hop Yard Plot features a quarter-acre setup designed to research about 10 varieties of hops.”  62 is a reference to the state route that runs in front of the current location.

We would like to lease the building where the former café was housed.  We need to remove all the coffee and food handling equipment, paint the dark walls a lighter color, put in new flooring, add additional tap handles and a kegerator, install booth seating, do some electrical work and buy some used bar stools.  We also need to purchase a merchandiser, renew the liquor license, obtain business insurance, buy a POS system and pay rent and utilities.  Wow, there is so much to starting a new business!

We estimate the total costs for the above purchases/renovations to be between $7k - $9k.  We plan to do as much of the work ourselves as possible. 

For helping us out, you will receive some awesome rewards.  The reward(s) you receive depend on how much you pledge - you can find details on the right side of this page.  We will also add the names of all donors who donate $250 to a "Thank You" plaque that will be built into the bar (unless you wish to remain anonymous).

This would be a real dream come true for us – we hope you can help out!

The Impact

We have so many things planned to bring the community back together from monthly "Hips and Hops" sessions to teach women about craft beer to Trivia Night.

Risks & Challenges

We do have challenges.  We will have to find a way to be successful while also working full time jobs.  As former veterans, we are up to the challenge!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out!  Don't forget to use the indiegogo share tools!

story:
Join chef Jon Young and his wife Melissa as they convert the iconic , 1950's KOB TV 4 news vehicle into a unique, mobile restaurant called "Fresh." The dine-in restaurant will feature a gourmet menu with fresh, seasonal ingredients presented in an on-board dining coach inspired by the Orient Express. Fresh supports local growers and the "farm to table" concept.

Back Story:

Chef Jon Young followed a listing for the sale of a 1955 Twin Motor Coach and found the antiquated vehicle resting comfortably in a field near Socorro, New Mexico. The bus was originally commissioned as the mobile news vehicle for the NBC news affiliate KOB TV-4.

 His vision was to convert the bus into a movable feast. This is not a food truck, but a mobile, gourmet restaurant with amazing ambiance and the  unique ability to go wherever the "occasion" calls. In addition to being a mobile restaurant, we want to educate the community about where their food comes from and how to prepare good food no matter what constraints are in their life. Our produce will be locally sourced from ARCA Organics, who employs disabled teens and adults. We will also be teaming up with local charities in the state to help teen parents, families with dietary restrictions, and others in need to learn to cook healthy, nutritious food on a budget. With an Internet blog of recipes, how-to tips, and a mobile bistro to bring classes to those in need, we want to change the face of how New Mexicans of all walks of life, view their food choices. Everyone can make a difference in the lives of others.

 Imagine yourself purchasing your favorite meal. Now look closer at all the people in your community who contributed to it’s creation. These aren’t random strangers. They are the people who take pride in creating locally grown, organic food for your meal. The simplest choice of the food you consume can change the world. And we intend to be a part of that.

Jon and Melissa are seeking $17,500 in donations for this project and will be hosting a celebration gala for all contributors and sponsors. The money that we receive will be purchasing the fabric and labor for the reupholstering of the booths. Material and installation of new stainless steel walls in the kitchen. Purchase and installation of generator, water storage tanks, hot water heater, a/c unit, furnace, embossed tin for ceiling, electrical receptacles and light fixtures.  Visit our website www.supportfreshabq.com  for sponsorship details and check out the PERKS on Indiegogo to see how you can become a contributor to our project.

story:
Hi everyone!

It’s been a really busy few weeks for us!  We have successfully:

  • Launched whynotpeople.com
  • Opened our membership application forms (the more people to register, the more we can understand how we can enhance the experience at the events for each member and their friends)
  • Confirmed that Coldplay, Ed Sheeran, Mark Ronson, Tinie Tempah and James Blake will all being doing a Why Not People gig in 2015/16!

Below is a summary for the Press we received surrounding the launch:

Thank you all so much for your support in spreading the word about Why Not People and what we are trying to achieve.

We are busy working away behind the scenes.  We need your help to do 3 big things:

  1. Announce and produce our first event which is in May at the Indigo 02
  2. Launch our membership area on March 16thand tickets being on sale to members
  3. Secure partnerships with the right brands, technologies and charities to grow the Why Not People members’ area to include more services, events, club nights etc…

And THIS is why we really need your help.  We have managed to do all the above with a lot of favours and people who are passionate about our cause – but raising this money will seriously impact how quickly we are able to achieve the above.

We've got 8 days left… please please help us make as much noise as possible and spread the word!

No more will people with disabilities be cordoned off to the side at gigs, or have to book your tickets through a separate phone line!  We have got some of the world’s biggest music artists signed up to all do a Why Not People gig in the next 2 years!

If you want any more information about Why Not People or want to register – please visit Whynotpeople.com

Don’t forget – we want to make sure all you wonderful people are rewarded for all the support! So please check down the right hand side of the page for rewards.  If you don’t like something, or would like to talk about another reward – tell us and we will see what we can do!

Thank you all so much!  This really is going to be a phenomenal year and we can't wait to experience it with all of you :)

Big Hugs and kisses,

Jam, Divya and Charlie

xxx

story:
What is GreenLight Health?

We are a team of Scientific Researchers, Doctors, Pharmacists and Nutritionists.

We are a healthcare company and our first product is a cannabis medicine for people who have Arthritis.

With your help and contributions we can bring our first product to clinical trial.


Our Campaign And Why It’s Important To Us

Currently, any patient who uses cannabis to relieve medical conditions faces criminalisation, a €2,750 fine and up to 12 months in prison for a second offense.

We believe that now is the time to advance cannabis medicines and make them more widely accepted and available in Ireland and across the globe.

With your help, we can make cannabis medicines available to the people who need it most.

story:
Short Summary

I am an entrepreneur who has a passion for cooking since I was 9 years old. I posess a masters in business administration which has afforded me the opportunity to successfully run a cupcake business for the past 6 years. After graduating from culinary school I expanded my business model to include full service catering. After spending several years perfecting recipes and catering small events up to 200 guests it is time to move out of the small space we have outgrown. We are excited about the opportunity to share Our Passion and Family recipes with the World. We strive to use nothing but Certified Organic Products and we are working to become a Green Business.

What We Need & What You Get

Our Goals: We have located a Catering Kitchen that is turnkey ready and available today. The facility is a couple of miles away from the local Culinary College. Our goal is to partner with the school and hire some of the students within our first 30-days. 

Our objective is to be a profitable business with projected growth of 3% ROI within the first year and an increased rate of 4-6% each year over the next five years. We expect to reach this growth by being a leader in the market offering fresh organic made from scratch products using all natural ingredients. We will use products from local Vendors and Merchants. Today there are more than 15% of all humans that suffer from Celiac Disease or Wheat Allergies. Our Gluten-Free line of cupcakes has been specifically formulated to meet the needs of those with special dietary needs.

Budget & Expenses: We have invested $48,000 into the infrastructure what we need now is for You to get on board with our Campaign. Our Timeline: $21,000 in 30-days! 

As a contributor we have some Special Campaign Perks just for You. You can be apart of the next Big Thing! Impacting an entrepreneurs life. You get the honor of saying I was instrumental in helping an entrepreneur succeed. I promise to keep you updated and acknowledge you personally as we reach our goal. When we reach the halfway point you will be invited to an exclusive private tasting featuring a special menu crested just for you. Finally when we do exceed our goal you will be invited to a press event where we can meet and I will thank you in person. Get on board today! 

The Impact

There are so many Children and People that would love to have the gift of cooking and baking. We have been blessed with both gifts. We will continue to Share our knowledge and expertise with up and coming entrepreneurs while expanding upon our cooking classes and cooking demonstrations. We will partner with local businesses to offer scholarships to students and needy families to be apart of our cooking classes and adventures at little to no cost. 

Risks & Challenges

With any new project comes risks and challenges. We have been preparing the risks over the past six years. There is the challenge of entering into an existing market with well established competitors. In general, the competition has average profit margins, but their market strength is greater than Upscales Catering. They have established excellent credibility in the marketplace. This group of competitors will present a considerable challenge to Upscales Catering.  We have spent the past six years preparing for this challenge and we are prepared to aggressively take it on. We have increased our marketing budget which will help us have a more visible presence in the industry. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that all of you are not able to contribute financially. However, that doesn't mean that you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out at work, in your community, at church, while playing golf. You get the idea help us spread the word together!
  • Please, please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out!

story:
PLEASE DONATE USING THIS LINK:

                             https://www.justgiving.com/Laya-Zenonos/

                         AS OUR INDIEGOGO PAGE HAS NOW EXPIRED!       


INFO: Our indiegogo campaign was running for 60 days. That has expired now but we shall continue to fundraise for Laya's 'Dragony' through her              personal website www.helpinglaya.org & her just giving page.

                Many thanks for your interest in supporting our little girl!

                  

                                          We are aiming to raise £25,000

                                                     Can you help Laya?

Our precious daughter Laya was diagnosed with Spinal Muscular Atrophy Type 1 (SMA 1) when she was just 8 months old. Laya is now nearly 5. SMA1 is a life limiting condition without a cure. Laya cannot walk, crawl or even sit by herself. She has very poor head control and she has extremely weak muscles. For instance a small apple is too heavy for her to hold. Although profoundly disabled, Laya’s brain is completely unaffected by her condition, she is very bright, loves to sing, read, tell stories and chat!

A year ago, her current wheelchair, Wizzy Bug, gave Laya her first taste of independence. For the first time she didn’t need to be pushed or carried, she was able to move in a direction that she chose, where and when she wanted to.  We will never forget her smile on that day, it’s a memory we will always treasure. She has now outgrown Wizzy, which is a pre-school wheelchair for toddlers.

Laya is very special as there are only a small handful of children around the world with SMA1 who have survived passed the age of two.  Because Laya is a bit of an anomaly she doesn't quite fit into any specific category and so we have struggled greatly to get any charity or government funding for a powered wheelchair that will give Laya this level of independence. This is why we have decided to fundraise ourselves.  The cost is out of our reach.

We really believe that with the right support (and a lot of love❤) Laya will continue to thrive and love life.  This is why we desperately want to raise the money to buy her a Snap Dragon wheelchair, it will completely open up her world and enable her to keep her independence. You only need to watch Laya's video to realise how much she wants and needs this wheelchair (link at top of the page).

With your help we might be able to give Laya what she needs!

Please check out this link http://m.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-28044341

If you can help Laya and also spread the word we would be very grateful!

Antony & Lucia (dad & mum)

p.s  For any iPad users - if the above video didn't work, try using this link https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KHVKvXWhYb4

story:
I AM A HUGE BELIEVER IN PREVENTIVE HEALTH TO CARRY US THROUGH THE EXTENDED LIFESPAN (hence, do not use disposable chopsticks as either the bleach or the mold will leach into food) AS WELL AS IN SAVING OVER 25 MILLION TREES BEING CUT DOWN YEARLY IN CHINA FOR DISPOSABLE CHOPSTICKS with landfill space (to bury them) disappearing. China and Japan use 70 BILLION disposable chopsticks each year!!

I am a friend of Greg Resnick who is the founder and CEO of Future Sticks and want to help him raise funds for expanding manufacturing of portable-size Future Sticks which come in a smart small case that will fit right into a breast pocket, briefcase, or purse. They can be used at home, taken to restaurants, or accompany anyone when travelling.

[Please see our unique "NOTE" at bottom of this 'Story' regarding adjusting Perks in order to accommodate a supporter, gifting Perks, and also INSCRIBING BOXES WITH YOUR NAME]

How can a chopstick fit into a small case? Easily when it is Future Sticks portables! Each stick separates in the middle, so there are four sections in each case. When in use, one clicks the top section into the bottom, and there is Future Sticks!! (please do view the video, or see the 'campaign card image' in the Basics section)

The special plastic that is used and the manufacturing process produce a smooth finish. The 'teeth' have no sharp edges or points, yet it is those 'teeth' which provide the extraordinary gripping power.

Future Sticks will be crystal (in color) which is so elegant. Additionally, they can also be a handsome red, golden, or other colors. 

The case provides both a front or an inside cover which can also be used for a logo, a name, or business advertising.

Greg married into a Chinese family. His wife and mother-in-law suffer from arthritis, and suddenly he got the idea to put 'teeth' onto traditional chopsticks. This reduces the pressure needed to pick up food either by healthy folks or by those with hand tremors (such as Parkinson's Disease) or stiffness. There are portable sticks, and in the future there will be children's size, adult size, and serving size.

Yes, Future Sticks needs to raise capital in order for the whole company to go global. This means being able to manufacture all four sizes of Future Sticks: portable, adult, child, and serving. In having an Indiegogo Campaign, we seek to raise funds in stages for each size Future Sticks.

They are made from a safe, nearly indestructible plastic which can be washed in the dishwasher.

Future Sticks will capture one's attention because it is the kind of business that has an incredible future and can benefit the world by saving health and trees! Greg is already manufacturing the portables; however, money is needed in order to expand production (including colors) and go global. This will be the basis for producing the next groups of Future Sticks: for children, adults, and serving.

Also vitally important to health concerns is eliminating the ingestion of bleach which leaches into food from the white  (bleached) chopsticks and eliminating the mold which leaches into food from the grey or beige sticks.

The Web site is www.futuresticks.com, and they are patented in the United States and China. I am Carole Lynn Steiner and am the published author (by a division of Penguin Random House) of the health and lifestyle book "MYBYBLE ... For The Extended Lifespan" www.mybyble.com which also details my great interest in the health benefit imparted worldwide to every person who uses Future Sticks.

Future Sticks are made in America! As the company grows, more and more jobs will be provided. Used personally or given as a gift, they make a permanent impact on both those who use them as well as for everyone else as we save trees and eliminate the need for landfills for the disposable refuse.

NOTE: There are specific PERKS for acquiring boxes of Future Sticks where we want to do something special and lasting for you. Those boxes can be PERSONALIZED and inscribed on the inside of the front cover with: THANK YOU "your name (or that of someone else)" FOR YOUR SUPPORT. The inscription can also be JUST with your name (and no other words) or with the name of the person to whom you are gifting this Perk. We will need your email in order to confirm the inscription. There is also the outside of the cover which has the Future Sticks name and logo, but should you want your name there, we can do that instead. WE WANT TO HONOR YOU WITH THIS LIFETIME PLEASURE as you use or gift your Future Sticks.

We encourage folks to POOL funds and SHARE A PERK when one finds that doing a favorite PERK individually is not possible. Decide amongst yourselves how to share the PERK. Also, PERKS may be fulfilled sooner than the estimated date where possible. Please do consider giving some PERKS as gifts! What fun, and how unique.

Yes, if you select a Perk that includes an in-person visit with the CEO or the author and then you find that you cannot travel to Texas or New York, we can adjust the Perk and convert the travel to, for example, telephone conversation.

For any supporter at any level: Should you find yourself in Dallas or New York City anytime in the future, if you would enjoy meeting with the CEO of Future Sticks or the author of "MYBYBLE", it will be our pleasure to make every effort to accommodate and welcome you.

FOR THAT SPECIAL INDIVIDUAL WHO SEES THE VAST POTENTIAL OF FUTURE STICKS AND WANTS TO SUPPORT AT OVER $1,000, WE CAN CREATE A UNIQUE PERK JUST FOR YOU! EMAIL Greg Resnick at gresnick@futuresticks.com or CALL Investor Relations at 817 400-8737 IN ORDER TO DISCUSS DETAILS OF THAT  PERK!!!

story:
We started this film festival with nothing- and were quite proud with what we created.  In this day and age, all people have to do is threaten to sue, and they get whatever they want. We think that's wrong.

We were advised to file a Civil Harassment Restraining Order. We did, and the Judge (Mary Thornton House) decreed that we must give nearly $8000 for 17 hours worth of work. Now, someone has put a levy on our Festival bank account, we assume in an attempt to destroy the festival. Little do they know of the support that we have in this community... In our community of Pasadena, our community of filmmakers, and our community of festival directors… Please don't let them get away with this. We, as a community, deserve so much more. Please don't allow this to set a precedent. If it happened to us, it can happen to you. If everyone just gives $10, we can show lawyers and bullies that they cannot, and will not, be able to push us around. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

story:
Green Frog Fragrances began over 4 years ago from my home doing markets and festivals while still working full time.  After 2 years I was ready to take the next step and resigned from my full time job as General Manager of an international company to pursue my passion.  After another twelve months it was time for the next big step and move into a production/retail space and out of my home and kitchen where I had been making all the candles and wax melts.


I am passionate about educating people on good quality candles and soy wax.  I do this by writing blogs, making videos, speaking to customers in my store and now running candle making classes.  I want to spread this knowledge further by having my products in more stores not just in Australia but worldwide.  Our new packaging will tell our story and show the benefits of our ingredients on them.

So where did the business name come from? Living in country Queensland, Australia, green frogs are normal to have in your toilet or even in your boots if you don't turn them upside down.  So when deciding on a name for my business I chose Green Frog Fragrances. 

In the beginning I wanted to make the soy wax melts in the shape of frogs but the molds were quite expensive so I put that idea on the back burner but never forgot about it.  One day I was talking to a customer who was taking the candle making class and he said he had an idea how I could make the molds myself.  This started a process off and now I have made a few molds with 2 sizes of frogs to suit our existing product line of small wax chips for small oil burners and larger wax melts for bigger oil burners.



Black Raspberry Soy Wax Melts - the very first wax melts made!


We already have nearly 50 stores around Australia selling our products and we want to expand into more stores.  To do this we require new packaging including bar codes for all products.  With 35 fragrances in our full range and 4 sizes of candles and 2 sizes of melts there is a lot required to revamp our packaging.  I want to take my products internationally and to do this we need quality packaging.  I have done a lot of research and found the perfect packaging for our new frog melts which will keep them safe but attractive to sell on shelves in any store.

With your help I will be able to reach more people to educate them on the benefits of 100% soy wax and what they are breathing in when burning cheaper candles. So many candles on the market don't list their ingredients which is concerning that you don't know what it is made of.  A lot of cheaper candles are made with paraffin wax which is made from petroleum.  This is not good for the environment or our health.  Soy wax is made from soya beans and I only use the best quality that is not genetically modified and made specifically for use in candles. 

I am conscious even more so these days on what I am breathing in as well as consuming. 

With this in mind I want to be able to educate customers even if I’m not there.  By having this information on the packaging it doesn’t matter where in the world it is sold the customer can read about the benefits of soy wax, cotton paper wicks and body safe fragrance oil – all components of my candles and melts.

I am also aware that our current labels are not easy to read in the smaller sizes and these need to be redesigned with the new design of boxes for the candles.

I have broken down our budget
New candle label design $3000
New candle packaging & printing $7400
Packaging for frog melts $5000
Barcodes $600

There are other items I make that require new packaging so if we raise more money than we have asked for will allocate it to that.  First priority will be our soaps, all handmade here as well.

The Frog Wax Melts are getting out and about.

Frogs checking out a drainpipe.  No real frogs around that day.

The Frog Wax Melts have made the local paper with this article in the North West News just this week.

story:
Living Large by Building Small: Waking Up to Leading Edge Trends in Housing and Community.

Why Size Matters: Designing small spaces that feel big
Versatile and flexible relies on spaces that can be repurposed for multiple uses that change with daily/seasonal needs more than squeezing use out of every square inch of space. We will explore the design elements of dynamic spaces that feature both tall and compact volumes, including design compact kitchens, bath rooms, bed rooms and the the use of basements that provide the true use of space with a wide open basement floor plan and very usable friendly home.  

Beyond the Boomer Housing Boom: How and Why Demographics are Shifting the Market.   I believe that smaller, affordable, and cutting edge designs by using and reusing materials will make for great STARTER HOMES.  the niche market are Single, Renters, one to two Child Families.  From accessible, accessory dwelling units to walk-able, urban neighborhoods,
The unprecedented aging of our population is one trend that is shaping our housing stock. The Baby Boom generation has been driving change throughout their lives and is now seeking new housing models to meet their needs.  Meanwhile, a younger generation is seeking out housing forms that aren't as different as you might expect   Boomers and Generation Y and Millennials are reshaping the traditional concept of suburban single family living and ready to break from cookie cutter housing.   This trend is a growing market and I believe i see the future of starter homes and retirement homes for active and assisted living.

Emerging Trends: Opportunities for small-scale urban development
Your glimpse into the current market for small single family homes, including cluster style development of small homes with shared common Parks and Recreation with central meeting, party, hosting lodge area that would include BBQ, Swimming, Tennis, basketball, baseball, football or combined sports event park available to all area housing owners and their family. 

 Who are the buyers, where are the looking, and what is their lifestyle?  We will outline supply vs. demand issues and other housing trends based on direct market experience designing, building and selling smaller homes.  If you look at what you do in your current home or rental apartment.  We will be offering a small home that with your NO INTEREST loan and programs to help pay for your dwelling you will be in the black and earning principal just after a year.

Micro to Small Homes are structures that are often smaller than 1000 square feet and have captured the attention of mainstream media and the hearts of thousands of Americans. They may be portable or fixed-in-place and may stand-alone or may be tethered to a “normal” house for utilities. These small buildings are used as backyard studios, extra bedrooms, guest suites or full-time residences mostly in very large homes that use them for rentals, the help, guests, and just about anything. Tiny House advocates explain that these small simple structures provide a flexible, affordable, reasonable (albeit small) solution for residential use, urban infill, and pocket communities. MY Nonprofit" That will be created from the funds from this site and me pounding the pavement " and Construction Company will present information to experience designing, building, and living in micro and small-houses with a focus on the unique benefits and challenges of taking small to the extreme Living comfortable and affordable. ESPECIALLY AFFORDABLE!!

I CAN 100% guarantee that anyone that pays rent for a 800 -1000 sq/ft apartment paying $500 to $800 per month will use this deal to have what they want and when they want to sell will have the money to buy or put down a fantastic down payment with our transfer/ transition/ upgrade/ or by out system that will be put into place threw my organization.  Homes for Independence.

I am retired military and have been in the construction business since i was very young.   while i was deployed many times while i was in the military.  I seen and was involved in creating cutting edge and shelter for my troops and myself.  On many occasions i used a simple connex  to live in with another person up to four people and we lived comfortable within our space.  Now that I am Retired and in construction seeing so many people living a hard life, renting owning nothing, giving up their money making payments for other people and not having something for themselves.

HOW IT WILL WORK:

I will use this money to start and finance a non-profit organization that will purchase properties, land, or distressed developments.  

the properties will be held or deeded to the non profit that will by contract use ESP Construction and Maintenance to build and maintain the homes built and purchased.

The homes will be sold for the final price of construction " Materials, Labor, Permits, Fees, and all monies used for the final project completion.  If the customer ever wants to sell it will be purchased at the price it was sold for.  No home appreciation or depreciation all homes will be sold and bought by the non-profit no sale of home outside the non-profit.  This will be contractual.  The reason for this is that the payments or mortgage will be to the non-profit so that other homes can be built.

Homes will be maintained and kept in tip top shape threw ESP Maintenance to make sure that all homes will be properly maintained.  All cost associated to repairs, additions, upkeep, and home upkeep will be kept at a minimal cost to home owner and will even have the option of adding cost to cost of home or threw additional addition to finance charge of home, again at no interest.  

I truly belive this will be the future for home financing and purchase and will keep more money in the home owners pocket allowing for a better life.

The home owner will be charged as per following example:

price of monies spent to build home + flat fee (never more that 10% cost of building home) = final cost.   you take the final cost divide it by months buyer want to finance home.  NOTE: no principal pay back for 1year.

POSSIBLE example:  1000 sq/ft home

$60,000 home build cost + $6,000 Fee = $66,000 TOTAL PRICE without possible tax and Insurance,  "call your insurance company and ask how much per year cost of insurance for 1000 sq/ft home)

FINALLY;

$66,000 cost of home divided by number of months, 

$66,000/ 120months = $550p/m.  $66,000/ 240 months=$275 p/m  so you can see very affordable we will offer up to 360 months.  remember this is %free in house finance your job and rental history is more imp[ortant than credit.

*** note*** no home can be purchased for rental property, "" THE HOME OWNER MUST LIVE IN HOME,  If found out that property is being rented you will be paid your principal amount and home will be taken back by organization and offered to future home owner to start their future investment.

First year NO EQUITY,  second year 1%, third year 2%,  3rd year 5%, 5th year, 25%, 6-10 th year 50% of equity pmts or purchased 90%, 10 - 15 years 75% of equity pmts or 90% of purchased price.

  At no time will the home be sold outside of the organization,  This will keep the price of the home the same from one owner to another,  As you can see it is almost like a bank account you get your money or percentage of your money back at any time you want to sell your home, or monies paid can be transferred to another home within the organization.  

The goal is to build a number of homes as starter homes and other homes that would be larger to accommodate existing owners that want to upgrade to a larger home and loosing none of their principal payments  we would just add the difference of price for new built home to current loan.  I know that with the monies i am asking for that i can build over 40 homes and with the payments from those homes i can build one home per month,  once we get to 150 homes it should allow for building 1 home every three weeks, 200 homes will allow building 1 home every week and so on, After building 500 homes the organization will be self reliant.  I figure it will take two and a half years to get to this point. I hope you help,  If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

David Espinoza

future home owner to start their future investment.First year NO EQUITY,  second year 1%, third year 2%,  3rd year 5%, 5th year, 25%, 6-10 th year 50% of equity pmts or purchased 90%, 10 - 15 years 75% of equity pmts or 90% of purchased price.  At no time will the home be sold outside of the organization,  This will keep the price of the home the same from one owner to another,  As you can see it is almost like a bank account you get your money or percentage of your money back at any time you want to sell your home, or monies paid can be transferred to another home within the organization.  The goal is to build a number of homes as starter homes and other homes that would be larger to accommodate existing owners that want to upgrade to a larger home and loosing none of their principal payments  we would just add the difference of price for new built home to current loan.  I know that with the monies i am asking for that i can build over 40 homes and with the payments from those homes i can build one home per month,  once we get to 150 homes it should allow for building 1 home every three weeks, 200 homes will allow building 1 home every week and so on, After building 500 homes the organization will be self reliant.  I figure it will take two and a half years to get to this point. I hope you help,  If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.David Espinoza

story:
What do we do?

We are "Afroponics": African hydroponics.  We aim to create jobs and relieve pressure on land and water, contributing to sustainable development and peace.  We will do this by growing horticultural crops sustainably and profitably in Rwanda, through both conventional and hydroponic methods.  Hydroponic methods do not use soil, only water and nutrients, and are normally much more water and land-efficient than conventional methods.  They just need knowledge and capital, which we hope to bring.  Your money will help us to: 

  • Establish our first hectares of crop (including tomatoes and chillies) according to sustainable land management principles
  • Extend existing hydroponics trials

Who are we?

 Afroponics was established in 2015 by:

  • Eugene Manzi, a Rwandan lawyer and entrepreneur with an MBA in corporate social responsibility from BRSU, in Bonn, Germany and a law degree from the Makerere University.
  • Jonathan Bower, a British former ODI Fellow and agricultural economist with degrees from SOAS and Oxford. Jonathan also works for Aegis Trust.

    • What We Need & What You Get

    • We need £10,000 i) to plant our first hectares, with the best available agronomic advice and ii) to build on existing hydroponic trials.   We will use the revenue from the crops we plant, to expand and replant, so that the business continues: we reinvest our profits. We will also use it to leverage in larger funding from a range of donors.
    • If you donate and you either live in or visit Rwanda, we will arrange to give you free fresh tomatoes.
    • If we don't reach our goal, or if we exceed the goal, we will use the funds we get to plant as much land as we are able, and extend hydroponics trials. 

    The Impact

    Economic

    We can multiply your money for Rwanda: we can use it to build up a sustainable business, built on both conventional and hydroponic production of horticultural crops in an environmentally sustainable way.  The potential is enormous because local and regional markets are growing very fast.  We will select only the most profitable and robust crops to grow conventionally, and we will develop hydroponics methods that are profitable in Rwanda.  Hydroponics tends to have high production per square metre compared to conventional agriculture, and therefore trials could lead to new sources of profit for us and for many other Rwandan farmers.  Ultimately, we aim to work with partners to replicate what works for us, with other farmers, and therefore help create jobs and income for Rwandan people.  

    Environmental

    Most hydroponics is many times more water-efficient than normal agriculture: one litre of water can produce a higher volume of crop.  Hydroponics is also more land-efficient than normal agriculture: one square metre of land can produce a higher volume of crop, and does not cause soil erosion or depletion.  Your money will help us make this work well in Rwanda.  We will also use and promote the use of the best home-grown and regionally proven sustainable land management methods to minimise soil depletion and maximise efficient land use.

    Social

    We aim to foster a positive image for agriculture for talented young Rwandans and to lure talent into the sector, to take the problem of food production and sustainable land use seriously.  We will also operate in a way that is sensitive to local community contexts, and operate according to a 'do no harm' principle.  Once we are more mature, we will contribute surplus that is not reinvested to build the company, to Aegis Trust, an international genocide prevention organisation working to build social cohesion. 

    The big picture: The vision of Afroponics is a thriving and innovative agribusiness that contributes to food security and sustainable peace in Rwanda, and is part of the solution to the growing global scarcity of land and water resources.  The mission of Afroponics is to work towards food security by exploring, demonstrating and replicating commercially successful agriculture in Rwanda according to the principles of best practice in sustainable land management.

    Risks & Challenges

    We can find land; we can find expertise, and we can certainly find markets.  Our main challenge is to find money to start off.

    • Our laser-like focus on commercial viability (from our starting points of economics and business respectively) will ensure that we will plan well and make good use of people's money.
    • In addition to crowdfunding, we will approach multiple funding sources.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please get the word out: share a link to this in emails and on facebook with your friends, and please use Indiegogo share features too!

management.

story:
Fund the Future

Over a decade ago, a group of dedicated volunteers got the deed for an abandoned railroad line with the dream of creating a recreational trail for bikers, hikers, runners and horseback riders.

Now an 8 mile trail built by volunteers stretches from Garden Plain past Goddard. With your help, the trail can extend another 8 miles east to Wichita and make it easier to meet up with the planned metropolitan bikeway system.

The time is now - your contribution is doubled today as part of a matching grant from the Sunflower Foundation.

2015 is a year of possibilities for trails in Wichita. On both the east and west sides of town, trail advocates from Prairie Travelers and partner organization Andover-Augusta Rail Trail Initiative (AARTI) are diligently working to create regional transportation connections that include bicyclists and pedestrians. Their combined efforts could result in a 50 mile designated bikeway stretching from Garden Plain to Augusta. Your financial support brings us closer to that goal.

Where does the money go?

Prairie Travelers, the nonprofit organization leading the charge on this effort, has applied for a $55,000 matching grant from the Sunflower Foundation.

  • While volunteer labor gets the work done, materials aren't free. The funding raised here goes to purchase equipment and supplies to create the trail, including fine crushed limestone and trail enhancements.
  • This summer, Prairie Travelers will host a team from the AmeriCorps National Civilian Conservation Corps. These 10-12 team members volunteer 40+ hours a week for 6-13 weeks in communities across the country, including ours. They will jumpstart the construction of the trail expansion and help make our dream a reality.

The Impact

Your contribution helps create a healthier community. Beyond the physical transformation of the abandoned railway, trails help promote healthy, active lifestyles and build community. Prairie Travelers has more than a decade of experience building trails, and a solid track record.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially? No problem. Prairie Travelers has ongoing opportunities for volunteers, including monthly trail workdays and our annual fundraiser, the Walnut Valley Metric bicycle ride. Contact prairietravelers@yahoo.com to find out more.

Share this campaign with your contacts using the options provided by Indiegogo or by copying the link above.

To learn more about the Red Bud Trail expansion from Andover to Augusta, e-mail aartitrail@gmail.com.

story:
On June 25, 2014, our mother Rhonda Timmons passed away at 64 after a long battle with diabetes and congestive heart failure. On that day, we were able to say goodbye and will always be grateful for the support of our family and friends during her illness and after her death.  

Like any children, we’d like to remember our mom in happier times and hoped to find a way to honor her life as we move forward without her.

That’s where Illinois Valley Services for Single Parents, Displaced Homemakers, and Single Pregnant Women (IVS) and this Indiogogo campaign comes in.

Figuring out a way to help single parents like her seemed like a perfect option. We can tell you that as a single mother without even a high school diploma, she struggled alone to parent and provide for three children over the years. She eventually attended Illinois Valley Community College (IVCC) and received her General Educational Development (GED), and later, a nursing assistant certificate. But more support—advanced training, childcare, interaction with other single parents—would have helped immensely.

That is why we’re raising donations for IVS. For the past eighteen years, this program has been providing personal and career guidance as well as financial support for single parents, and divorced and widowed women in the greater Illinois Valley Region including LaSalle, Bureau, and Putnam counties. 

During that time, IVS has served more than 600 women.  IVS aims to help women make wise decisions leading to financial independence through education and job skills training.  Sometimes it’s as simple as teaching a divorced woman with no job experience how to interview effectively.  Sometimes helping a single mother stay in school means helping with car repairs or tires, gas money, or work clothes.  At other times, it’s helping her with her self-esteem, time management, budgeting, parenting, or relationship issues.  Each client is unique, so the services offered are individualized for each person.

Specific programs are listed below:

CAREER PLANNING

  • Interest Assessment
  • Career Exploration
  • Job Shadowing
  • Mentoring

OCCUPATIONAL  SKILLS

  • Job Search
  • Cover Letters
  • Resume Writing
  • Interviewing Skills
  • Job Keeping Skills
  • Vocational Training

PARENTING INFO

  • Child Development
  • Discipline
  • Nutrition
  • Childhood Diseases
  • Budgeting
  • Stress Management

EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE

  • High School Diploma
  • GED Certificate
  • Associate Degree
  • Assistance in accessing college funding

100 % of the proceeds raised now until Mother’s Day on May 10th, 2015 will go directly to IVS for their programs. Moreover, 100% of the proceeds IVS receives from this campaign will go directly to their clients.  

IVS depends on donations to provide the financial support offered to clients. None of the donations they receive go toward the cost of running the program. While the majority will be used toward tuition, textbooks, or travel expenses to and from school or work, IVS also provides financial assistance for emergency expenses to keep these women in school or employed. 

This program provides a long term commitment to their clients.  It often takes many years for a woman to complete education for a career as she often must work full time and go to school part time.  IVS provides continuous support during those years.  Once a client achieves her educational goals, they offer continued personal and financial support until the clients are on their feet.  

We hope you consider supporting IVS!  And please share this link on your social media sites. Everyone knows a parent who can use a little help with the world’s most difficult job.

With love and much gratitude,

Maria, Angie, and Chad

story:
A healthier and cleaner way to snack.

Let's face it, many of us have every intention of eating healthy, but we still tend to reach for that overly processed, high calorie junk food that just results in the spiking and crashing of our blood sugar levels. This can wreak havoc on our minds and bodies, causing anything from headaches and mood swings, to losing our ability to focus and concentrate.

At Kraze Foods, our goal is to provide you with high quality, nutrition-dense foods that are healthy and bursting with flavor. We are focused on creating raw food snacks that appeal to people from all walks of life, not just raw foods enthusiasts.

Our raw flavored nuts are all natural and contain no additives or preservatives. We use only the finest and freshest organic ingredients from trusted sources to make our products. 

Raw from start to finish. Our nuts are soaked and dehydrated for 5 days, which helps to neutralize enzyme inhibitors, activating beneficial enzymes to allow for easier digestion and absorption of nutrients.

We want you to enjoy snacking without the guilt. Sure, nuts are high in fat. We all know this. But they are good fats that are essential to our diet. For example, did you know that walnuts support brain and heart health? Did you also know that pecans are rich in magnesium, a mineral known for its anti-inflammatory properties? And cashews are known cancer fighters. Good stuff, right? Down to the last ingredient, we have health in mind when creating our products. Just a handful of our nuts will give you the natural energy boost you need…your body will thank you, too!

We are launching with our trio of flavored nuts: Spicy Cashews, Maple Mesquite Pecans and Chocolate Orange Walnuts. Handcrafted in small batches, these nuts pack a huge flavor punch, and keep you coming back for more. Seriously, we can't keep our taste testers away!


Spicy Cashews ingredients: organic raw cashews, organic coconut oil, organic lime juice, organic lime zest, organic ground cayenne, organic chili powder, raw pink Himalayan salt.

Maple Mesquite Pecans ingredients: organic raw pecans, organic grade B maple syrup, organic raw mesquite powder, organic vanilla extract, organic lemon juice, organic ground cinnamon, raw pink Himalayan salt.

Chocolate Orange Walnuts ingredients: organic raw walnuts, organic raw cacao powder, organic grade B maple syrup, organic orange zest, organic vanilla extract, organic orange juice, raw pink Himalayan salt.

We all need a little pick-me-up from time to time, so why not make it something tasty with nutritional benefits to boot?

We need your help to make Kraze Foods become a reality. Our products are so good, we must share them with the masses, but cannot do it alone. The money raised in our campaign will go toward ingredients, packaging, equipment and commercial space to create the products. We are absorbing all costs associated with graphic and web design, video production, photography and social media since we are handling this ourselves.

At campaign completion, we will be selling directly to customers through our website and will be working like mad to get Kraze Foods onto shelves at retailers. Just know that you helped get us there when you see us in stores. Now isn't that a great feeling?

We really appreciate your interest in our cause. Just remember, the next time you reach for a snack, make sure you reach for Spicy Cashews, Maple Mesquite Pecans and Chocolate Orange Walnuts from Kraze Foods…they will elevate your taste buds, as well as your mood!

Please don't forget to share this campaign with your friends and family.

Thanks for your support and join the kraze!

story:
What is TOGI?

TOGI is an application that will remind you to set times for play, while providing you various ways and ideas for fun active time. TOGI contains a variety of games and activities, for a wide range of locations. You can play with your children, with Friends in small or large groups, with accessories or without them. You can play for a short while or for longer periods.

The application will enable you to set play dates with friends, to schedule your week and get notifications.

TOGI is the first stage of our vision- to give everybody, everywhere an amazing tool for free, that's why we need your help.

What can you do with TOGI?

  • Spend quality time with your children while playing  physical games.

  • Select activities based on your children number, age, time &  available accessories.

  • Plan your weekly playing activity.

  • Receive reminders for planned activities and play dates.

  • Create play dates and events with friends.

  • browse through a dynamic and constantly updating pool of games.

  • Watch short guidance films on play, physical activity, parents- children connection and more.


What do we need the money for?

10,000$ - legal advice for the regulations and terms of use.

7000$ - translating and editing.

14,000$ - continue developing

5000$ - Marketing.


Our Timeline


What we'll do with money above 36,000$ ?

  • Enlarge the number of games above 70 that are planned for the initial version.

  • Produce more detailed short films on physical activity, games and skill developing trough play and movement.

  • Add add- ons to the application.

  • Translate the application to different languages.

  • Expend the range of age groups for 2-3 years old.

  • Develope the application to IOS.

In which ways does physical activity benefit our children?


  • Brain development

  • Positive body image

  • Self-value

  • Response speed

  • Developing social skills

  • Positive achievement

  • Winning while respecting others

  • Losing with honor

  • Flexibility

  • Creativity

  • Eye hand coordination

And more..


For what mutual activities of parents and children will contribute?

  • Stronger connection

  • Significant experience- emotional and physical

  • Positive body image

  • Mutual esteem

  • Collaboration while receiving authority- in the game, and transferring to the relationship

  • Openness and mutuality
And more..

Children that sit too much might lack:

·  Motor flexibility

·  Limited coordination

·  Less connection in the brain

·  Less balance

·  Lower self esteem

·  Peer in social skills

·  Weak shoulder belt

·  Will be more likely to develop diabetes mellitus

·  Might become clumsy


Our Impact

We want to create a change in the way we live today. Being more active is a goal that will touch so many circles of life - physical health, mental health, relationships, development and more.

The priorities must be changes, but for this we need you - to help us make an impact.

Our impact goal is to reach as many families as possible, to improve their quality time together, to provide them with creative and challenging games. We believe that the information and the solution must be available to all


The team

We are a team of four professionals who works on TOGI because we believe  that play time with our children is important, and it's worthy that everybody will have varied options and fun ideas for quality time. All of us are involved in all the aspects of TOGI  ☺

Sharon  Michaeli- Ramon, (36), mother, educator, applied behavioral analysis, humanitarian aid specialist and a trainer. Having international expertise in programs developing, 1:1 behavioral therapy, education and training professionals.
The initiator of TOGI, responsible on the project planning and strategy, contents development & building, developing the educational- play- physical perception and methods.

Shay Zalman (38), father of two, Senior web / mobile developer Open Source Platforms and languages specialist. CTO & co-partner at Joomi LTD.
A water sport enthusiastic (Surf, Scuba dive, sailing..)
Responsible at TOGI for CMS/API, software architecture and Android coding.

Dan Michaeli (35), father, 3D artist & designer, P.E in animation. Work as an independent and salaried employee for the last 9 years. climber and a sport climbing guide.
Responsible at TOGI for design, character design and animation.

Dror Miler (38), visual artist, photographer and painter, mainly in the northern Israeli periphery.  B.Sc in computer science, P.E in film studies; lectures of filming and photography in Tel- Hai college.
Responsible at TOGI for short films, design and production.
story_txt:
What is TOGI?
TOGI is an application that will remind you to set times for play, while providing you various ways and ideas for fun active time. TOGI contains a variety of games and activities, for a wide range of locations. You can play with your children, with Friends in small or large groups, with accessories or without them. You can play for a short while or for longer periods.
The application will enable you to set play dates with friends, to schedule your week and get notifications.
TOGI is the first stage of our vision- to give everybody, everywhere an amazing tool for free, that's why we need your help.

What can you do with TOGI?

Spend quality time with your children while playing  physical games.
Select activities based on your children number, age, time &  available accessories.
Plan your weekly playing activity.
Receive reminders for planned activities and play dates.
Create play dates and events with friends.
browse through a dynamic and constantly updating pool of games.
Watch short guidance films on play, physical activity, parents- children connection and more.

What do we need the money for?
10,000$ - legal advice for the regulations and terms of use.
7000$ - translating and editing.
14,000$ - continue developing
5000$ - Marketing.


Our Timeline

What we'll do with money above 36,000$ ?

Enlarge the number of games above 70 that are planned for the initial version.
Produce more detailed short films on physical activity, games and skill developing trough play and movement.
Add add- ons to the application.
Translate the application to different languages.
Expend the range of age groups for 2-3 years old.
Develope the application to IOS.
In which ways does physical activity benefit our children?



Brain development
Positive body image
Self-value
Response speed
Developing social skills
Positive achievement
Winning while respecting others
Losing with honor
Flexibility
Creativity
Eye hand coordination

And more..



For what mutual activities of parents and children will contribute?

Stronger connection
Significant experience- emotional and physical
Positive body image
Mutual esteem
Collaboration while receiving authority- in the game, and transferring to the relationship
Openness and mutuality
And more..


Children
that sit too much might lack:
· 
Motor flexibility
· 
Limited coordination
· 
Less connection in the
brain
· 
Less balance
· 
Lower self esteem
· 
Peer in social skills
· 
Weak shoulder belt
· 
Will be more likely to
develop diabetes mellitus
· 
Might become clumsy

Our Impact

We want to 
create a change in the way we live today. Being more active is a goal 
that will touch so many circles of life - physical health, mental 
health, relationships, development and more.
The priorities must be changes, but for this we need you - to help us make an impact.Our impact goal is to reach as many families as possible, to improve their quality time together, to provide them with creative and challenging games. We believe that the information and the solution must be available to all
The team
We are a team of four professionals who works on TOGI because we 
believe  that play time with our children is important, and it's worthy 
that everybody will have varied options and fun ideas for quality time. 
All of us are involved in all the aspects of TOGI  ☺

Having international expertise in programs developing, 1:1 behavioral

story:
Long Story Short…

We never thought we would be here: in the last place we ever dreamed of being, doing the last thing we ever dreamed of doing. Together, raising a child of our own in the small town in which we were raised, farming for a living…

Though we farm full-time, it is not on land of our own. Another small-farm family, the Howells of Hickory Lane Farm, are not only teaching us how to farm, and how to do good within our community through farming, but have also encouraged us to begin our own farm business from the produce we help grow on the farm. Think Little, a year-round twenty member CSA, is our way of making a living while learning to operate a farm business. Without them, we may never have realized our dream of becoming a farm family.

However, despite the unbelievable opportunity the Howell family has given Think Little, we need to begin thinking about the future. We’re unable to get a loan for equipment because of our outstanding student loan debt and grants/cost-shares will not cover the cost of one central piece of equipment: the tractor. Currently, our family is leasing a few acres of land on which we are able to grow our own produce, which will allow us to expand our small CSA to the point of saving money. By growing a little more over the next few years, we hope to be able save enough for a down payment on land of our own. Our campaign is for a walk-behind tractor and the implements needed to begin cultivating our few acres of leased land.

Year one will entail growing fresh herbs and flowers on our leased land for both the Hickory Lane and Think Little CSAs. Currently, we do not depend heavily on market sales, but will earn additional income as there are currently few fresh herb options within our local market. By the Winter, we will have acquired an additional high-tunnel (to our name) for expanding our capacity to grow vegetables for the two CSAs year-round. Year two is when we will begin to expand our fruit and vegetable production to supplement what is grown on Hickory Lane so that we may then increase the number of CSA members to approximately 30.

A small contribution here, today, will create a wealth of produce for not only more CSA members, but for low-income families as well. Food access is built into our CSA model. For every four members, we provide a free CSA share to a low-income family through HOTEL INC (a local non-profit serving those who demonstrate a need in our community) for three months of the year. More so, we hope to one day provide the same opportunities for aspiring young farmers that have been given to us by the Howell family.


What We Need & What You Get

For the equipment we need, we’re asking for an even $8,000. Here’s the breakdown:

Equipment:                                          Cost:

BCS 852 walk-behind tractor      $4,275

Rotary Plow (for BCS)                    $1,400

Mulch layer (for BCS)                        $650

Required accessories:                       $600

Irrigating attachment (mulch layer)

Axel extensions (for BCS/layer)

5x10x20 foam-filled tires

Broadfork                                                $185

Trailer & hitch                                        $500

Total Cost                                      $7,610

Target                                           $8,000

Subtract 4% Indiegogo              -$320

Grand Total (goal met)              $7,680

** Please, feel free to visit the following website from which we will be purchasing the following items: www.earthtoolsbcs.com **

In case we do not reach our goal, the money will be spent in the order of the list above. First, we’ll purchase the tractor, then the plow, and so on. However, if we go above our goal, the money will be used to purchase plastic mulch, drip irrigation tape, seed, and other small implements (we’ll cross that bridge when we come to it if we get close to our goal).


The Impact

The short-term impact of a successful campaign will give us the tools we need, along with the continuing support of Hickory Lane Farm, to expand our CSA for the 2015-2016 season. Our goal is to have a total of 30 CSA members by our second quarter (April) of 2016. The result will be an additional $11,000/year in membership, allowing us to reinvest a substantial portion in our business (nearly doubling the return on the investment within two years), and the addition of three more twelve-week shares to be given to low-income families (rounding up, for those of you doing the math). You can follow our progress on the farm blog: www.thinklittlecsa.com

The long-term impact of a successful campaign is an investment in one small-farm family focused on food access. Unfortunately, these are rare, but the number of us who are concerned first with a fair and equitable local food system is growing (we are lucky to have some of them as mentors). Farmers have a unique role in providing food security not only for the average consumers of a given region, but also in closing the gap between local farms and those without adequate access and good whole foods. Further, we work just as hard off the farm advocating for food access in other arenas: farmers markets, public health, policy/regulation, non-profits, and other grassroots organizations. Being a stronger producer will give us a stronger voice in those arenas. Our long-term goal, besides sustaining a small family farm indefinitely, is to raise enough awareness, and inspire enough action, about food insecurity to put our particular CSA model out of business.


Qualifications

For the sake of brevity, here's a quick list:

> Our year-round CSA has a retention rate of 85% within it's first year
> Former Community Farm Alliance Farmers Market Support Fellow
          Assisted 6 other Eastern KY markets with Double Dollar/outreach programs
          The program is now offered to 20+ KY markets in low-income communities
          * Did not renew the fellowship to pursue farming full-time
> Current Outreach Co-coordinator for Community Farmers Market
          CFM started the first Double Dollar program for SNAP/WIC in the state of KY
          Acquired an additional $20,000 in grant funding for the Mobile Market project


Other Ways You Can Help

Lastly, if you’re able to give, that’s awesome! If you want to give more, also consider a donation to HOTEL INC or the Community Farmers Market Double Dollars Program. If not, here are some other ways you can help our mission to support beginning farmers and the connection between local farms and low-income communities:

·  Spend some of your budgeted food dollars with local farmers at a farmers market or at establishments that support local farms. Further, encourage your local market to accept SNAP benefits (see MarketLink).

·  Share some of the good work other organizations are doing in your community regarding food access, which is easy to do via social media.

·  Ask local farmers for permission to glean seconds for local food pantries.

·  Spread the word about our Think Little campaign!!!

** If you're in TN, please consider supporting your local farmers first by donating to the Double N Urban Farm tractor project. **

story:
Short Summary

  • I'm a high school Junior who is interested in being a plastics engineer and would like to further my knowledge in 3D printing. I am certified in Solidworks and planning to learn more CAD programs. My school currently has 3, 3D printers, but I would like one to start a my own small business.
  • Even the littlest amount of a donation will be helpful towards my dream of be a plastics engineer and learning more about 3D printing.
  • I want to buy a 3D printer with the money I raise.

What We Need & What You Get

  • If I'm able to raise $750, I will be able to afford a 3D printer. The money will go towards the Cobblebot Little Monster. 
  • http://cobblebot.com/index.php/cobblebot-littlemonster-519.html
  • It is available to pre-order now.
  • The Cobblebot Little Monster is $450 with shipping.
  • I plan to get upgrades with the 3D printer. 
  • I plan on getting the Dual Extruder Carriage + Hexagon Extruder + All Metal Extruder is $100.00, 
  • Upgrade Primary Extruder to Bulldog XL is $100.00,  
  • 10" x 10" x 10" Heated Bed (Pre-wired inc.Thermistor) is $75.00 
  • 2X Hotend Fan Mount & Fan is $30.00.
  • Grand Total of $755
  • Any money leftover will be spent on plastic for the 3D printer.
  • Anyone who donates at least a $1 will be given a personalized thank you email from me.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, I will keep the funds aside and save up however much more I need to buy the 3D printer.

The Impact

  • This would help me forward my dream of becoming a plastics engineer. I will be able to create a small business to help me pay for college. 

Risks & Challenges

  • The Cobblebot Little Monster comes unassembled, but I believe that some friends and I will be able to build the 3D printer successfully. I've taken multiple tech classes so I believe we should be able to assemble the 3D printer with no problem.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • It will be very beneficial to me if you can't contribute financially, that you please contribute socially and share my project on social medias. Thank you.

story:
Maybe you're new to the Co-Op or maybe you've been a diehard since its inception. Regardless of the length of time you've supported Mountain People's Co-Op, we're here because we believe in its mission, take ownership of its growth, and desire to continue to provide our families with the nutritious, local foods and products the Co-Op provides. 


As many of you now know, the Co-Op is embarking on an exciting new adventure by moving to a new location that will allow for growth and the capacity to support even more farmers and partners in our growing local food economy. 

But we need your help. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $35,000 to accomplish the move, get the new space ready, and market the new location to the community. Here's how the money will be spent:  
- $15,000: Contractor labor (inspections, electricians, telecom, computer services etc.)
- $12,500: Materials (dry wall, paint, flooring, display and kitchen upgrades)
- $5,000: Moving costs (physically moving everything from the store to the new location)
- $2,500: Marketing and outreach  (promo for new location)

  • We currently have 753 member/owners! If every member donated $50, we would reach our goal! We know that some members will be able to give less and others more so we've designated several giving levels. 

  • We have some unique perks as a Thank You for the investment you make towards growing the Co-Op. 

  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the Co-Op will still move but we'll have to dip into the capital savings account to pay for the remaining costs. 


The Impact

We've outgrown the existing space! The move will allow for more visibility, more collaboration with other regional businesses, help incubate more businesses, and grow the Cooperative movement in WV. This is Mountain People's  first step in moving towards a regional food hub. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Without the financial and volunteer support from Co-Op members and the community, the transition time will be longer and it is possible that we'll have to stay closed longer. 
  • If the capital savings account is needed to supplement for money not raised, we could potentially deplete our savings that we've accumulated over the past 3 years.
  • If savings is depleted, we won't have this buffer for unexpected market challenges and changes. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Visit the Co-Op and put your name on the volunteer sign up list. We'll be sending out periodic updates for volunteer needs when they arise. 
  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends and family on Social Media. 
  • Be part of the change. Run for the Board. Nominations close March 31st. 
  • Not a member yet? Become a member! 
  • If you're a small business-- partner with the Co-Op as your supplier!

story:
The project was prompted by an email from a carer of a child reaching 18 years of age - ''........found myself having to give up work to look after my son. I had no idea that at 18 education and services would stop and we would be left reliant on benefits..............looking for some way I can go back to work and my son can do normal things like catching a bus.........................''

After speaking to other carers we found this was a common theme, children coming out of education into the adult world were being left with no basic life skills, no prospect of employment, no social life and were again the 24 hour 7 day week responsibility of parents.

Our project was begun with two aims in mind, to give carers a break by helping young adults with learning disabilities gain some independence, being able to switch on a hoover, catch a bus, and to make that break more sustainable and meaningful by aiming to place the young adult in employment, both paid and voluntary.

The reason for this campaign is to find funds to purchase equipment to enable us to provide training to the young adults in various disciplines such as gardening, picture framing, furniture repairs. All furniture repaired will then be sold through Crossroads' Charity Shops.

Thank you for your support!
story_txt: The project was prompted by an email from a carer of a child reaching 18 years of age - ''........found myself having to give up work to look after my son. I had no idea that at 18 education and services would stop and we would be left reliant on benefits..............looking for some way I can go back to work and my son can do normal things like catching a bus.........................''After speaking to other carers we found this was a common theme, children coming out of education into the adult world were being left with no basic life skills, no prospect of employment, no social life and were again the 24 hour 7 day week responsibility of parents.Our project was begun with two aims in mind, to give carers a break by helping young adults with learning disabilities gain some independence, being able to switch on a hoover, catch a bus, and to make that break more sustainable and meaningful by aiming to place the young adult in employment, both paid and voluntary.The reason for this campaign is to find funds to purchase equipment to enable us to provide training to the young adults in various disciplines such as gardening, picture framing, furniture repairs.  All furniture repaired will then be sold through Crossroads' Charity Shops.Thank you for your support!

story:
What is Shareagenarians?

Shareagenarians is an online housemate service specifically for older adults.  We match adults over 60 who have more home than they need or can afford with older adults who are looking for safe, affordable housing.  Many of our users are empty-nesters, widows or widowers, who may have an especially difficult time adapting to life alone.

The Backstory

I’m Stephanie Heacox, Founder and CEO of Shareagenarians. When my mom was no longer able to remain in her home of 50 years, my sisters and I wrestled with a problem that you may have faced already – or that you may be anticipating as your own loved ones age. Mom cherished her independence, and she wanted to remain in her home, but it was no longer safe for her to live on her own. At the time, I thought there ought to be an online service that helps elders in this situation to find each other and create"Golden Girl" households. There wasn’t. So as a longtime web and usability consultant – and third-generation do-it-yourselfer – I decided to form a team and build one.

The Scope of the Problem

There were 12 and a half million Americans over the age of 65 living alone in 2012.  70% of those were women.  And people in this age group faced foreclosure eight times more often than they had just 5 years earlier. According to AARP and Harvard, the high cost of housing can cause older adults to cut back on essentials such as food and medicine.

Meanwhile, scientists are documenting what most of us intuitively know:  living alone simply isn't good for us.  In a society where multigenerational households are not the norm, the growing number of alone elders has social, psychological, health and financial consequences.

Boomers Are Different

That said, if one thing is clear about Boomers, it's that we're going to change the way we age.  More so than the generations that precede us, we want to remain active and independent.  Yet we are also keenly aware that we are social, familial creatures, and we are willing to explore new ways of living in community, and of participating in today's sharing economy.

Shareagenarians:  One Solution

One potential solution for many homeowners and fixed income older adults is to share a home.  The few elder homeshare services that already exist are mostly local, offline, or otherwise limited, and only meet a small percentage of the existing need.  As a national online matching service, Shareagenarians can reach the larger market and even supplement local manually-operated programs.

Help us Provide Free Access and Support

So what do we need?  In short, we need users.  Lots of them, and fast.  This is our biggest challenge, because if a user from Cleveland logs in looking for a housemate, we need other users from Cleveland to be there, as well. 

To create this critical mass as quickly as possible, we want to offer the service free of charge for the first 30 to 60 days – longer for individual states where we haven’t signed up at least 25 users.  We need help to underwrite the free membership period, the underlying service costs, and the staff (the majority of whom are seniors themselves) who will provide phone and online support.

We also want to enlist intermediaries to help us reach users who don't have (or don't feel comfortable with) technology:  public libraries, churches, senior centers and social service agencies.  We want to give them marketing materials and user guides to support that outreach effort.

With your help, we can create opportunities for housing and friendship for our elders – our family, friends and neighbors!

A Quick Tour of Shareagenarians

How it works

Shareagenarians is, at its core, a matching service. Homeowners and home-seekers each fill out a personal profile, which includes much the same information that any roommate would want to know, but adds some questions that are unique to older adults.  We also encourage users to add introductory text of their own, to share hobbies, special considerations, etc.

We apply an algorithm to our user profile questions, including location and budget, and we identify potentially promising housemates.  Those matches are presented to users on an ongoing basis.

Users can exchange emails (with notifications forwarded to their personal email) and decide whether someone has housemate potential.  Those emails, as well as new matches, will be clearly displayed on the user’s home page.

How do we help?

Safety tips, presented when users first log in, help users who are new to online matching services learn the best ways to meet with a housemate candidate.  Those tips are also available on our Help pages, where users will find a range of assistance, FAQs, and related links to tools such as sample homeshare agreements.   

What about discomfort with technology?

We recognize that some older adults may not be entirely comfortable with technology, or may not have access to a computer or tablet. We have several ways to provide assistance:

  • Users may include a “helper” for their account – perhaps a friend or family member – who becomes a co-user, and can assist them with filling out the profile, even receiving copies of all messages
  • We provide phone support (in addition to email and chat) that is staffed by reps who are over 55 themselves, so that older users who need our help feel more comfortable
  • We will be actively engaging local intermediaries – public libraries, senior centers, churches and social service agencies – to assist their older constituents in using Shareagenarians, and will provide them with marketing materials and user guides

Lastly, an opportunity to share wisdom!

One of the fun features of Shareagenarians is Ask Steph – an advice column by our CEO and for our users, where they can pose questions about homesharing, interpersonal relationships, or whatever else comes up.  Ask Steph has a twist, however:  our users will be allowed to add their own comments, blog style, and share centuries of wisdom with their peers!

Please help us with donations, and spread the word about our campaign and our service.  The need is great, and the time is now.
