story:
Lexis Dilligard and Sharon Gonzalez are the mother daughter owners of Lady Lexis Sweets Harlem's House of Confections.

We are seeking $18,000 for construction cost of a new storefront and to support our efforts in providing free monthly baking classes to families which would entail purchasing equipment and supplies.

My name is Lexis Dilligard and I am the owner and Pastry Chef of Lady Lexis Sweets. While attending Baruch College for two years I decided to change my major and attend Kingsborough Community College and study Culinary Arts. After graduating I went on to City Tech to obtain a Bachelor's Degree in Hospitality Management. While attending City Tech, I decided to pitch the idea to my mother about opening up a Sweet Shop in Harlem. I raised some money, received some help and with the help of my mother we opened the shop. While we are novice to the baking arena there is nothing simple about our creations.  I am responsible for hand making all of the Pastries, Cakes, & Cookies in the shop and coining new creations that are fan favorites like Smorkie Cookie, Rum Raisin Oatmeal Cookies and Chocolate Chip Cranberry Cookie.

One of my goals was to provide my community with healthy choice for desserts.  I created a line of Granola and Vegan Treats for the Ralph Lauren Cancer Center located in Harlem, the center has been a great supporter of our business. 

This year I spent time at The Community Health Academy of the Heights providing free baking demos to the students who are being trained to create healthy eating dishes. 

I also provide baking and cupcake decorating classes for children and as a Certified Wilton Instructor I provide the community with cake decorating classes. During my classes I show families how they can create fantastic desserts that are free of artificial flavoring and preservatives.  We even provide weekly nutrient workshops at our shop. 

As residents of Harlem it was a unanimous decision to open the Sweet Shop in the same neighborhood where my mom and I were born and reared. We are vested in this neighborhood and it is here in which we want to remain.  We need help to remain in the community.  We have no staff so it is just a mother and daughter team.  We love what we do; but we need more exposure so that our daily revenue can increase and we can continue to accomplish our goals; Showing families how to create healthy desserts and providing free nutritional classes. 

We have put all of our savings into this business and we would like to remain here.  We need $18,000.  The money will be used for construction of a new storefront, to increase seating for the family baking classes and purchase equipment for the classes 

The new storefront will open up our shop to more people and bring us more foot traffic.  After a year and half at this location we still have people who come inside and say, they didn’t even know that we were here.  We want everyone to know that we are here, and it is here that we would like to stay.

story:
We’ve open sourced Sentinel now and forever. We hope you choose to support further development.

UPDATE: With 10 days left we’ve simplified our message, simplified our goals.

Application security is a fundamental aspect of application design. Funding this campaign allows us to create not only the tools, but the education material developers crave.

  1. We’ll open source Sentinel (done).
  2. We’ll refactor Sentinel documentation from the ground up. Using multiple use case examples.
  3. We’ll create tutorials in “recipe” format that contextualize best practices going beyond the how, and answer the why using real scenarios.
  4. We’ll create a training demo. An installable application with thorough doc blocks that explain the what and why.
  5. We’ll create a site, devoted to the discussion and resources.

What is Sentinel exactly?

Sentinel is a powerful role based authentication and authorization PHP library available as a composer package. It’s the successor of our much older yet popular open source Sentry project.

  • Authentication.
  • Authorization.
  • Registration.
  • Users.
  • Roles.
  • Driver based permission system.
  • Activation scenarios.
  • Reminders (password reset).
  • Multiple sessions.
  • Interface driven.
  • Single or multiple persistences.
  • Persistence meta-data.
  • Multiple login attributes.
  • Custom checkpoints.
  • Selective checkpoints.
  • Custom hashing strategies.
  • Driver-based permissions.
  • Advanced inter-account throttling with DDoS protection.
  • User impersonation.

Premium Add-ons

Sentinel optionally has useful add-ons that extend core functionality. While Sentinel Core will always remain open source, You’ll have a chance to receive these through the appropriate perks.

  • Sentinel Social: provides an OAuth 1/2 Provider implementation
  • Sentinel Expiring-Permissions: set expiration periods on permissions.
  • Sentinel Unique-Passwords: prevents setting the same password more than once.
  • Sentinel Two-factor: adds two-factor authorization support.
  • Sentinel Multi-tenancy: SAAS, Organizations capability.
  • Sentinel Server: adds ability for sentinel to act as an OAuth2 server.

How We Develop

We’re a framework agnostic company and will develop smart to ensure Sentinel…

  • Follows semantic versioning. No exceptions.
  • Is compliant with the PSR-1, PSR-2 and PSR-4 to ensure a high level of interoperability between shared PHP code.
  • Is framework agnostic, allowing developers to create implementations for their favorite framework of choice.

Perks

Considering the sponsor and/or corporate sponsor perk? The Sentinel/Sentry ecosystem receives over 20,000 unique page views a month. Traffic that directly corresponds to developers. Seriously considering? Message us for specific analytics.

story:
The Dream...

Imagine sun soaked days at the beach, locally roasted coffee in the morning, wine tasting in the afternoon and evenings around the firepit, sipping handcrafted wine and making S'mores...this is The Winery at Manzanita Experience!

The Back Story...

Manzanita is a small, quaint beach town on the Oregon Coast, just 20 minutes south of Cannon Beach and an hour and a half from Portland, Oregon.  With 7 miles of uninterrupted, dog-friendly beach, amazing sunsets, cute shops and tasty restaurants, it is a regular vacation destination for Portlanders and Seattleites alike.

Mark Proden, owner and winemaker, founded Bodhichitta Winery in 2008 while attending wine school, at the Northwest Wine Studies in Salem, Oregon, making small batches of wine (10-100 cases at a time) by hand.  He became interested in wine during his 11 years in the Air Force as a pilot and engineer, visiting Napa and Sonoma and eventually Oregon as Pinot noir grew in popularity here.

He had been making his wines in a small, cramped space in Salem until the owner needed to sell the building due to medical bills.  Since the current winery's location was no longer viable, he began looking for a new building, a location inspired by nature, that would allow for increased production while maintaining high quality.  Manzanita came to mind, as Mark had made many trips there with his black lab Pinot, mainly for its long, dog-friendly, lease-free beach and awe-inspiring sunsets.

A Plan and Vision Begins to Form...

Over the past few months, a plan and friendship began to form.  Enter Charley Lostrom, a local real estate broker, landlord and developer in Manzanita.  He and Mark began to talk about developing an empty lot Charley owned, right on the main drag on Laneda Avenue, across from Mother Nature's Natural Foods and next to the Pine Grove Community Center, just 3 blocks from the beach.

A vision of a cedar shingled 500 square foot tasting room, 2000 square foot production facility emerged, complete with a trellised courtyard with grapevines and romantic string bulb lighting, Adirondack chairs, firepits, a glass roll-up garage door entrance, a glass viewing wall into the main production area, second floor two bedroom beach vacation rental and ocean view decks.

We will serve local, hand roasted coffee in the morning and offer wine tastings, flights, glasses and bottle service in the afternoon and evening.  To accompany the wines, we will serve picnic lunches to go, hand packed burgers, brats, sausages, hot dogs and paninis at lunch and dinner.  DIY S’mores kits are available to be assembled over the fire pits.  We welcome families, wine aficionados and their dogs!

Why We're Crowd Funding...Turning a Dream and Vision into Reality

With the lease signed, construction of the building has just begun and the tasting room and winery are set to open late 2015.  We need your help to turn The Winery at Manzanita vision into reality.  You can be part of the dream, vision and reality of The Winery at Manzanita through your donation.  Be part of the beauty that Manzanita has to offer!

Our Indiegogo Project goes beyond financial need.  We are doing it to build community, a sense of belonging and ownership.  This is your local winery and we want you to be part of it.  Whether you visit Manzanita regularly or live here, we hope The Winery at Manzanita will be a gathering place for this coastal town, to enjoy coffee, food and wine amongst friends.

What this Indiegogo Project Will Help Us Achieve...

The ambitious goal of creating such an open and giving space in the form of a courtyard, tasting room and production facility has prompted us to reach out to you for help!  Of foremost importance is the purchase of a crusher/de-stemmer, press, additional tanks, barrels and commercial dishwasher to open come late 2015! 

So why $15,000? Here’s the breakdown of anticipated costs.  Any amount above the $15,000 goal will be applied to the total anticipated costs of $55,000.

Tasting room build-out

    Wine barrel firepits: 10,000

    Commercial dishwasher: $4,000

    Tasting bar and chairs: $3,000

Increased production (from very, very small tanks, to well, small tanks!)

   Tanks: $10,000

   Barrels: $5,000

   De-stemmer: $11,000

   Bladder Press: $12,000

 

The Future of The Winery at Manzanita...

While $15,000 is a lot of money to many of us, the big wineries in Oregon spend millions of dollars for their equipment and buildings.  We are asking for your help for a small fraction of that.  We intend to stay small and are committed to small batch wine production for one reason--quality!  

Thank you so much for your support!  We couldn't do it without you!

Will Help Us Achieve...The ambitious goal of creating such an open and giving space in the form of a courtyard, tasting room and production facility has prompted us to reach out to you for help!  Of foremost importance is the purchase of a crusher/de-stemmer, press, additional tanks, barrels and commercial dishwasher to open come late 2015!  Oak barrels for redsSo why $15,000? Here’s the breakdown of anticipated costs.  Any amount above the $15,000 goal will be applied to the total anticipated costs of $55,000.Tasting room build-out    Wine barrel firepits: 10,000    Commercial dishwasher: $4,000    Tasting bar and chairs: $3,000Increased production (from very, very small tanks, to well, small tanks!)   Tanks: $10,000   Barrels: $5,000   De-stemmer: $11,000   Bladder Press: $12,000  Small tanks we'd like to purchase with your helpThe Future of The Winery at Manzanita...While $15,000 is a lot of money to many of us, the big wineries in Oregon spend millions of dollars for their equipment and buildings.  We are asking for your help for a small fraction of that.  We intend to stay small and are committed to small batch wine production for one reason--quality!  Thank you so much for your support!  We couldn't do it without you! Si Nae and Annabel enjoy a great day at the beach

story:
Help restore an icon in rock n roll history

A little over a year ago, I embarked on the scariest and riskiest endeavor of my life - I purchased majority interest in the historic and iconic Rock N Roll club known as The Legendary Dobbs.   Yes, I knew the facility needed attention.  I didn't realize just how much attention it needed, and coupled with a lot of unexpected issues left behind, I find myself doing something I hate doing - asking for help.

Besides plenty of other minor issues, which we are dealing with as they arise, we are in need of a complete new air conditioning system.  Our 1st floor is the only floor with true central air, and the unit literally caught fire on Saturday May 9th due to being over-stressed, and it's antiquated and was never really adequate for the space. We can and are putting another 'bandaid' on that system to at least keep us going short term.  But we have no central air at all on the 2nd and 3rd floors, and window units are simply not enough to maintain any level of comfort for our crowds.

We are planning on continuing to offer many great shows that will pack the house, so an effective and efficient air conditioning system is a must to keep a very full Dobbs comfortable, not to mention for the comfort of the amazing talent that graces our stages.  

A Little About Dobbs 

The Legendary Dobbs opened in June of 1975 as JC Dobbs, and has featured original live music ever since.  It is truly one of the last of its kind, and in its 40 year history has played host to many acts that later went on to become very notable -

including George Thorogood, The Stray Cats, Nirvana, Pearl Jam, Oasis, The Roots, G-Love and The Special Sauce, and many more.  Every Friday and Saturday night will typically welcome 10 or more bands on our 2 stages.  You'll see a combination of local, newly touring talent, and even some recognizable names.  We specialize in indie, emerging, and re-emerging talent.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to donations, your patronage at Dobbs helps keep us alive!  Come out to see a show!  Join our jams on Tuesday nights, or play an Open Mic on Wednesdays.  Check our website, http://legendarydobbs.com for our calendar.

Also, please share with your friends, family, anyone that has ever played a show at Dobbs or ever wants to, anyone that loves live music.  Get the word out and help us keep the dream going!

And finally - we are actively accepting bids for this system, so if you are, or know, a qualified HVAC Technician, please have them write to me at admin@legendarydobbs.com with subject line "HVAC Tech".

Much love, respect, and rock n roll!

~Momma Dobbs~

story:
About Audra Smith Art and Creative Apps

                                        

                                      


Hi my name is Sharon Audra Smith

In a few short weeks I will be launching my businesses showcasing my interpretation or I should say Abstract Realism in Nature and Beauty in Bold Body Contours and Apps creation for small business.

I started drawing and painting so that I could depict my conceptualised ideas of nature and form.  I love Picasso's Cubism  and Rembrandt's style and colour. Contemporary Art has always appealed to my senses but I have other talents and skills and hence have searched for a way to find balance between them. Even though I consider my art authentic, I by no means am an expert artist but a creative person who believes in the expression of self and ideas to one's best abilities.  I thought of the years I have spent pondering "what if!?" and decided it was time to take a leap of faith into the Creative Global Stream of Abstract Reality, to bring affordable original art to the masses.

My goal is to found Aundra Smith's Online Gallery in conjunction with my small business creative apps business www.creativeloyaltyapps.com  because I love the balance between Art and Science, since everything stems from a creative core.  I have realised that in life we all possess a multiplicity of talents and defined skills (some with more talents than others) and all bestowed, is a Great Thing.  And because of this, one should live a life so full, that they empty themselves of all the talents and skills of which they possess, for the enjoyment and greater benefit of mankind, so that they leave empty one day, having lived for Live You Must!!!!

In order for me to do so I need to market my work both online and offline.  This is the first stage of my journey.  My Abstract Realism in Nature and Beauty in Bold Body Contours will showcase 8.3 x 11.7 (A4), 11.17 x 16.5 (A3),  10 x 14, 16x 20 and 23.5 x 23.5 (all dimensions quoted in inches) and all canvas using mediums: acrylyc, oil and ink.

To cover the cost for more canvas and paints, inks and brushes as well as to market my art and apps businesses the cost will be $750.00 to me. In order to do this though, I need your help funding this amount, and in return for helping me out, you can be one of the few who gets your hands on my original abstract creations and vouchers for apps to be created for your small business or someone that you may know who has a small business.

Here are some of my Perks to you:

These beautiful flowers are some of the perks to be had.  I really hope you like them as much as I enjoyed creating them. 

The Blue Flower

Available in A4 and A3  and for your contribution of $35.00 and $40.00 respectively.  This painting is created in acrylic on canvas paper.  Be one of my unique collectors of these original paintings where no two are ever alike.


The Red  and Orange Flowers

These paintings were created on varying size canvas using acrylic, ink and oil paint. For your support of $50 and $65 respectively, these are my perks to you.





Body Beautiful Contours 

My goal is to create more forms on larger canvas in continued bold and vibrant colours and some in perhaps 2 tones and textures.  The aim is to view the contour of the body in different perspectives from one painting as shown here.  For your support of $150 this is my perk to you.  Size 23.5 x 23.5 inches.

MORE PERKS: Mobile Apps Vouchers for Android and iPhones

I decided to create apps because it is another form of creative.  Apps are tools used in the mobile revolution of today.  Every small business should have a Mobile Website and an App.  The reason being every where one turns, someone uses a mobile device be it young or old.  People live their lives today on the Go...Mobile. It is important to reach them where they are. Whilst a mobile website encourages one to stay in touch with what is on offer, a Mobile App helps with engagement.  Having a customer purchase online one time is one thing, but to keep them coming back for more is another, especially on slow days.  This is where mobile apps comes in and creates the magic.

So for your contribution you will get the following:

APP Perk 1 - for your contribution of $50.00 Voucher ($70.00 Value)

I will create a 5 Tab App - Android Version Only.  This will be uploaded into Google Play under my developer account and will come with Push Notification Function for engagement - text only.  A Flyer will be created for your small business for the download of your app to be displayed in your store or a digital copy for your online social media marketing.  

APP Perk 2 - for your contribution of $100.00 Voucher ($150.00 Value)

I will create a 10 Tab App for your Android and Iphone.  Both of these apps will be uploaded into Google Play Apps and iTunes both under my developer accounts and will both come with Push Notification Function for engagement - text and html only.  A Flyer will be created for your small business for the download of your app to be displayed in your store or a digital copy for your online social media marketing.

Includes 1 push notification.

Sharing my Fundraiser

Please, help me share Audra Smith and my Creative Apps with the world! Like my Art on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/pages/Audra-Smith-Contemporary-Art/344823007792?ref=hl), I appreciate any support you can provide. Thank you so much.

story:
Help join me and Pollinate Energy expand operations to Kolkata!

Our mission is to improve the lives of India’s urban poor by giving them access to sustainable life-changing products. 

Pollinate Energy is a social business with a simple mission – to improve the lives of India’s urban poor by giving them access to life-changing and affordable products. With a focus on sustainable solutions, such as portable solar lights, water filters and improved cook stoves, people are able to reduce indoor smoke, have access to better quality water and light, use less kerosene and save money.

Help join our crew of pollinators and help me take a year off working to make money and instead help kick-start a new city of opportunities for Pollinate Energy in Kolkata.  A new city for Pollinate means potentially thousands of more people in Kolkata’s slums will have access to life-changing products like solar-powered lights and water-filtration systems (with more products planned to come in the next year). As a not for profit social business, Pollinate is self-funding and only asks for charitable donations when it is ready to upscale and expand to a new city like Kolkata.

With my city Co-founder Boris, and the many other dedicated people involved – we will help expand and upscale Pollinate Energy's third city up to a strong sustainable position in the next 12 months with your help.

Check out a short enlightening video on Pollinate Energy India's work. 

The Impact: Better health, lower costs, increased productivity and carbon emission reductions, all help create much improved living conditions for thousands of people to get out of energy poverty.

  • Millions of Indians live without electricity, many of them in urban slums. The polluting and toxic fumes from the kerosene lamps many families depend on are the second cause of mortality of children and women in India. In addition, buying the costly fuel to power the lamps eats up a significant percentage of their humble incomes. Kerosene lamps produce a very weak source of light; the children cannot do their homework after it get dark and parents are limited to the most basic tasks which lowers their productivity and possibilities of generating income at home at night.
  • Millions of these same people live without safe drinking water, making them chronically ill and malnourished.

Pollinate Energy India’s Record of progress so far just in Bangalore and Hyderabad has already sold 8,963 lights, served 41,299, saved 34.6m Rupees, and conserved 1.62m kg of carbon emissions.

We need to reach a goal of $5,000 for operations in Kolkata and we need your donations to help make it happen! 

Currently based in Bangalore, and Hyderabad – Pollinate plans to provide sustainable solutions to slum communities across 50 Indian cities by 2020. The next step of this ambitious adventure is expanding to Kolkata in May 2015. As a City Co-Founder, this is where I will play a part and your funds will be put towards the first step of the expansion, allowing us to pay for the initital costs of setting up the hive.

The first thing to do in Kolkata is set up what Pollinate call the Hive: it's where we work from, host other volunteers and live to make this happen.  Starting up a new city for operations is the largest single outgoing cost Pollinate makes, and where your donation to get this started will make the biggest difference to its success. 

Where your money will go:

This will directly help us set up operations, which will be financially self-sustainable after 12-13 months, thanks to the revenue from the sale of products.

Once the Hive is located, and set up by your donations, we will begin our work on the ground in Kolkata to:

  • Recruit and train Pollinators from the local communities to carry out community engagement and sales (paid for by micro-financing);
  • Organise the volunteering programs of the many amazing people who come over volunteer their time as well to help Pollinate with important projects;
  • Develop collaborative partnerships with local organisations;
  • Managing operations, finance and HR, and building the customer base.

Risks & Challenges

  • The greatest risk in expanding to Kolkata is not raising the funds required to start the Hive.  Once this is overcome the business model used by Pollinate Energy has proven itself effective in Hyderabad and Bangalore already, and is backed by the UN.  My plan to solve this problem is to ask as many generous people with varying incomes to give what they can, and I know the people I know are givers, each and everyone of you.
  • If you cant give anything, please take the time to advocate for Pollinate and pass this on to as many people as you possibly can.  The more people who know about this the better for everyone involved especially Kolkata’s poorest – who will be better off because you took the time to tell someone use this link or share with the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Also you can switch to Pollinate Power and support renewable energy and life saving technology in Australia and India!

This is your chance to light up a life.

$20 lights up a household, $100 lights up a whole family, and $500 will light up an entire community.

*If you are in Australia and pay via the Paypal option, these donations are also tax deductible, so get in before June 30 to get your end of financial year kickback!

story:
vs.   

The idea is to create a workout for adults that will serve as entertainment too! In a society where adults are constantly encouraged to be sedentary, obese, or simply make unhealthy food choices, Eniale is the way out! 

Eniale Fit Party!

What is it? Outdoor Fitness Classes, DJ's, food vendors, clothing vendors and more!

Who's it for? Adults 18+ of all exercise levels. Eniale personal trainers and group fitness instructors will safely push you to your max! 

*Fitness professionals will meet new clients*
*Vendors will  make more customers*
*Participants will get a great workout, make new friends, and hear good music*

Where is it? Los Angeles, California

Why Do We Need Your Help?

Some costs include:

-Location: Many locations were unable to host the event due to the noise it will create, traffic, the amount of people, the time of day, equipment used etc. I have found an amazing location that has agreed to host the festival and is excited about it, but it is not free. 

-Insurance: Hosting workouts are fun, but they have to be safe too! After working with the Los Angeles Police Department, Fire Department, Fitness Insurance Companies, we have created a plan… but it's not cheap!

-Attendance: There is nothing worse than a party of one...Public relations and marketing are costly, but we need it.

-Plus: Exercise equipment, sound, power, decor, staging and more. 

HOW DOES ENIALE FIT INTO THE COMMUNITY?

America's need to exercise = 100%

Children's need to see parents healthy = 100%

Eniale Classes = accessible, relatable, maintainable & achievable

Exercise + Food + Music = Best Workout Ever= Eniale Fitness Festival!

Please support the movement! (Literally!)

Register for Classes, Become a Volunteer, Vendor or an Instructor.

Get involved!

www.EnialeFitness.com

story:
In today’s economy, every penny and every dime counts. For many of us saving 10-20% is a welcoming offer. But stores and brands have put up a tremendous amount of hurdles and requirements just to save a few dollars. Coupons are difficult to save and keep track of, daily deal emails are usually for products that most of us don’t need, and loyalty cards make you check-in and earn points just to get a free cup of coffee. Getting a discount should be as easy breathing.

If you don't use coupons, dislike daily deals, and rarely use loyalty cards then you're one of tens of millions of Americans who feel the same way. Even though the combined industry of all three is over $100 billion, all three industries have been in decline for years.

Some of the main reasons constantly cited by consumers as to why they don't use coupons, daily deals or loyalty cards is because coupons are difficult to organize and constantly expire, daily deals are usually product irrelevant to them, and loyalty cards require too much time and hassle just to earn a small reward.

wRipple, www.mywripple.com is a completely new way for people to save. wRipple allows users to share an offer that they receive from a merchant with their friends on social media. This sharing feature, gives our users the power to get a discount on anything that they are buying at any time. This on-demand discount is done without our users needing coupons, or a daily deal, or even a loyalty card. Our users just need our app and a willingness to share. 

The reason that merchants are willing to give our users a substantial discount is because our users will allow them, via the wRipple software to auto-post a one-time first person message to their social media accounts that the user linked to wRipple. This message also includes an offer from that merchant that the user's friends and connections to use. If one of their friends "likes" or "shares" the post, then even more people can take advantage of the offer.

wRipple gives the merchant the ability to get directly in front of the audience that they covet most - the friends and connections of their existing customers 

And we give our users the ability to save on-demand without the hassles of coupons, daily deals, or loyalty cards.

I designed wRipple for my wife.

When my wife found out she was pregnant with our first child, she decided that it was time to save more money. Raising a child especially living in New York was very expensive. And as any parent knows infants need a lot of diapers. My wife cut out as many coupons as she can. She saved every discount mailer from every national baby chain stores and downloaded every coupon app, daily deal app, and loyalty card that she could find.

But for some uncanny reason, every time she went to these national baby chain store, she would either forget the coupon or the coupon was expired. Coupon apps weren't very helpful since she could never find a coupon for a specific product when she actually needed it. And as much as my wife would have loved to get 75% off a massage, she didn't have the time and didn't want to pre-purchase a deal when she didn't even know what her plan was for the next day. Loyalty cards were not at all helpful. Especially since it takes an average of 9 months to get enough points to earn a reward.

I knew that there had to be a better way for people like my wife to save and get a discount without having to save a coupon, buy a daily deal, or earn points. I knew that there had to be a way to get a discount without all these hassles and jumping through all these hoops. I knew that there had to be a lot of other people out there who also didn't like coupons, no longer used daily deals, and don't use all the loyalty cards that they sign up for. 

I conceptualized wRipple, www.mywripple.com for people like my wife. And I knew that I didn't have all the answers so I solicited three of my friends that had different areas of expertise to help be build it.

We sketched out the idea, poked holes through the business model and came up with a solution that simplified getting a discount for a consumer and simplified offering a discount through viral marketing for a merchant.

We believed that if we empower people with the ability to get a discount on-demand whenever they want, that they will in-turn pass along these offers to their friends. We believed that the power of our friends and connections linked together by social media can be the engine that drives our ability to save without ever having to cut out another coupon, or purchase another daily deal, or be required to "check-in" or earn points. 

Since our approach was completely new and there are literally no companies that socialize offers and social media marketing the way we do, we wanted to be responsible for the initial huge risk. So, we put in our own money and sweat and tears to build the first app prototype.

Then nine months later wRipple was born. Our app is currently live and available in the Apple App store. https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/wripple/id969586602?mt=8

We now need your help to make our prototype the norm in the world of shopping. We now need your help to simplify and transform the way we all can get a discount. We need your help to market - get new users, and bring on new merchants.

wRipple has the ability to transform the discount industries.

Our feature of on-demand socialized discounts without hassles is new to the discount industries.

And with just one post, a merchant has the ability to get in front of hundreds and potentially thousands of the most highly coveted and valuable lead base - the friends and connections of their existing customers.

Like other recently and highly successful companies (Uber and Snapchat, for example) have done, we're delivering significantly more value to our users and merchants by simplifying an industry. 

While there are a lot of competitors out there from coupon companies, daily deal sites, and loyalty cards, we believe that the simplicity of our model can disrupt all three of these industries. All three of these industries are in a steady decline. Less than 1% of all coupons generated or printed are ever used and even though most people have close to 30 different loyalty cards, we use less than 1/3rd of them. And if you're one of the people, like my wife that no longer use coupons, daily deals, or loyalty cards then you know why. 

We are looking to raise $500,000 in increase marketing, hire more sales people, and improve our app and even start work on the next generation. We want to get wRipple to ever major and minor city in the U.S and eventually the world but we need your help. Once we reach our goal- 60% of the funds will go towards marketing and hiring sales people, 30% will go towards software development, and the remaining 10% for a rainy day. We believe that with your help, we can onboard over 100,000 new users and over 1,000 merchants. 

And when you help, you'll be part of our wRipple family. We'll mention you on our website, add a caricature of you in our next video, clothe you in wRipple gear, and treat you like one of the family.

We also need you to tell all your friends, family and connections to sign up for wRipple by sending them this link:

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/wripple/id969586602?mt=8

From all the wRipple team and family, we thank you for your support.

story:
It's time for me to pay it forward in return for all the help I received after a spinal cord injury at age 18.  There are thousands of people in the US and abroad with injuries who will benefit from what I've learned over the last 25 years thriving with an injury. It's time for me to share this experience and guide as many of them as possible through this challenging time in their lives." 

This Summer, on behalf of a nonprofit to promote sports, recreation and employment for people with disabilities, I'll be speaking to a minimum of nine SCI rehab hospitals, events and youth organizations. I'll be visiting and presenting at several hospitals and locations throughout the US.

I'm driving a truck adapted by Ryno Mobility and DriveMaster Corp. and pulling a 20 foot trailer converted for wheelchair access travel. 

Please share this adventure through any and all of your social media connections. Including email, Facebook, twitter, YouTube and Instagraham. All of the platforms you love and enjoy. This IndieGogo site will allow you to get involved, contribute and share.

Imagine how your support will help someone through the trials and tribulations of a devastating injury. Your contribution will allow people with injuries to see how full their lives can be. It will show them how they might still drive a four-wheel-drive truck, skydive, ski or go white water rafting. It will show them how they might travel the world. It will provide them with a positive view to the future! You can help us accomplish these goals.

We can easily be found, followed and shared in the following places:

Where It All Began: Below social media links.

Website    http://www.beyondwheels.org/

Twitter  https://twitter.com/beyondwheels

Facebook https://www.facebook.com/pages/Beyond-Wheels/644301052272728

YouTube  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcXWSVJ_sX2arDgLIArGaQw

Phone 732-895-2610

Where It All Began

It's early on a bright warm summer morning just outside of Denver. I'm a young man of 19. It's June of 1989,  I'm wide-eyed and smiling from ear to ear in front of an itinerary of events. The activities include water skiing, hot air ballooning, sailing, camping, canoeing, and white water rafting. I begin to feel as if I have entered an extreme sports summer camp. I add my name to all these events and the fun begins. But I am not at an extreme summer camp. Instead, I have recently been admitted to Craig Hospital,  a rehab facility for individuals with spinal cord injuries and head trauma.

Only months before. It’s a dark night in October . The year is 1988. There are four young men. They’re 18. And there knocking back a few Budweiser’s. At midnight, one of boys has what he thinks is a brilliant idea. He says, let’s go visit Kevin at Stockton college. Freshman in search of a party. Yeah right! A brilliant idea. The passenger steps inside his dream car. It’s A white Nissan 300ZX Turbo. The driver jams his foot on the floor and the passenger is pinned back into his seat. It’s like a roller coaster. They are rocketing down the Highway at 120 miles an hour.

Because they’re teenagers, they're more thrilled than they are scared. 18-year-old geniuses. The driver slows at a toll. Once through, the passenger is once again thrown back into the seat. The passenger sits up, looks over his shoulder, and what do you think he sees? That’s right. Red white and blue police lights. What does the driver do? Slowdown? Pullover? No. That would make too much sense. He speeds up in an attempt to escape. He grabs the steering wheel and jerks it to exit the Highway. But they don’t. They don’t! The Turbo jumps a curb. It hit’s a small tree. The tree collapses. The Turbo flips over and since the passenger Charles is not wearing a seatbelt, He's ejected from the vehicle, thrown wildly through the air 100 feet. His neck breaks! He's hit with a permit spinal cord injury. Yes! I was the passenger on that tragic night.

The rehab process, from the time of my accident and through long years is long hard work, but gradually I come by answers. By the time I finish SCI rehab, I have a new awareness and new tools to deal with my life altering injury. Most importantly I now know that the glass is still more than half full. I know that despite the new physical considerations, there are still incredible opportunities available to to myself and people with similar injuries. 

The new restrictions from the paralyzing spinal cord injury are significant, but with the help of giant hearted individuals and incredible programs, there is enough to keep most people with injuries busy and fulfilled for many lifetimes. This Indiegogo campaign is inspired by what myself and others has learned. It's inspired by the desire to pass it on and help others.

The accident creates all kinds of challenges. How will I take care of myself? How will I get a job? How will I even motivate myself to get out of bed every day? But in retrospect there are incredible opportunities that came out of that terrible night. Thousands of people a year face similar "new realities." This tour, this Indiegogo campaign, exists to help those individuals prosper under their difficult circumstances as soon as possible.

The money raised will go to cover expenses for the trip. Transportation, support, promotion, and daily expenses. The money raised in the campaign will also cover inspirational materials and tools for audience members. These materials and tools will help individuals improve their learning curve while dealing with challenges related to their injuries.

Please contact us and follow us:

Website    http://www.beyondwheels.org/

Twitter  https://twitter.com/beyondwheels

Facebook https://www.facebook.com/pages/Beyond-Wheels/644301052272728

YouTube  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcXWSVJ_sX2arDgLIArGaQw

Phone 732-895-2610

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kimmi, although I go by Madie. I am the owner of Madiecakes, a home business where I make and sell bath bombs, soaps, and more. I make everything myself, down to the labels for each of my products. 

Having my own home business has done a great deal for me. I am able to stay at home with my youngest while I work on being able to help provide for my family. I have severe social phobia and social anxiety and going out into the world is often scary for me. Now I am able to be myself and that includes being creative and working towards a goal. I love what I do and I am very passionate about it. Very slowly I am opening up, whether it is making youtube videos with my daughter or entering soap contests. 

My main reason for wanting to get this bath bomb machine is so that I have more time to spend with my family, even if its an hour or two. I work 7 days a week and sometimes all day and night. Being the only employee means I have a lot more of a work load. While I love what I do I find that I am often missing out on outings and trips to the Zoo because I have orders to fill. With this machine I would be able to get a few days worth of bath bombs made! One of the other reasons I would love this machine is because it would allow me to pump out A LOT of bath bombs which would mean I could start stocking up and attending farmers markets and craft fairs, which means I can sell more products. 

What We Need & What You Get

This is what I am hoping to get:

  • B-3 Bomber bath bomb machine
  • 3 different bath bomb molds, a 1.7 diameter, a 2.75, and a cupcake!
  • I plan to have fun, soapy perks for those who contribute. If I do not reach 100% of my funding I plan to use whatever is funded towards the cost of the bath bomb machine and the molds. 

The Impact

The difference your contribution will make:

  • I work 7 days a week, some times 12+ hours a day trying to fill orders. I have no employees and I make everything myself. Having one of these will help allow me to have more time to spend with my family, which would be wonderful. 
  • My business has taken off faster than anyone could have imagined, this will only help me prepare for farmers markets and craft fairs. 


Other Ways You Can Help


  • Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
SPACE

424 Gates Ave. 
Brooklyn, NY 11216

HOUSING will open its doors September 23, 2017.
 

Historically speaking, there has been no room for the “other” in the euro-centric art canon. Major institutional collections in the US have widely excluded black artists for decades, despite the fact that without black artists there would be no modernism. Artists of color are widely expected to maintain a rhetoric that focuses on intersectional issues, while white artists are afforded the freedom to prioritize their own dialogue. 

Because the "other" carries with it an overwhelming amount of weight, it is difficult, if not impossible, for marginalized artists to find the right languages to use, or the appropriate platforms to speak on. The problem here is that the margins are often where the most crucial work is being done. When the very systems for visibility are always already co-opted by White Supremacy, it is unsurprising that this whole terrain is difficult to navigate.

"Even the nominal inclusion of young Black artists in predominantly white institutional art spaces does not translate into substantive representation."
— Olubukola Gbadegesin 
 

HOUSING is a place for art in the Bed-Stuy neighborhood of Brooklyn, New York.


Part of our motivation is to support artistic practices & aesthetic experiences that contour the limits of visibility, & advance the conditional inclusion of artists of color.

We are opening a six hundred square foot platform for discourse, for critical commentary, & for the exhibition of some of the most crucial work that is being done. We are opening a space for some of the most discerning artwork rarely shown elsewhere. Our aim at HOUSING is not to promote the exhibition or collection of this work as a specialized initiative, & it is not our aim to mitigate liberal guilt without the discomfort of actually challenging anything.

With an impressive exhibition series, performances, lectures & young artist workshops ahead, HOUSING requires the support of its community to offset the opening costs & rental agreements. By providing any contribution to HOUSING, you are effectively funding the continuation of cultural programming in Bed-Stuy.

 


 

SUPPORT 

Your contributions will assist with the opening costs & operating supplies required to facilitate the unique program forthcoming at  HOUSING, including but not limited to:


signage; interior space refurbishment; the proper outfitting of a storage area for artworks; the purchase of a color/laser printer; general rental costs; electric & other utilities; the shipment & insurance of artworks; exhibition refreshments; artist & lecturer honorariums; the purchase of display equipment such as televisions/projectors for media works; 3-D printing; flight costs for artists &/or lecturers; community dinners; marketing materials & advertising costs;PA system rental & audio equipment for performances; the purchase of basic tools & hanging hardware; assistance with the fabrication of artist's works, continued payment for any & all freelancers, designers, producers, DJs, photographers or otherwise unlisted creative labor put into the space.

We are eternally grateful  for any amount of generosity you are able to show HOUSING, & promise to offer in return: 

an unprecedented exhibition platform for artists of color; affordable rental fees for various events & production purposes; a community gathering space; a number of purposeful HOUSING related products included herein; a performance series; young artist workshops & more.

If we don't reach our entire goal, we are still fully committed to the production of an impressive exhibition series. Additional funds we receive beyond our goal will be instrumental to the realization of artists' works.

Even if you can't make a donation, please spread the word about HOUSING. 
We honestly appreciate any contribution of time or resources to the ongoing efforts of the space.

 

UPCOMING

KHARI JOHNSON-RICKS,  BRANDON DREW HOLMES , 
GINSSIYO APARA, KALI FLOWERS, PASTISCHE LUMUMBA
SEP 23—OCT 23 2017

PARKER BRIGHT, HAMISHI FARAH, 
SEAN-KIERRE LYONS, BRI WILLIAMS
OCT 28—NOV 18 2017

KEIJAUN THOMAS
NOV 20—DEC 01 2017

RAFIA SANTANA
DEC 2017

AMERICAN ARTIST
JAN 2018
story_txt:
SPACE
424 Gates Ave. Brooklyn, NY 11216
HOUSING will open its doors September 23, 2017. 
Historically speaking, there has been no room for the “other” in the euro-centric art canon. Major institutional collections in the US have widely excluded black artists for decades, despite the fact that without black artists there would be no modernism. Artists of color are widely expected to maintain a rhetoric that focuses on intersectional issues, while white artists are afforded the freedom to prioritize their own dialogue. 
Because the "other" carries with it an overwhelming amount of weight, it is difficult, if not impossible, for marginalized artists to find the right languages to use, or the appropriate platforms to speak on. The problem here is that the margins are often where the most crucial work is being done. When the very systems for visibility are always already co-opted by White Supremacy, it is unsurprising that this whole terrain is difficult to navigate.
"Even the nominal inclusion of young Black artists in predominantly white institutional art spaces does not translate into substantive representation."— Olubukola Gbadegesin  
HOUSING is a place for art in the Bed-Stuy neighborhood of Brooklyn, New York.
Part of our motivation is to support artistic practices & aesthetic experiences that contour the limits of visibility, & advance the conditional inclusion of artists of color.
We are opening a six hundred square foot platform for discourse, for critical commentary, & for the exhibition of some of the most crucial work that is being done. We are opening a space for some of the most discerning artwork rarely shown elsewhere. Our aim at HOUSING is not to promote the exhibition or collection of this work as a specialized initiative, & it is not our aim to mitigate liberal guilt without the discomfort of actually challenging anything.With an impressive exhibition series, performances, lectures & young artist workshops ahead, HOUSING requires the support of its community to offset the opening costs & rental agreements. By providing any contribution to HOUSING, you are effectively funding the continuation of cultural programming in Bed-Stuy.
 


 

SUPPORT 
Your contributions will assist with the opening costs & operating supplies required to facilitate the unique program forthcoming at  HOUSING, including but not limited to:
signage; interior space refurbishment; the proper outfitting of a storage area for artworks; the purchase of a color/laser printer; general rental costs; electric & other utilities; the shipment & insurance of artworks; exhibition refreshments; artist & lecturer honorariums; the purchase of display equipment such as televisions/projectors for media works; 3-D printing; flight costs for artists &/or lecturers; community dinners; marketing materials & advertising costs;PA system rental & audio equipment for performances; the purchase of basic tools & hanging hardware; assistance with the fabrication of artist's works, continued payment for any & all freelancers, designers, producers, DJs, photographers or otherwise unlisted creative labor put into the space.
We are eternally grateful  for any amount of generosity you are able to show HOUSING, & promise to offer in return: 
an unprecedented exhibition platform for artists of color; affordable rental fees for various events & production purposes; a community gathering space; a number of purposeful HOUSING related products included herein; a performance series; young artist workshops & more.If we don't reach our entire goal, we are still fully committed to the production of an impressive exhibition series. Additional funds we receive beyond our goal will be instrumental to the realization of artists' works.
Even if you can't make a donation, please spread the word about HOUSING. We honestly appreciate any contribution of time or resources to the ongoing efforts of the space.
 
UPCOMING
KHARI JOHNSON-RICKS,  BRANDON DREW HOLMES , GINSSIYO APARA, KALI FLOWERS, PASTISCHE LUMUMBASEP 23—OCT 23 2017PARKER BRIGHT, HAMISHI FARAH, SEAN-KIERRE LYONS, BRI WILLIAMSOCT 28—NOV 18 2017KEIJAUN THOMASNOV 20—DEC 01 2017RAFIA SANTANADEC 2017AMERICAN ARTISTJAN 2018

story:
We are looking to raise £1000 to pay for rental of language interpretation equipment (headphones and radio transmitters) and for interpreters to give simultaneous translations in English, Turkish and Arabic for a summit on the future of the Middle East

A summit like no other!

Every year leaders of the 20 richest nations gather to run the world their way. Now there is an alternative G20 where people, not politicians, come first.

We are not about protesting and saying no. The Alternative G20 is about debating possible, realistic alternatives. We are not looking to blame anyone for the past, but to work together and share ideas for a positive future.

You can find out more about the Alternative G20 and the summit from our website:

 http://alternativeg20.org/istanbul.php

In Istanbul, Turkey this August, Alternative G20 will be hosting a summit on the future of the Middle East. We will gather ordinary people, representatives from NGOs and academics from all over the Middle East region to have their say on the future of their region. The purpose of the summit is to debate and develop real ideas for a better, peaceful Middle East. In other words: Allowing the people who live there to shape their own futures.

We have a team of organisers from various countries in the Middle East, including Afghanistan, Lebanon, Libya, Morocco and Syria. This ensures the summit will include and reflect the concerns and issues of the people who actually live and work in Middle East countries; not  politicians.  

We have a great line up of speakers including:

Jaynice Del Rosario - the Chair of Gender Development at Peace Corps in Ethiopia, 

Joanne Baker, the head of the UK Charity 'Child Victims of War' 

Abdul Ghafoor, a refugee campaigner from Afghanistan. 

The summit is a great opportunity to unite people in a common goal: A peaceful and productive future for the Middle East driven by the people, not politicians and global enterprise. 

By providing interpreters and equipment, we will be able to offer everyone the opportunity to join the discussion regardless of their language skills. We believe that’s important to ensure everyone gets to take part in the summit either in person or online from anywhere in the world.

story:
Short Summary

What is Derigo Ltd? 
Derigo was co-founded in 2014 by five good friends (Balázs, Dániel, Dávid, Péter, and Szabolcs) to deliver a service that wants to offer alternative travel programs, by proposing more authentic, more fun trips for travelers from all around the world.
Our Mission :
Our mission is to enhance local trips organized by local people and make it more achievable to share the self-organized trips using Derigo's platform, and to offer high quality, adventurous trips on the best prices.

Why we need the money

The raised money will be use to:
 - Increase our visibility through advertising investment;
 - Develop and improve the quality of our services;
 - Reach more local guides and more travelers all around the globe;
 - Create a discount card for our customers

The Impact

Our team uses technology to get the most meaningful and friendly interaction between the local organizers and their users. The power lies in our signature social travelers’ society and as it talks for itself: in the perfect world of Derigo the local organizers gets their fees straight from the consumers to host programs whilst the travelers receives their well-deserved quality local programs through a reliable channel. The organization of a trip or booking an authentic program becomes a simple, one-touch experience which creates a win-win situation for everyone. Moreover it offers a possibility for those who like organizing trips, make long-lasting friendships and passionate about culture whilst getting to know travelers.
With your help, we will be able to make our dream true and unite travelers from all over the world.

Risks & Challenges

The main difficulty in our project is that people don't trust new platforms like this very easily. We have to bring more locals to the site and therefore increase our visitors. 

Why are we capable of overcoming these hurdles?

  • We have a dedicated to our cause team, that is always aiming for the best
  • We have a lot of partners who can help us succeed our goals

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help but don’t know how? Sharing this opportunity with people you know is a huge blessing to us!

Whether it be someone you think may be interested in joining Derigo, or someone you think may want to partner with us as a team member or by the utilization of one of our many perks! 

When things are good, they affect more than just the people involved, and we believe Derigo is ready to shine a bright light all over the world!

story:
Summary:

Young People of Color Incorporated is a grassroots organization dedicated to the acknowledgement, achievement and advancement of youth POC. Utilizing a 10 lesson curriculum that will culminate in several trips related to the performance arts, multi-culturalism and politics, and finally an end of semester talent showcase, it is our goal to foster a sense of empowerment and promote critical thinking and creativity to ensure that our youth are able to directly affect their futures and their communities in positive ways. The summer initiative aims to reach 40-50 NYC youth grades 6-12.

Need Statement:

The purpose of this program is to instill critical thinking skills, inspire and empower students of color and encourage them to excel in school while also honing their artistic skills effectively in a progressive and enriching environment. Most students, especially students of color, are guided down a path that either focuses heavily on academics, and stresses the importance of book smarts, or focuses on some sort of vocational skill that can ensure employment and a steady income. Either path leaves the student with little or no time or energy for creative endeavors with the exception of a few clubs or teams the school or community may offer in the afternoon or on weekends. Since we at YPOC understand the importance of allowing our children's creatvity to blossom, and it has been scientifically proven time and time again that children who are involved in extra curricular activities, especially those related to the performance arts, actually fare better academically than their peers without access to creativity enriching experiences, we aim to make academic achievement and creative forms of expression a dynamic duo rather than an odd couple. 

In a society full of youth who have access to a plethora of negativity in the form of reality television, an ever declining standard of music, the internet, and various other modes of transmitting negative depictions of people of color, our men, our women, our children and our communities, it is up to us as educators, parents, community members, family members and friends to lead by example and teach our children that not only are they capable of anything, but that they can actually achieve their dreams as individuals and as a people through awareness, empowerment, leadership and action. Whether they'd like to become a fashion designer or a neuroscientist we must instill in our youth a sense of self worth and agency so that they can take charge of their lives and make the most of the gifts they have been given. We must make them aware that their life itself, no matter how troubled they may be, is a gift, and that it is never too late to start over and be the best you can be.

Goals and Objectives:

The 3 primary goals of the YPOC summer initiative are:

1. To instill a sense of empowerment in youth POC. Through enriching dialogue, experiences and examinations of self and society using pop culture, the performance arts, current events, history and other means of examining the role of POC in their own lives and as members of the Black Diaspora.

2. To discover and hone each student's inate creative talents. Whether they are a singer or an architect, we aim to allow their creativity to flourish as their minds open to new ideas so that they are expanding their whole mind and not just their left brain. Through performance, deep reflective writing and creative seminars we aim to give students an opportunity to figure out what they like and realize their full potential in that area.

3. To instill critically thinking minds. The main objective of the YPOC summer initiative is to make sure each and every student leaves the program with a questioning mind and a thirst for knowledge. As a community, we are often unaware of what isn't between the covers of a magazine or on the news, but a desire to know more about everything, and an understanding of the importance of concepts like empowerment and activism, will hopefully help create a generation of future thinkers, doers and leaders with the book smarts to know how to solve problems, the creativity it will take to defeat issues related to those problems and the empowerment to be the change they want to see in this world without fear.

In addition to the main objectives, other significant objectives include improving students writing and public speaking abilities, improving their ability to learn in new ways and expanding their knowledge of history, society and themselves.

Program Design:

The YPOC summer initiative curriculum was created by YPOC founder Tajh Sutton. As a childhood education major at Brooklyn College with a concentration in English, a mother of two, a political activist, and an aspiring performance artist and model, my aim was to take all the things that have helped expand my understanding of life and added to my happiness, and put them together to create a holistic edu-cultural program that would benefit the collective. 

Future Goals:

If successful in all goals, the YPOC summer initiative aims to branch out into an academic school year program, such as an elective or after school program option, in addition to the summer program. There is currently a senior staff of one, with an alternating list of volunteers providing assistance when needed. We are currently building support for sponsorship and partnering with like minded businesses, programs and initiatives for funding and implementation in order to hire a consistant staff and provide compensation as well as provide our students with enriching opportunities outside of their schools and communities.

Excess funds raised will be stored in a YPOC account and used exclusively for YPOC initiatives, events & expansion including but not limited to the following:

Equipment & crew to help create a promotional video as well as launch YPCTV & spread YPOC content & dialogue

YPOC Freedom & Fun Summer Camp 2015 

YPOC Summer Camp Farewell Student Showcase/ Exhibition/ Graduation

YPOC Implimentation in public schools & community centers beginning Fall 2015

YPOC Saturday Sessions (Ongoing according to demand)

YPOC 2nd Annual Self Love Sessions (Black History Month 2016)

YPOC 2nd Annual Mothers Day Brunch (May 2016)

YPOC 2nd Annual Fathers Day Brunchv(June 2016)

YPOC UnityFest Block Party Fundraiser (TBA)

YPOC Parent Support Groupt (TBA)

YPOC Community Potluck (TBA)

Stipends for YPOC volunteers


The summer initiative is just one of many projects in a long line of endeavors to enrich our youth, our families, our communities and the world at large!

Check out the photo gallery to see what we've been up to since our first indiegogo campaign in 2012 where we raised $1,100 and the YPOC journey began. (You can view our previous campaign using the link below.)

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/young-people...

Please like, share & donate whatever you can. 

We can do anything when we do it together!

With love, sincerity, determination & high hopes,


Tajh 'Afrocenchick' Sutton

Founder

Loc Love Lives Here

Best of Locs Awards

Young People of Color Incorporated

Mother- Model- Musician- Educator- Activist- Writer- Step & Dance Instructor


afrocenchick.wordpress.com

instagram.com/youngpeopleofcolorinc

twitter.com/youngpplofcolor

facebook.com/ypocinc

youngpeopleofcolorinc.tumblr.com

story:
Handmade Cans is iconic!

Handmade Cans is the stomping ground of the creative small business scene in Cairns. Our contributers range from those who are known, to those that will be.
* We've been around about 2 years now - in the cute little shop on Sheridan Street.
* We've taken the leap and decided to move into the CBD. We need foot traffic and more space! Workshop space, market space, reading space!
* We have a HUGE kick with being selected to play in the Cairns Regional Council's Urban Spaces Program. This means the move will happen with a BANG! (This doesn't get us $$, just support)
* You have seen us featured in the Oasis Magazine, The Cairns Eye, ECOFiesta, Cairns Creative Crawl, JCU Leadership Series..
* You've also seen us on facebook and instagram - we are photo addicts! And why wouldn't you be with so much awesome to share!  
You know us, you love us, now support us! 

What We Need & What You Get

* A coffee machine - and set up - to add to the Cairns caffeine scene. We need to buy our set up so we can support our local roasters - and provide you with the best buzz while you shop small.

We think this might be around the $5000 mark. We could be wrong. You might need to correct us. 

REWARD - Every contribtion over $20 gets a loyalty card that gets you a FREE upsize EVERY SINGLE TIME. Go hard or go home hey?

(Work that out - visit us every weekday on your way work - you save $130 a year!!!)



*Canning in for the rent - CBD costs more - but here's the upside - no more trolling the block looking for parking - saving you $$ and our environment. 

You're welcome. (Our preferred space has parking - our own parking. #inserthappydance)

Chucking in will also help us keep costs down for our small business suppliers.  This means we can make more magic happen, and keep them doing what they do best, so you can buy the very best. 

Reward - Can in over $50 and you will get a membership to the Can Club.

Priority invites to workshops and events, your picture on the wall, first dibs at new stock. 

And the Loyalty Coffee Card - saving you $130 a year :O I know right!!!!

I'll even start a facey group so we can gush at you regularly!!!


Now - here's how this rolls. If we raise $10 000 towards the rent we can drop the rental for the creatives by $5 a week, $15 000 gets $7.50 a week, $20 000 gets a whopping $10.00 a week discount! That's HUGE in the handmade world. 



Let's talk turkey

Small business is tough right now - across the country. We are fighting back - and fighting hard. We are looking to PUSH small business past the brink of cool. 

To make that happen - Handmade Cans is morphing. From a small shop of goodies, to a training ground. For skill sharing, and small business assistance. To a place where we can train each other to upcycle and create. Where you can spend quiet time reading local books, and for mobile entreprenures to share their air. 

  • We know Handmade Cans is a successful popular model.
  • We know people want to connect and share.
  • We know you need a home to drink coffee, and meet your friends.
  • We know you love quality handmade items.
  • We know we love our creatives and want them to shine!
  • We know you and we love you!!!!
  • Risks & Challenges

Let's be honest. Small business is tough. We know it. We've felt it.

We have been brainstorming, navel gazing, and this is what we've come up with.

* We need foot traffic, parking, income from training, income from markets, income from coffee/tea/food. 

We can make this all happen in a bigger premises. 

Our chosen new shop is bigger. It has foot traffic. A quiet room for workshops and book club. Storage. Parking. Visibility. 

* We also need to 'curate' more - so we will be working with our suppling creatives to up their game. To try new things. To work on their business. 

This is all capacity building - and we are in negotiations with all sorts of professionals to make this work. This also fuels other small businesses and adds to their bottom line. 

* We need staff - so we are working with an agency on providing a training ground for people in the region so that we are a pathway to confidence and success. We will be looking at engaging them long term. 

Though - we need $$ to do this - so we need to build our business and our sales.

We need courage. And we have that in spades. 

  • Other Ways You Can Help

Now, you may not be cashed up. And that is a-ok. 

We've worked it out - if each of our supporters chucked in $20 each - we should be more than right to lock our lease in, grab a great coffee machine, and even get security systems in place to protect our stock and update our POS system! All these things will kick us to cool town!

Share this on facebook and social media. Over, and over again. And tell your friends.

Find us a coffee machine!! 

Pop in when we've moved. Drink a cuppa, bring ALL your friends. Make us your regular. 

Share our posts on social media.

Tell your crafty friends to apply! They are the backbone of our business!

Make stuff and sign up with us! Play the game - it's fun and interactive! 

NOW GET PLEDGING ! We don't have much time to lock this all in and make it happen!!!!!

YOU ARE MAKING AMAZING THINGS HAPPEN!!

We think this might be around the $5000 mark. We could be wrong. You might need to correct us.

(Work that out - visit us every weekday on your way work - you save $130 a year!!!)



*Canning in for the rent - CBD costs more - but here's the upside - no more trolling the block looking for parking - saving you $$ and our environment. 
You're welcome. (Our preferred space has parking - our own parking. #inserthappydance)
Chucking in will also help us keep costs down for our small business suppliers.  This means we can make more magic happen, and keep them doing what they do best, so you can buy the very best. 
Reward - Can in over $50 and you will get a membership to the Can Club.
Priority invites to workshops and events, your picture on the wall, first dibs at new stock. 
And the Loyalty Coffee Card - saving you $130 a year :O I know right!!!!
I'll even start a facey group so we can gush at you regularly!!! 



Now - here's how this rolls. If we raise $10 000 towards the rent we can drop the rental for the creatives by $5 a week, $15 000 gets $7.50 a week, $20 000 gets a whopping $10.00 a week discount! That's HUGE in the handmade world. 


Let's talk turkey
 Small business is tough right now - across the country. We are fighting back - and fighting hard. We are looking to PUSH small business past the brink of cool. 
To make that happen - Handmade Cans is morphing. From a small shop of goodies, to a training ground. For skill sharing, and small business assistance. To a place where we can train each other to upcycle and create. Where you can spend quiet time reading local books, and for mobile entreprenures to share their air.   We know Handmade Cans is a successful popular model.
We know people want to connect and share.
We know you need a home to drink coffee, and meet your friends.
We know you love quality handmade items.
We know we love our creatives and want them to shine!
We know you and we love you!!!!

Risks & Challenges
  Let's be honest. Small business is tough. We know it. We've felt it.
We have been brainstorming, navel gazing, and this is what we've come up with.
* We need foot traffic, parking, income from training, income from markets, income from coffee/tea/food. 
We can make this all happen in a bigger premises. 
Our chosen new shop is bigger. It has foot traffic. A quiet room for workshops and book club. Storage. Parking. Visibility. 
* We also need to 'curate' more - so we will be working with our suppling creatives to up their game. To try new things. To work on their business. 
This is all capacity building - and we are in negotiations with all sorts of professionals to make this work. This also fuels other small businesses and adds to their bottom line. 
* We need staff - so we are working with an agency on providing a training ground for people in the region so that we are a pathway to confidence and success. We will be looking at engaging them long term. 
Though - we need $$ to do this - so we need to build our business and our sales.
We need courage. And we have that in spades.   
Other Ways You Can Help


 Now, you may not be cashed up. And that is a-ok. 
We've worked it out - if each of our supporters chucked in $20 each - we should be more than right to lock our lease in, grab a great coffee machine, and even get security systems in place to protect our stock and update our POS system! All these things will kick us to cool town!
   Share this on facebook and social media. Over, and over again. And tell your friends.Find us a coffee machine!! Pop in when we've moved. Drink a cuppa, bring ALL your friends. Make us your regular. Share our posts on social media.Tell your crafty friends to apply! They are the backbone of our business!Make stuff and sign up with us! Play the game - it's fun and interactive! NOW GET PLEDGING ! We don't have much time to lock this all in and make it happen!!!!!YOU ARE MAKING AMAZING THINGS HAPPEN!!

story:
In Latin America, women have become vital for economic growth. Without women's contribution in the marketplace, extreme poverty in the region would have been 30% higher. 

However, the participation of women in the labor market remains unequal to men and unequal along social classes among women. A key factor behind this is the double burden for women caused by the uneven distribution of family responsibilities. 

In the region, half of all women in paid work are in the informal sector, which becomes the only source of income that allows them to manage the dual responsibility as economic provider and family nurturer. 

Access to personal economic security is a source of self-esteem and a key element necessary to escape domestic violence, a problem that has affected one of every three women at some point of their lives. 

If women are given more flexible job opportunities in the formal market they will not only become less vulnerable, but they will develop their talent. A more balanced, talented work force will enhance and boost Latin America’s economic growth.  

We created GoGlam to combine our passion for beauty and tech in favor of one dream: to empower Latin American women to develop their talent. GoGlam is a mobile application that connects talented beauticians with working professional women looking for convenient beauty and wellness services delivered at their homes or offices. It allows working professional women to select the service, location, and beautician based on their availability, biographies and ratings. 

For us, GoGlam is more than just an app, it is a community of women helping women. It is an opportunity for talented women, heads of low income families in vulnerable locations, to become beauty micro entrepreneurs. They will earn an additional income, enjoy of flexible schedules, receive comprehensive training, and have access to our platform of shared knowledge. 

For our clients, GoGlam is the most convenient option that allows them to feel beautiful every day, at any time. Feeling beautiful enhances women's confidence, which is essential to demonstrate their talent and advance in their professional careers.

Help us raise $10,000 to make this dream come true for the first 50 GoGlam Beauticians in Lima and Bogota.

Funds raised will be used to:  

1. Find the most talented women head of families, coming from vulnerable areas in Lima and Bogota. 

2. Train them to become GoGlam beauticians.

3. Provide them the supplies they need to begin their journey as micro entrepreneurs in GoGlam.

Be a part of changing the lives of more women in Latin America today.
