story:
From the First Coo's and Giggles..

So let me start by introducing myself! I am Maria Mucci and I came from the adorable town of Bellmawr, NJ. I am a music-lover, business-minded and crafts-aficionado individual who has a passion for little ones.

Back in the Philippines when I was in high school, I started assisting Sunday School doing story-telling, singing songs, playing fun games with kids...and I loved every minute of it! I was also able to encourage the group of young people in our church to visit the children in underprivileged areas of our town, which we were able to do once or twice a month. Aside from doing fun activities with them, we would feed them snacks that we bought from our allowances.  Back at our house, I would gather chairs and tables, then call all the children in our neighborhood so I can help and teach them to read, write and do their homework.

Fast forward, I have met the most wonderful people in Straightline Ministries in Westville, NJ and has been a member for almost a decade now. I have the honor of working with amazing ladies in the Sunday School department. Later on, I was given the opportunity to create agendas that will improve our children ministry's program. It is my goal to help our church financially and for us to make a difference in these young ones' lives.


Being in the child care industry myself for years and the passion that I have for children, gave birth to the idea of a daycare center.




Learning the ABC's and Knowing the 123's

The growing number of parent(s) and women in the workforce has resulted to the increasing demand for child care. May it be a service from a family member, friend, babysitter or a daycare center, the need is apparent. And so we would like to take this opportunity to be a part of the industry and offer child care service to children 6 months to 3 1/2 years of age.



Our church recently acquired a building that has a classroom and a nursery room in the first floor and is perfect to care for these little ones! There are just a few things that need to be accomplished and improved on in order for us to be operational, such as:

  • Fire suppression system installation
  • Fencing in the lawn area
  • Some shelvings and re-painting




Our center's goal is, first, to provide a fun, educational and safe environment for kids. We want to team up with parents in developing the foundation for their children in an enjoyable and effective way and provide them a learning space where parents will have confidence that their kids are in a safe environment. Second, we would like to offer a very affordable child care service. As this is also our ministry, we want to help them by offering the lowest cost and the best quality of care in the area. And lastly, it is our goal to be actively part of the community. Our church is affiliated with Choices of the Heart, an organization that helps young individual(s) facing unplanned pregnancies; Isaiah54 Project, a non-profit in which one of the things they do is to provide services to women by helping build their self-esteem and prepare them for their purpose in life; and Food Bank of South Jersey that helps provide food and nutrition education to the people in need in the South Jersey region. The center would like to partner with these organizations to promote and strengthen community building.


The Boo-boo's and Potty-Trainings!

Like any other exciting endeavors, there will always be some boo-boo's that can happen especially for the crawlers and first-time walkers!


This is the first time that we will be venturing in a business and run a daycare center. There may be some hurdles and some trials-and-errors along the way, but we will use these to continually learn and develop plans that will improve the operation of the center as we help children, not just to "watch" them but to also effectively teach them. We have been communicating with mentors and people with daycare center experience for guidance and advice. The best team of people that possesses same passion and extensive experience in the child care industry will be hired to be a part of this challenging yet exciting journey! With perseverance, determination and collective skills of the team, we will be able to accomplish our goals.


Wheels on the Bus (go round and round)...

The funds that will be raised is going to help with the start-up requirements and operational expenses such as:

  • Purchase of supplies such as shelves, cribs, refrigerator, toys, educational materials, etc.
  • Meet the requirements in order to become operational as stipulated by the state such as Lead and Radon tests, etc.
  • Installation of a fire suppression system to make sure that we will have a safe place for children
  • Marketing
  • Help with the expenses of the center for the next 2 to 3 months of operation

Your donations are greatly appreciated in advance! We want to make sure that you are not just helping us but other people as well. Aside from the organizations that our church has been working with, we also teamed up with talented people that can offer their products and services as a way to help our venture. With your donations, you have a chance to choose from our list of wonderful perks! We have jewelries, Just Peachy Salsa from the Food Bank of South Jersey, online yoga classes and many more...

If you are unable to give monetary donation, it's okay! you can help us by spreading the word. Share us in Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other social networks. Every little help is greatly appreciated!

Please do not hesitate to reach us at josiahsclubhouse207@gmail.com!

Our success is measured by the smiles that we can give to the children and their parents and YOU ARE PART OF IT!

"I can do everything through Him, who gives me strength...."

story:
Hi! My name is Jason and I make furniture for families and businesses here in Austin, Texas. I'm a north Texas transplant and I started making tables out of my apartment a few years ago as a fun hobby. My intention in the beginning was never to start a full blown business, but I love what I do! I'm campaigning to raise money for machinery/tools to help make my product better, to shorten the time in making furniture and to make high quality/trendy furniture more affordable to the marketplace. While keeping an Earth-friendly mindset, I would like to use wood from the fallen trees from the recent floods here in central Texas and use reclaimed and repurposed wood from a local lumberyard. My next project is to began creating live edge pieces for tables! 

Lately, I've been very busy and have realized that I need to work smarter and need better equipment to meet deadlines and to keep up with demand. This is my first full year after being full-time after starting in August of last year and my sales are up 456% while heading into our busiest season!!! I have great Etsy reviews and have done furniture for many local businesses including Whole Foods. 

I think one the reasons why my products are doing so well is that people are tired of paying outrageous prices for tables. Also, tables are no longer made out of real wood anymore. They are mostly mass produced in a factory with no real originality or style. Here at my company, people get that one on one attention, the sometimes get to actually design what they want and it's nice that they can talk to an actual human being and not a recording. 

We just closed on the biggest order ever with a company in New York City and it's now time acquire a few items we don't currently have:

Bandsaw

Bandsawmill

Inventory

Table Saw w/ SawStop protection (so we don't lost our fingers)

Jointer

Biscuit Joiner

Kiln (home built)

Welder

And last on the list is time. Time to discover and create new ideas, to market/advertise more and for overall quality of life. At the end of the day, we all have families we would like to spend more time with. (well some of us ;) ) This money will allow us to do things we never thought possible. And if we don't meet our goal, we will still gather a few of these items and at worst, it's a great jumpstart to the business! Thanks for reading my story! 

PS - If you can't donate now, pass this link along and help me get the word out!

story:
Ahmed Dawabsheh is the only survivor of a horrible arson attack by extremist Israeli settlers.  He suffers from burns on 60% of his body, but no doubt the loss of his father, mother, and 18 month brother, Ali, hurts much more. 

He is only 5 years old. 

We can't bring back his mother or father or brother. We can't erase the burns that cover his body. We can't even ensure the culprits will be found. But we can ensure he has a future ahead of him. 

Please help us in taking care of this child, who has a very hard life ahead of him. Donate to ensure that his uncle will be able to provide for him the way he deserves.

We've contacted his uncle, who will be taking care of Ahmed, and he is overwhelmed by the support and by the campaigns set up for Ahmed. Be a part of the good in Ahmed's life, lets show him not all the world is unkind. 


More from the story:

Ahmed spends most of his time asleep due to the medications he receives. Once awake, he speaks and watches children's TV shows. Entrance to his room is strictly for family members only, due to the boy's condition.

"Alloush, Alloush, he would sometimes say in his sleep - calling his younger brother Ali," said Ahmed's aunt, Maryam. 

"That toddler who died when a firebomb was thrown on his house will not be able to answer Ahmed."

Maryam rarely leaves Ahmed's bedside, and told that the boy wakes up asking about his mother and why she hasn't come to visit him yet, as he does not know about her death yet. 

The five-year-old does know that his father is "now in heaven".

"Ahmed cries all the time but I try to console him," said Maryam. "Last Friday, on the day that his father was martyred as a result of his wounds, Ahmed woke up yelling 'they burned us... put the fire out... let me out'.

"The hardest thing we face is when Ahmed asks about his mother. We try to change the subject and console him.

'Rough days'
Riham's mother, Satira, cannot hide her grief and worry.

Riham's father, Hussein, tries to hide his sadness and anguish.

"They were a loving and understanding family," said Hussein. 

"Saad worked in construction while Riham worked as a math teacher. They lived a peaceful life until that terrorist attack burned them.

"I heard a loud explosion while I was on the roof of my house. I was really worried when I saw it was near my daughter's house. I frantically drove there. Everyone was trying to help and put out the fire. I'll never forget that scene."

Hussein continued: "Riham knew something had happened because she was awake for a while after arriving at the hospital until the sedative started to work. But she doesn't know the details of what happened to her family. She's been heavily sedated and unconscious ever since, and the doctors what to keep her like that due to the severity of her burns."


-BY al-Araby al-Jadeed (with some modification due to the mother's death)

story:
We're excited to introduce Fun Eating Devices to the world with our very first product, Sporkman! At Fed, we feed children and bring smiles to every mealtime with the goal of transforming mundane eating times into playful eating experiences. With every Fun Eating Device purchased, Fed will provide meals to children in need. It's that easy!

Funds from this Indiegogo campaign will go towards the production of two NEW-NEVER-BEFORE-SEEN fun eating devices that will feed even more children in need! We guarantee that your children (or you) have never eaten with utensils like this. We're basically giving kids and kids at heart permission to play with their food.


Every child has to eat–why not eat with a Fun Eating Device? It's fun, safe, limits contact with surface germs, and builds dexterity through cognitive play. No matter what rewards you decide to choose, we know there's a child in your life you can give a Fun Eating Device to and brighten their day. Also know that each rewards has a boost in meals provided to our global outreach partner, Stop Hunger Now. Not to mention, you'll be saving more money on a Sporkstix 2-pack if you contribute here on Indiegogo. 

We're a Colorado-based company founded in 2015 by two crazy designers and a levelheaded business woman who care deeply about the well-being of children everywhere.

At the beginning, our experience told us that we were onto something very big that had the potential of contributing to multiple facets of life– and like everything worthwhile, risks and challenges would come along for the ride. Our experience has also provided us with the hope of success, knowing that if we persevere through these obstacles, we would arrive victorious.

We have printed, tested, abused, and broken many prototypes over the course of a year before we were ready to share our design with the engineers at the factory. Our 3D printer also broke from the amount of prototypes we were printing (we were able to fix it)). We have tooled and retooled molds to ensure the products we offer the world pass every stress test required by the FDA and other government agencies. Materials have changed numerous times to not only pass FDA requirements, but to pass the requirements set forth by the parents and friends in our community.

We want the best for the children who interact with the products we create. Our products include the following features: 
•BPA Free 
•Recyclable 
•Food Safe 
•Dishwasher Safe 
•Limits Contact with Surface Germs 
•Increases Dexterity through Cognitive Play

After we conquer the challenges that come with producing the mold (which will be happening within a month), fulfillment will be fairly straightforward and our Indiegogo friends will receive their items on the date promised. Our initial run of a minimum order requirement of 3,600 units will be reordered immediately if we anticipate a surge of orders midway through our campaign. Everyone will receive their rewards on time!

If we meet our goal of $10,000, we will be able to reach our larger goal of $30,000 and begin tooling and mold production for two more products under the Fed brand. That's more awesomeness for you and the people in your life! Every product we create needs to help fund future products in order for us to grow organically.

We measure our success from the amount of meals we provide to children in need. Our goal for the end of the year is 7,200 meals. Help us blow that goal out of the water!

You can still make a difference if you're unable to contribute funds to this campaign. All you have to do it share it with your friends!
story_txt:
We're excited to introduce Fun Eating Devices to the world with our very first product, Sporkman! At Fed, we feed children and bring smiles to every mealtime with the goal of transforming mundane eating times into playful eating experiences. With every Fun Eating Device purchased, Fed will provide meals to children in need. It's that easy! 




Funds from this Indiegogo campaign will go towards the production of two NEW-NEVER-BEFORE-SEEN fun eating devices that will feed even more children in need! We guarantee that your children (or you) have never eaten with utensils like this. We're basically giving kids and kids at heart permission to play with their food.



Every child has to eat–why not eat with a Fun Eating Device? It's fun, safe, limits contact with surface germs, and builds dexterity through cognitive play. No matter what rewards you decide to choose, we know there's a child in your life you can give a Fun Eating Device to and brighten their day. Also know that each rewards has a boost in meals provided to our global outreach partner, Stop Hunger Now. Not to mention, you'll be saving more money on a Sporkstix 2-pack if you contribute here on Indiegogo. 



We're a Colorado-based company founded in 2015 by two crazy designers and a levelheaded business woman who care deeply about the well-being of children everywhere.





At the beginning, our experience told us that we were onto something very big that had the potential of contributing to multiple facets of life– and like everything worthwhile, risks and challenges would come along for the ride. Our experience has also provided us with the hope of success, knowing that if we persevere through these obstacles, we would arrive victorious.We have printed, tested, abused, and broken many prototypes over the course of a year before we were ready to share our design with the engineers at the factory. Our 3D printer also broke from the amount of prototypes we were printing (we were able to fix it)). We have tooled and retooled molds to ensure the products we offer the world pass every stress test required by the FDA and other government agencies. Materials have changed numerous times to not only pass FDA requirements, but to pass the requirements set forth by the parents and friends in our community.We want the best for the children who interact with the products we create. Our products include the following features: •BPA Free •Recyclable •Food Safe •Dishwasher Safe •Limits Contact with Surface Germs •Increases Dexterity through Cognitive PlayAfter we conquer the challenges that come with producing the mold (which will be happening within a month), fulfillment will be fairly straightforward and our Indiegogo friends will receive their items on the date promised. Our initial run of a minimum order requirement of 3,600 units will be reordered immediately if we anticipate a surge of orders midway through our campaign. Everyone will receive their rewards on time!If we meet our goal of $10,000, we will be able to reach our larger goal of $30,000 and begin tooling and mold production for two more products under the Fed brand. That's more awesomeness for you and the people in your life! Every product we create needs to help fund future products in order for us to grow organically.We measure our success from the amount of meals we provide to children in need. Our goal for the end of the year is 7,200 meals. Help us blow that goal out of the water!You can still make a difference if you're unable to contribute funds to this campaign. All you have to do it share it with your friends!

story:
Short Summary

We are Glassier Gardens, a local agricultural co-operative based out of Basalt, Colorado.  Our co-op is comprised of five members and five small businesses: Ajax Adventure Camp, Colorado Soil Systems, Elevated Produce, The Heritage Fruit Tree Project, and Sunfresh Flowers and Gardens.  We believe in growing locally, organically, and sustainably.  In order to fulfill our dream and allow our businesses to succeed we need to fund a variety of start-up costs.  We have estimated these costs to be about $10,000 and they include necessities such as electric fencing, various gardening and farming tools, an irrigation pump, and more!

Will you support your local food economy and donate to Glassier Gardens?

Learn more about each of our businesses below!

AJAX ADVENTURE CAMP

Ajax Adventure Camp aims to teach kids about their natural world through hands-on experiences. At Glassier, kids help raise chickens, ducks, rabbits, quail and in future years - other livestock.  The goal is for the kids to learn about agriculture, food sources, and sustainable practices in fun, creative, and explorative ways.  Furthermore, kids are exposed to other agricultural producer coop members so they can understand what it takes to grow crops on the land, how to use animals in the most sustainable fashion, and what it means to be a farmer.  

COLORADO SOIL SYSTEMS, LLC

Colorado Soil Systems, LLC is a landscape management company whose mission is to act as a resource to the Roaring Fork Valley and surrounding area for information, education, and assistance in organic landscape management practices and soil building processes in order to grow our local food economy, increase environmental health, and increase resistance to disturbance in our food production systems and landscapes.

ELEVATED PRODUCE

Elevated Produce is a new company dedicated to growing locally and organically with the intention of selling these products to local vendors and residents of the Roaring Fork Valley.  We mainly focus on growing strawberries and we are currently experimenting with greens, vegetables and herbs. Although our operation is small we are currently cultivating part of the Glassier property in order expand strawberry production to meet our clients’ needs.  We look forward to building a relationship with local vendors, restaurants and the general public by selling at farmer’s markets and capitalizing on existing connections with small business owners in Snowmass Village and throughout the Valley.

THE HERITAGE FRUIT TREE PROJECT

Mission: To renew the historical fruit resource in Colorado and to grow our local food economy.

The goals of this project include:

  • map and collect data on all fruit trees in the Roaring Fork Valley
  • identify trees with tasty fruit and favorable characteristics
  • graft from, grow and plant more fruit trees throughout the Roaring Fork Valley and Western Slope region of Colorado
  • divert food production back into our local and regional food systems

Growing and tracking our fruit production resources will allow Colorado to become a major agricultural producer and increase food security for the whole state.

SUNFRESH FLOWERS & GARDENS

Sunfresh Flowers & Gardens has been in the business of designing, selling and growing flowers over the past 20 years here in The Roaring Fork Valley.
We currently create beautiful local bouquets and arrangements and garden pots & containers for our local Whole Foods Market in Basalt and have been doing this for the past two years.  We also provide flowers for weddings and events.  We would like to expand this process so that we may provide flowers and herbs to more local vendors.  

What We Need & What You Get

BUDGET BREAKDOWN:
Lawn and gardening tools: $4,488.30
Irrigation pump and pipe: $3,209
Electric fencing for .7 acres: $1,561.90
Miscellaneous (marketing materials,greenhouse, etc): ~ $500 or more
INITIAL OVERHEAD COSTS: ~$9,758.78 

PERKS:
In exchange for your contribution we would also like to offer you a variety of gifts that we call "perks."  These include one of a kind stickers, postcards, greeting cards, plants, flowers, and more!
See our Perks on the right of this page for more information.

The Impact

There are many reasons to support a co-op like Glassier Gardens.  When you support and buy from independent, locally owned businesses your money goes back in to your local community rather than to a nationally owned business.  Keeping business local also reduces environmental impact.  Locally owned businesses purchase more from other local businesses thus reducing the need for transportation and therefore contributing less to urban sprawl, congestion, and pollution.  Supporting local farms also preserves the environment by conserving open space.  Rather than developing the Glassier land for commercial use, Pitkin County decided to lease a portion of it to our co-operative for agricultural use.  Therefore, by supporting Glassier Gardens, you are doing something proactive to preserve the agricultural landscape.  When you buy local you are also investing in your community. Local businesses are owned by people who live in your community, are less likely to leave and care about your community's future.  


Risks & Challenges

THE GRASS
Although the Glassier property is historically known for having some of the richest soil in the valley, when we acquired the lease on our section of the property it had not been in agricultural use for quite some time.  Over the years local grasses have taken over and developed an extensive root system that is difficult to break through when tilling the land.  We would like to extend a special thanks and our deep gratitude to Brett Meredith, Rio Grande Trail Manager, for donating his time and effort and bringing a bobcat to help us break through the soil so that we may prepare it for planting.  
WATER
The Glassier land has excellent water rights and we have access to a water canal which we can dam at various points in order to flood irrigate our plants and flowers.  However, we need funding for an irrigation pump and pipe in order to best access and take advantage of this water supply.  Currently we are pumping water from a well on the property through several hoses to get water to our crops and flowers.  If we can get funding for an irrigation pump/pipe and rely less on on water from the well we can reduce our environmental impact on the water table and conserve groundwater.
THE WEATHER
High altitude gardening about 5,000 feet elevation has always proved challenging.  The heat from the searing sun during the day combined with unreliable rainfall and a short growing season can make production difficult in the Rocky Mountains.  If we can raise our goal of $10,000 (or more!) then we can set aside money for a greenhouse which would extend our growing season from early spring through late fall.  
ANIMALS
From prairie dogs to deer and even the occasional bear, our parcel of land on the Glassier Open Space land is home to abundant wildlife.  We seek to coexist with these animals but some have proved to be detrimental to our plants and flowers.  With every contribution we receive we will be one step closer to raising enough money to purchase an electric fence which will help protect our gardens from pests. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We value you and your time, not just your money!  Can't afford to donate? Help us out by:

  • Spreading the word about our campaign to others!
  • Donating any lawn, garden, and farm tools and equipment 
  • Donating some of your time to help us garden or promote our campaign

Visit and like our Facebook page! 

www.facebook.com/glassiergardens

story:
Short Summary

Hey there sweet lovers, my name is Damian and I love eating sweets, maybe its because my mum is a Chocoholic and my siblings eat sweets almost every day. So that's why I was so determined to make my own sweets business, selling chocolates, jelly bean and other magnificent creations from all over the world that is all carmmed inside a website and put into even smaller box that's waiting on your doorstep.

To all my contributors that will help us, you are the real heroes by supporting me and making my dream come true, you will help me achieve to make the most delicious almost able to eat website and send little boxes of sweet Hershey Kisses to millions of people.

What We Need & What You Get

Okay so what I will need from you guys is support. I need about £1000 on just buying and supplying the products so that we never run out of them. The rest of the £500 is going to making the website, creating little Thank You cards, Sending out inventions to look at our website and advertising.

Our sweet perks are almost delicious as apple pies. Each contributor that adds money to our goal will get a signed price list and a thank you card, for people that give us more support well then we have to give you more from us, so if you're thinking of giving us £15 we will give you Hershey's GIANT Chocolate bar and if you want to give us £25 then you will receive a small sample box of  different sweets as a thank you.

If we do not reach our goal its not all sour apples! We will continue to make the website run and still send out those delicious boxes what ever we raise we know that you supported us.

The Impact

Our campaign lets all people around the world try our awesome service and try sweets from all over the world no matter where they are and it gets even better, the prices are low which means costumers wont have to spend a fortune on Gummy Bears.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute but want to help us and want to et the word out to the world about us then you can use the easy tools on the Indiegogo website, share it with Twitter, Facebook and other sharing social sites that are available. 

Thank you so much for supporting us and lots of sweet kisses from the team.

story:
QUI EST FUNNYCACH ?

La société Funnycach est une petite société basée à Blagnac, près de Toulouse. Nous importons et vendons différents produits tels que les caméras embarquées DASHCAM, les Balles WABOBA, les KIT MAINS-LIBRES Bluetooth et différents autres produits connectés. Nous avons aussi signé des contrats de distributions avec plusieurs centrales d'achats.

FUNNYCACH, créée en 2011,  existe maintenant depuis 4 ans.

WHO IS FUNNYCACH?

Funnycach is a small company based in Blagnac, near Toulouse. We import and sell various products such as Waboba balls, board cameras dashcam and various other connected products. We also signed contracts with several distributions purchasing centers such as Carrefour, Auchan, Cora and Système U.

FUNNYCACH, founded in 2011, is now for 4 years.


POURQUOI DEMANDER UN FINANCEMENT ?

Les banquiers ne sont pas très coopératifs... et la société doit grandir. Pour grandir, elle doit étoffer son réseau de distribution avec des agents commerciaux travaillant en exclusivité, rechercher sans cesse de nouveaux produits et les faire connaître en faisant de la publicité, avoir en permanence un designer pour le packaging des produits, un standard téléphonique et un secrétariat, en bref, créer des emplois.

  • Pour avancer, la société doit trouver un financement d'environ 195.000$ sur 3 ans ou au moins 65.000$ pour un an. Ces fonds seront consacrés entièrement à l'embauche de salariés à temps complet, à la recherche, l'acquisition et design de nouveaux produits.
  • Mais nous ne demandons pas de financement sans compensation. Chaque participant recevra une contrepartie, suivant la liste établie et dans la limite des stocks disponibles.
  • Notre objectif est de créer entre 4 et 6 postes et avec votre aide, tout deviendra possible. Nous sommes conscients de l'importance de la demande, à notre connaissance, jamais réalisée sur les réseaux.
  • Si vous n'atteignons pas complètement notre objectif, les fonds récoltés serviront à l'embauche d'au moins deux personnes, à la recherche de nouveaux produits et à leur commercialisation.

WHY APPLY FOR FUNDING?

The bankers are not necessarily very cooperative ... and society must grow, the company must grow. In order to grow, it must further develop its distribution network with commercial agents who work exclusively for her, constantly seek of new products and make them known by advertising, have permanently a designer to create product packaging without forgetting a telephone switchboard and a secretariat, in short, create jobs.

  • To go forward, society must find funding of about $ 195,000 over 3 years, or at least $ 65,000 for one year. These funds will be allocated entirely to hiring full-time employees, in search, acquisition and design of new products.
  • But we are not asking for funding without compensation. Each participant will receive a counterparty, according to the established list and the stocks!
  • Our objective is to create between 4 and 6 jobs and with your help, everything will become possible. We are aware of the importance of demand, to our knowledge, ever attempted on networks.
  • If we do not fully achieve our objective, the funds raised will be used to create two jobs, in search of new products and their marketing.



Pour nous aider un peu plus

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer,  vous pouvez quand même nous aider :

  • Faîtes passer le mot à vos amis, faîtes de la publicité autour de notre projet.
  • Utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

Merci de votre soutien.

Didier

To help us more

If you can not contribute, you can still help:

Make spread the word to your friends, make of advertising around your project.  Use them Indiegogo sharing tools!

Thank you for your support.

Didier

story: After working many years in schools and shules, I have tapped in to the pulse of today's Jewish youth and teens. Would like to start my own outreach organization where we can host events, music gatherings, Shabbaton's, classes and eventually to make our own center. The money would help start up the organization, fund, events, sponsor initial salaries for the staff. Any funds left would go towards saving up to make a center. Today's youth are our top priority and many kids today our facing problems such as abuse and drugs. We have a teem that with degrees in Social work and much experience with today's youth. make this dream come a reality and help us save lives.

story:
Our company is Adams CDL Transport.

We created our company in order to begin training women and minorities through an extended cdl course.

My name is Jason Adams and I am the team leader.  I started my trucking career through the company sponsored cdl training with Beech Trucking in Little Rock for whom I began driving in the mid  90's.  To toot my own horn I was the only person in my class to pass the driving exam with a perfect score.  I went on to become a driver trainer with Beech later in my career.  I have also worked as a CDL trainer for Continental Express (now part of Celadon) also in Little Rock.  I left trucking in 2000 to work with a facility for troubled teens as a house parent.  I had direct authority for 10-14 boys for 5 years.  I came back to trucking in 2004 and currently drive for a company out of Grand Forks ND.

When you read almost any magazine or newsletter connected to the transport industry the two things you will see are that there is a driver shortage and that the driver retention rate for some companies is extremely high.  If you listen to the radio, like Road Dog radio on SiriousXM, you hear of the severe need for truck drivers, a need that is projected to grow over the next 10 years.


The trucking industry has constantly and consistently ignored the large pool of unemployed and underemployed women in our nation.  I believe that most of them are unaware that they can do the job as well as anyone and that the conditions and equipment have improved to such a large degree that it's not the hard grueling job that it used to be.  To educate the public we will create a seminar and travel around to the unemployment and workforce centers and show women how they can become part of the transportation industry and make a good living using their cdl.  We are not about promises of riches or get rich quick schemes or the flashy upfront bonuses that other companies lure their students with.  We want to show our students that if they put in an honest days work they can get a honest days pay and support themselves and their families with a good paying job that they can be happy about and proud to do.

We want to create a cdl training course that gives our students an extended training period where when they receive their cdl they can walk into any carrier, be assigned a truck, and take off with a load without the usual 2-6 week ride along.  We want to go beyond the basics and train women on how to protect themselves at their stops, how to find parking, how to deal with the unusual instances that arise, how to be safe, defensive, responsible drivers projecting professionalism for themselves, for their company, and for us as their trainer.

We believe that two week training courses set the students up to fail from the moment they begin.  Two weeks is barely enough time to learn the very basics of what is on a cdl test.  We want our students to have at least 30 hours of individual driving time with an instructor in addition to two weeks of cdl test prepration time along with time in-between to work on the practice yard going through the skills course.  Then if the student still feels unprepared we want to be able to eventually offer extended one-on-one time up to 12 additional weeks.



We need help with getting equipment, property for the business, and setting up the training course.  We need to apply for our authority and for the various insurances necessary for a business of this magnitude.  Contributors will help us promote and propel women into the trucking industry who will eventually work with top trucking companies and then began buying their own trucks and maybe starting their own businesses.  Contributors will help us be an incubator for the success of women in the trucking industry.


What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $100000.  This will allow us to find a property to work from.  I had intended to purchase a property as there is a really good spot in my home town that is empty and perfect for this type of business.  I think now that a long term lease with an option to buy may work better.  We will need to get beginning equipment.  I'm open to a partnership with a carrier if they would allow us to use a truck and trailer or two.  If not we will have to lease or purchase equipment to use.  We will need to get our authority and insurance, and hire additional instructors.

For contributors we are offering a hand-written embossed thank you card.  There is also a perk for a shout out on our website and on our social media pages.

For the top 4-8 contributors we are willing to hang your banner (something like 3 ft x 12 foot) in the lobby of our business the first year.

For our top 3 contributors we are willing to add a banner both in the lobby and on our trailers for everyone to see as we drive around Little Rock and Memphis and Helena.

If we don't reach our entire goal the funds will still be used for the business scaling back as we need to but also doing additional fund raising to complete our goal.  In the interim I will purchase a truck and lease on with a reputable company like Landstar and then train a lady to drive that truck.  I will then buy a second truck and train a lady to drive that truck.  I will buy a third truck and train a lady to drive that truck.  When I have 5-6 trucks working I will open a training center on my own.

Some people might say to go into debt and get a loan to fund the operation from the beginning.  I say why get a loan when I can do it without being in debt with a little luck and a lot of hard work.  I've never liked being in debt and don't want my company starting out that way.



The Impact

Keeping drivers on the road is important for our nation as a whole.  Truck driving is not a industry that can be uprooted and moved to another nation.  We are here to stay.  With so many people being out of work and our economy growing and with so many of our current drivers being close to retirement age the need for alternative resources to fill those seats is an urgent one.  We believe we can fulfill that mission to train safe, efficient, loyal drivers.


Risks & Challenges

Insurance is a big risk so we may have to pay more.  As a new company we don't have a track record yet so we will have to pay to play and as we prove ourselves our insurance costs should come down. 

We will have to have alert instructors who have the experience to judge conditions on the road and be able to relay that into actions a student can take to minimize risk.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out.  If you know a person that would benefit from a training course like ours share our information with them.  Facebook share, tweet, pinterest, google+, email, even just telling someone in person about us will help.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About Us

Love Productz is a up and coming business that aims to give local (and soon worldwide) musicians another platform to help produce, sell and promote their music. With CD Duplication, Merchandise Store, Video and Music Production and a stage to perform or host a album release party, it's sure to help artists build more for their careers. Also looking to help single parents and give kids a "sanctuary" and get them off the streets and into something productive.

Why Are We Here?

I am CEO and Founder my name is Marquise Love. I am a inspiring artist and also a single father. I have been doing music for 11 years and I have noticed in Grand Rapids, there are little to no resources to point a artist in the right direction. Nightclubs are either closing down or getting rid of open mic/local talent opportunities and a lot of artist do not know where to start to get their music produced or heard. It's the same for single fathers....no grants to finish school, no helpful people to help us become better parents. Thats where we come in.

What We Need & What You Get

I guestimated 9,000$ as our goal to get the resources that we need 

  • Music and Video Equipment (Cameras, Green screen, Microphones etc.) 
  • Machines to produce more quantity orders and get even better in quality (Heatpress, Industrial Printer)
  • Store Equipment (Racks for t-shirts, Decal, Cash Register etc.)
  • And A building to put it all in
And for being participators in the campaign you can get.

  • Free Prizes
  • A chance to throw your own show (Talent Show, Birthday Party, Graduation etc.)
  • Job opportunities (sign flippers, In-store associates, street team etc.) 
And much more

If we do not reach our goal then the money will be put towards a much smaller building and as much equipment as we can get so we can build from there.

The Impact

We as a company aim to not only help musicians, but also the community bringing more jobs, giving grants to single parents, giving kids a place to go to and acquire a hobby and learn new things the streets can not teach them.

Risks & Challenges

There maybe a few risks/challenges on our journey and I will personally be out in the forefront fighting to make this dream come true. I have been saving bottles and cans and any change I can find to put towards this campaign as well so we all are in this together. We may not get a investor, might not find the building we want, reach our goal etc. and I will do whatever it takes to make sure your donation was not taken for granted 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to make a donation at this time. (there is a 60 day maximum on this campaign) and thats ok :) you can return bottles, collect loose change anything is better then nothing at all. You can also Share, Repost, and Spread The Word about this campaign you still can win something for any cooperation. 


Want to thank you for taken the time to read this and thank you if you participate.

story:
Summary of Story

OK. Before we get into our story, lets talk about how these mobile media devices can be used. 

  • It's an indoor outdoor internally powered media device. Watch your shows, videos or hotspot broadcast for 12 hours.
  • As a business the possibilities are endless. Market your business with punch. from a single walker to a quad delivery you WILL catch attention! 
  • Receive expect advice on how to impact the most clients!

Take your message anywhere. Edit your videos from camp or simply be off grid. Tailgating becomes easy with a set that won't drain your battery and doesn't need to be charged for 12 hours. Your business will have a unique way to deliver your message, either locally or at major events. Entertainment is taken to another level with endless possibilities for shows and developers! Whether it is simply having a television you can unplug or a business idea that could vault you to the next level. 

  • Our team has 18 years of experience in the field of design and 30 plus years collectively in sales and management.
  • Our product is currently in use in our own business and so we are confident in production and delivery time.
  • Hybrid advancement in internally powered media device.

 1. Technology should provide people with a better quality of life, regardless of budget.

2. Cost should be based on Technology, Quality and Features not marketing jargon and celebrity endorsements. 

3. We trust that our consumers can determine what makes good quality products rather than just following a brand narrative.



What We Need 

Let's break this down in more detail. The funding we are asking for will be used specifically for the following:

  1. Purchase in bulk of all materials needed to complete the perks.
  2. Labor for assembly and production.
  3. Profits will be used to fund booth offerings at next years biggest Consumer Electronics Shows. 
  • ITEXPO
  • INTEROP
  • QCON
  • GOTO

What You Get

Besides knowing that you are contributing to the beginning of a new era in powering mobile devices, we're offering the initial sets to private investors such as yourself. 

If we do not reach our goal of $300,000 the money collected will go to delivery of the Perks offered, as well as a scaled back campaign at the above mentioned electronics shows. Your RaveCave set comes with the following.

 Be among the first in history to own these devices:

  • Included is a 40 inch AC/DC Smart LED TV with TV Stand. 
  • Internally powered for 12 hours on a single charge.
  • TV System: NTSC, Sound system: B.G.D.K.M.
  • Smart Function: Android system, Quad Core CPU, 4G memory, 1G DDR Size.
  • Support both WIFI and W-Lan 3. 
  • Accessories: User-manual, Remote control, Warranty card and AC Cable.
  • Warranty: 3 year warranty.


The Impact

Think about the possibilities and turn heads! A smart television that is mobile, internally powered and WiFi enabled that lets you connect from anywhere. 

What will you use your RaveCave set for? 

RaveCave Productions, LLC is a Missouri-based advertising and marketing company with a background in manufacturing and sales. RaveCave products are engineered with the latest innovations in materials and technology, matched with precision craftsmanship to produce an astonishingly dynamic and immersive experience.

As this idea came about out of necessity, the business born from this idea has already established itself as a force in the industry. The interest of individuals in ownership of our sets came at such a surprise, that we were almost caught unaware. Almost. 

We are releasing them for sale because we were inspired by the concept of creating something new. Because we know you're out there. People like us. Innovate minds with dreams to fulfill. That's why we decided to release this project. Nothing is more rewarding than assisting someones in making their dream come true. We want to pay it forward. So... Go. Be. Creative.


Risks & Challenges

We have been working on this device since May 2013, that is why we have complete confidence in our ability to successfully deliver this product. We have an experienced team, very skilled both with hardware and software integration, and we are absolutely confident that we can ship according to our timeline.  We have already completed  and tested several models of the prototype and have moved into production of the sets for our business use. This has helped us not only to acquire the proper know-how but also to build a solid and proficient professional relationship with all suppliers involved in the production process.

We understand that there are always a few risks associated with the launch of any brand new technology to the market, but we are convinced that in our case these are very minimal. We already have in our hands a complete functioning product and we just need to mass produce it. We believe in a transparent project management approach and we have decided to inform all our backers on a regular basis about the progress made during the production phase.


Why RaveCave

1) Hybrid design – From everyday use around the office or home with standard power options or unplug for 12 hours of use anywhere you desire.

2) WiFi access coupled with the android system of entertainment and aps.

3) Backpack, mounting brackets or self standing for ease of use.

In an attempt to find a niche market, in an advertised soaked town like Branson, Missouri, we started brain storming one night at our favorite watering hole. What began with the bold step of napkin sketching, transformed into an undertaking more exciting and immense than we ever imagined. 



Milestones



A MESSAGE FOR THOSE WHO WANT TO HELP BUT CAN'T CONTRIBUTE.
Some of the best support we have received since May 2013 on this project has been the support of those willing to tell others about what we're doing. If you saw something today that made you as excited as we are, please tell all of your friends. Just by doing that one thing you are actually contributing in a way that money can't buy. 
  • So please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

  • And use the Indiegogo share tools! If you're not sure how, contact us and we'll walk you through it!

Technology is the reason why we keep progressing forward. Because of technology we have the ability to provide people with a greater sense of enjoyment in life and accomplishment in business. Over the last 40 years we've seen Computer Technology make people's lives easier and more convenient. We've seen Technology break the barriers of time and space by connecting people on opposite ends of the earth. We've witnessed Storage Technology grow infinitely while shrinking in size and cost. We've experienced Video Technology pack an infinite amount of pixels into displays to recreate images with previously unimaginable clarity. But Marketing and Advertising has been lagging. Even though available everywhere most people are simply desensitized to it. Yet businesses are forced to spend ridiculous amounts of money in an attempt to get their name out into the public eye. We use the old because there is no new. However, the time has come for this to change. That is why we are here, because we want everyone to truly reap the rewards of building your dream. Deliver your message in a way never thought possible (without forcing you to go beyond your budget). We learned from our the building of this business and now this Campaign, this community is about more than just providing us with monetary backing. 

LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

story:
We know that Africa is the next-big thing on the investment horizon but instead of focusing on sectors or companies we want to be the rising tide that will lift all boats by subjecting African businesses to the public court and raising accountability and business standards across the board.

As a Contributor you will be the catalyst to effect change across businesses in a region where legal and regulatory changes are extremely slow and do not favour ordinary consumers. Your contribution will not only have an impact on the daily digital lives of African consumers but also provide an avenue that will give a voice to every African with a mobile phone and access to the internet.

Our campaign is about harnessing the power of the internet to empower every day Africans. We are committed to Africa and African consumers and businesses by allowing them to voice their opinions on our website: www.yululate.com

Imran Khan, CFA is a CFA charter holder and former finance professional having worked in New York for over 10 years in investment banking, consulting, asset management & private equity. He co-founded Yululate with his wife Tehmeena Manji. Imran is a graduate of Whittier College, California.

Tehmeena Manji is a co-founder of Yululate. She worked in New York for over 5 years at Lehman Brothers as a tax professional. She holds a Bachelor’s degree from CUNY Hunter College and a Master’s degree from University of Edinburgh. 

Yululate is seeking to raise $250,000. The funds will be used as follows:

1.  New improved website- improved search engine, market fragmentation for advertising & placement, GPS enabling, innovations to draw reviews from other apps: $35,000 - $50,000. The website will be built to specifications.

2.  Mobile App – App to capitalize on fact that 80-90% of yululate consumers are currently accessing website on mobile phones. Cost: $15,000 - $25,000

3.  Advertising: Main obstacle to scale so far has been limited reach of advertising. Over 7 months we have identified best means to advertise – combination of capturing captive business wi-fi customers, social media ads, events and other. Cost: $120,000 to $144,000

4.  Business Development staff: Hire team of business development staff (10 – TEN) across cities in Kenya. Cost $30,000 to $40,000

5.  Balance – other operating costs such as staff salaries, rent, SEO expert, utilities etc.

The Impact

There are 2 Kenyas. One built for the tourists and one for the locals. The customer service experience one can have in these 2 Kenyas is dramatically contrasting. Since majority of tourist interactions take place at hotels, resorts and restaurants and there is a public court to try businesses (Tripadvisor), the level of service at these places is world class. However, on the flip side, since locals do not have a consolidated platform to voice their views, businesses have gotten away with treating consumers extremely poorly.

The biggest impact of Yululate will be giving a voice to those consumers that have had to stay silent & suffer for very long, by harnessing the power of the mobile phone that majority of them (30 million out of 44 million people have mobile phones in Kenya) now use.  


In addition to giving consumers a voice, Yululate will provide a medium for the vast number of small businesses an avenue to economically reach wider audiences and in order to scale their business, but more importantly it will ensure that the best of these rise to the top through the public trial system.

When business standards begin to rise and entrepreneurs are able to broaden their market reach, the impact of Yululate in Kenya will be realized both socially and economically.

Business Intelligence to level the playing field: There is a growing movement of small and medium enterprises("SME") in Africa and they embrace the digital economy more liberally than their more established peers. However, established names cannot ignore their consumers who spend more time on digital devices. as a result, even though digital advertising spend constitutes a small amount of total advertising there is huge potential for growth. 

The big search engines however, are too complex and too expensive for these SMEs to access and hence limit the growth of these SMEs. In Africa, these international search giants are perpetuating the digital divide and instead of being a means to connect more people are allowing the bigger, deep pocketed companies to leave the SMEs behind. Yululate has been set up to allow these SMEs to put in all their key words for an affordable price of $100 a year and more importantly appear in search rankings based on their customer reviews not based on how much money they have spent on us. Our Business Intelligence report will give information on what consumers are searching across categories, days/months etc. This will allow SMEs to compete with other companies on their service offering for the first time but also give them vital and factual information on what consumers are looking for and allow them to target these consumers, thus, leveling the playing field.

In our short life of 7 months we already have over 300,000 page views and over 200,000 users have used Yululate and soon a part of the public transportation system can be rated on Yululate, which will only increase our reach.

Our founders’ background in finance also provides us with the discipline and governance to grow Yululate in an economical and structured manner. This is evidenced with the fund raising at inception from a family office and demonstrates the belief in Yululate and its potential.

Risks & Challenges

Having run Yululate for 7 months we think the key risks & challenges in scaling up Yululate are the following:

1.  Completing website & app in a timely manner due to the dearth of talent – Most of the tech talent in Kenya has focused its effort around mobile payments due to the success of Mpesa - the mobile payment platform. Finding tech developers beyond that has proven to be a challenge. We have already discussed developing the website with a few companies in Eastern Europe and India with extensive experience on similar websites and apps and will select one post fund raising.

2.  Business Buy-in: This has proved difficult especially because business development staff have not been insightful in pointing out that yululate is a moderated platform that does not give carte blanche like other social media platforms.

3.  Business Development -Hiring quality business development staff has been a challenge and we continue to find the best way to align their incentives with the Company and also a way to monitor their work effectively without compromising the end goals.

4.  Competition -This is probably the lowest risk, since there are no similar companies here and barriers to entry are relatively high (high start up cost of building website and more importantly scaling it due to advertising costs). 


Other Ways You Can Help

Love the idea and want to help? There are a number of ways.

1.  Like our FB page

2.  Follow us on Twitter

3.  Share this link on your FB page

4.  Give us your suggestions on what we can do better

5.  Know of a business in Kenya? Tell them to list on yululate

story:
The Chicago Charity Challenge inspires and motivates Chicago-area businesses to support the nonprofit community. Our annual competition teams employees with a charitable organization of their choice and rewards them for volunteering and raising funds for nonprofits that serve Chicago's neediest neighborhoods. 

In less than two years, thousands of Challenge participants have given more than $10 million and volunteered nearly 40,000 hours to organizations battling hunger, homeless, poverty, disability, and disease. With your help, we can continue to positively impact the lives of others.

Your support will allow us to donate money awards to the winning nonprofits and provide assistance and incentives to willing volunteers. Please join us in our effort to drive philanthropy and build a stronger community!

The Chicago Charity Challenge is a 501(c)(3) charity. Donations are tax deductible.

story:
We're Moving!

That’s right! In just three and a half short years, The Strum Shop community has outgrown its current facility!  We host music gatherings every week, which requires shutting down our retail operation, moving all of our floor displays out onto the sidewalk and setting up chairs.  These events include weekly classes, recitals, the Uke University Strum & Singalong, The Roseville Guitar Club, the CBA Bluegrass Jam, the Irish Slow Session, the Sacramento Songwriter's Circle and much more.  We also have had the opportunity to host great workshops and concerts put on by top visiting artists from all over the world.  And we love it!  Our events are so well attended, we’ve often had guests watching from the sidewalk because there was no more room in the store.   
The Strum Shop is a retail music store with the heart of a community center.  Our community events are almost always free and 100 percent of the net proceeds from concerts and workshops go directly to the visiting artists; we want to keep it that way.  In order to do that, we need to rely on retail sales to pay the bills.  Wouldn't it be great if we could keep our retail operation intact even while events are going on?  The bottom line is we need to move into a bigger space and soon! 

 
Fortunately we have found a beautiful historic storefront that is nearly twice the size of our current space and less than a mile away.  It's located right in the heart of  our beloved City of Roseville at 209 Vernon Street, in the historic downtown district.  This move will enable us to offer a number of awesome improvements including:
  • Dedicated 50-plus seat auditorium to serve our local community of musicians and music lovers.
  • 7 Lessons Studios (up from 4) for our local music teachers and their students.
  • Full Service, onsite repair shop for both fretted and school band instruments.
  • Shipping and Receiving area to better serve our online community.
  • Larger, more comfortable area for students and parents waiting for lessons.
  • More of the Ukuleles, Guitars and other instruments you've been asking for.

The dilemma is that due to unexpected rapid growth, this move is about three years earlier than we had anticipated.  We are significantly underfunded at this point and really need your help!

How You Can Help

Your contributions will enable us to maintain the sustainability of our little shop so that we can better serve our community.  While we are making every effort to reduce costs, moving and expanding a music store is an expensive endeavor.  The $40,000 we are asking for in our Indiegogo campaign is just a start for the $200,000 plus we will need to raise over the next 6 months in order to fully implement our vision.  The funds will go toward: 

  • Construction and remodeling costs.  We'll need to build the lesson studios, install additional lighting and build out the performance area.
  • Professional staging, stage lighting, and better, more comfortable chairs for our mini auditorium.
  • Additional computers and systems.  Our computers were purchased used and are nearly 10 years old at this point.
  • New fixtures for our retail area.
  • More Ukuleles! (and of course guitars, and other instruments)
As a way to say Thank You for your support, we have put together a series of perks for you to choose from in exchange of your contributions.  With your help, The Strum Shop can segue into it's next grand opus.  We are truly grateful for your participation.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize not everyone is able to support this endeavor financially but we would be just as grateful if you would share this page with friends and family via Facebook, Twitter and via word of mouth.  Lastly, please consider The Strum Shop for all of your future musical instrument purchases.

Happy Strumming,

Dan, Stu & The Strum Shop Family

story:
Crush the Microbead Menace


See these? They’re microbeads. Those little bits of colored plastic are in hundreds of health, beauty and cleaning products. They're supposed to help with scrubbing. And now trillions of them are choking our waterways and killing marine life.

Hi. I'm Nawal Calder and I'm one of the owners of KINDERMA LLC, a small but pioneering skin care company in New England. We are deeply passionate about our work and we have dedicated ourselves to creating natural environmentally-safe products that make a real difference in people's lives.

This microbead situation is a disaster. We're about to launch an amazing new skin care product that will help keep hundreds of millions of cosmetic-grade microbeads from being flushed into our lakes, rivers and seas.
But we need your help.
 

So What’s the Big Issue?

This.


Sadly, oceans are the world’s sink drain. When civilization has a problem, we often like to scrub it off and swiftly flush it down the drain. Eventually the drain backs up. And the "plumbers" we hire to fix it are either incompetent or have a side business of purposely clogging drains.



The massive problem with microbeads is their incredibly small size (most under 3mm). Once they leave your sink or shower they fly right through those industrial- grade filters at water treatment plants and straight into our rivers and seas (403 out of the 610 water treatment plants in New York State alone can't stop them!). According to a stunning 2015 study, 8 trillion microbeads enter our waterways 

EACH AND EVERY DAY.

- 2015  Microbeads Report, College of Science, OSU

Remember, these aren't natural ingredients -- they're non-biodegradable plastic.  Once these things get released into the wild, they never break down and they never go away.

Tweet: "Microbeads are the ocean's version of disposable diapers" #SaveTheSeas


But it gets worse. Microbeads are poison magnets, too. They actually attract toxins the same way magnets attract metal. Contaminates such as PCBs, DDT, fuel oils and solvents stick to the outer surface of these beads as they float through our waterways; waterways that are teeming with life.


And then the problem gets even bigger. Guess what a microbead looks like to a fish? Yup -- Lunch. Huge numbers of fish are now being found with chemical-laden plastics and microbeads in their stomachs.

If you're playing ahead, then you already know how this ends.



Hungry yet?


How is KINDERMA Different?

KINDERMA's campaign will make a real difference, because it will help all our efforts to put more microbead-free products on the shelves and force an earlier end to the microbead epidemic.


The U.S.A. just passed important Anti-Microbead legislation. But it unfortunately allows companies to keep selling microbead-filled products until July of 2018.
And trust us, many of them plan to.

KINDERMA (www.Kinderma.com) has fought against the proliferation of microbeads from day one. Our sole focus is on developing the highest quality and most naturally sustainable products possible for your skin. 


In fact, we got a tiny bit famous last year when the American TV show “The Doctors” recommended our high-end skin moisturizing lotion, DERMA RESCUE, for people who suffer from Psoriasis.

Here’s the show clip:



Our flagship product, Hand Kind SCRUB, is a high performance hand and skin cleanser that removes concentrated dirt stains yet actually softens your skin the more you use it. Formulated with a powerful combination of natural humectants, premium moisturizers, and crushed walnut shells, Hand Kind SCRUB is equally as effective at removing grease, oil and toxins from your skin as it is at eliminating odors.

But most importantly,

NONE of our products contain microbeads.


“I’ve yet to meet a person who learns there’s plastic in their face wash that says, ‘I must wash my face with plastic.’”  Sherri Mason, Professor of Chemistry, SUNY

Ok, How Do We Help?

We have a brand new emollient-rich exfoliator scrub that only uses natural crushed rice bran grains for an abrasive. Rice bran grains are fibrous exfoliates similar to a loofah or rough washcloth, and therefore won’t create micro-scratches in the surface of your skin the way other abrasives do. And they are superior in effectiveness to microbeads.

This revolutionary product is tentatively called DERMA RESCUE Skin Polisher, and we're planning to launch it this Spring.

Because we insist on high quality natural ingredients, our new Skin Polisher (with, appropriately, a tropical ocean scent), has taken on some big costs; beyond what we had projected during the development phase. And then we got the proposal for design and packaging.

Wowza.

We’re not Aveeno. And we’re not Clearasil. These production costs hit close to the bone.

It's going to take a little over $19,000 to bring this product to market, before we even get to advertising and promotion. So we wanted to open up this finishing phase to you, supporters of natural skin care and of the environment.

We would be honored to have you join our team in launching our amazing exfoliator. We want to be as transparent as possible, too, so here is a breakdown of exactly where your pledge funds would be going:

TUBE AND BOX DESIGN                                                       $4,200
CONTAINER PRODUCTION (tubes and caps)                  $9,630
BOX PACKAGING                                                                    $5,740

TOTAL:   $19,570




Every penny of your contribution will go toward those three line items. And if by some stroke of fortune we raise over that amount, those extra funds will go directly to the promotion and distribution of our new Skin Polisher, along with a new label and bottle redesign for our Hand Kind SCRUB (yes, we know - we need it),

And How Will I Be Saving The Seas?

Simple.

10% of all campaign funds raised will be donated to Save Our Shores, an industry leader in ocean preservation.


Save Our Shores (SOS) is a leading marine conservation nonprofit dedicated to caring for California’s Central Coast through ocean awareness, advocacy, and citizen action since 1980. Learn more at www.saveourshores.org

Both Kinderma and Save Our Shores are really serious about changing minds with this campaign. Your pledge will help us achieve our shared goals and fuel our mission to force an immediate end to all microbead use now.

We're Also Going To Give You Some Cool Swag


All Perks Include FREE

U.S. Shipping



BONUS!

Are you creative? Do you want to help us come up with a better name for our new Skin Polisher? In your pledge email, simply give us your ideas for a cool new name and if we choose it, we’ll send you a $200 Kinderma gift certificate!



As always, we want to spread the word of this campaign as far as possible. Even if you can't pledge, you can still help us out by sharing this page with your family and friends. Use the campaign page sharing links here and then visit www.Kinderma.com to see how we're helping people live better lives through our solutions for healthy skin!



Thank you so much for your pledge to Save The Seas and for your support of KINDERMA’s natural product initiatives. I look forward to a gorgeous future.

Nawal


Image Credits:
Chris Jones
Nick Harris
Stephen J. Serio
Olga Lyandres
Lord Mountbatten
Alamy

Special Thanks to the Plastic Oceans Project

Rice bran grains are fibrous exfoliates similar to a loofah or rough washcloth, and therefore won’t create micro-scratches in the surface of your skin the way other abrasives do. And they are superior in effectiveness to microbeads.
This revolutionary product is tentatively called DERMA RESCUE Skin Polisher, and we're planning to launch it this Spring.



Because we insist on high quality natural ingredients, our new Skin Polisher (with, appropriately, a tropical ocean scent), has taken on some big costs; beyond what we had projected during the development phase. And then we got the proposal for design and packaging.Wowza.
We’re not Aveeno. And we’re not Clearasil. These production costs hit close to the bone.It's going to take a little over $19,000 to bring this product to market, before we even get to advertising and promotion. So we wanted to open up this finishing phase to you, supporters of natural skin care and of the environment.
We would be honored to have you join our team in launching our amazing exfoliator. We want to be as transparent as possible, too, so here is a breakdown of exactly where your pledge funds would be going:TUBE AND BOX DESIGN                                                       $4,200CONTAINER PRODUCTION (tubes and caps)                  $9,630BOX PACKAGING                                                                    $5,740TOTAL:   $19,570Every penny of your contribution will go toward those three line items. And if by some stroke of fortune we raise over that amount, those extra funds will go directly to the promotion and distribution of our new Skin Polisher, along with a new label and bottle redesign for our Hand Kind SCRUB (yes, we know - we need it),


And How Will I Be Saving The Seas?


Simple.
10% of all campaign funds raised will be donated to Save Our Shores, an industry leader in ocean preservation.


Save Our Shores (SOS) is a leading marine conservation
nonprofit dedicated to caring for California’s
Central Coast through ocean awareness,
advocacy, and citizen action since 1980. Learn more at www.saveourshores.org
Both Kinderma and Save Our Shores are really serious about changing minds with this campaign.
Your pledge will help us achieve our shared goals and fuel our mission to force an immediate end to all microbead use now.


We're Also Going To Give You Some Cool Swag













All Perks Include FREE 

U.S. Shipping




BONUS!Are you creative? Do you want to help us come up with a better name for our new Skin 
Polisher? In your pledge email, simply give us your 
ideas for a cool new name and if we choose it, we’ll send you a $200 
Kinderma gift certificate!
As always, we want to spread the word of this campaign as far as possible. Even if you can't pledge, you can still help us out by sharing this page with your family and friends. Use the campaign page sharing links here and then visit www.Kinderma.com to see how we're helping people live better lives through our solutions for healthy skin!
Thank you so much for your pledge to Save The Seas and for your support of KINDERMA’s natural product initiatives. I look forward to a gorgeous future.Nawal
Image Credits:Chris JonesNick HarrisStephen J. SerioOlga LyandresLord MountbattenAlamySpecial Thanks to the Plastic Oceans Project

story:
Hello friends!

My name's Terence, and I'm the Founder of Food Tribe...

... a restaurant review platform with a mission to end hunger.

Restaurant reviews suck, and I want to fix them. I believe that  foodies and restaurants, when unified,  have the power to help change the conversation around food.

I started Food Tribe as a result of being frustrated with current restaurant review platforms.

Restaurant reviews like these:

"The risotto with scallops is where hope goes to die."

...and

are really confusing and ultimately caused me to miss out on some good #eeeeeats based on the opinions of others.

After some conversation with friends who were equally frustrated, I decided I wanted to combine my love of food, technology and giving back to start a company I believe can create community and honest feedback.

Restaurant Reviews Suck

For Foodies: 16% of all restaurant reviews are fake, so for hungry eaters like you and me, that means a lot of wasted dollars.

For Restaurants: 1 bad review = 30 lost customers! Crappy reviews are losing good restaurants potential customers.

But Wait! There’s More!

Social entrepreneurs everywhere are creating solutions to major problems and making them fun, which is how Food Tribe was born. I want to create a restaurant review platform that could provide a way for restaurants and their patrons to address LA's local hunger issue.

Feeding the Hungry

One in seven people in Los Angeles County experiences food insecurity.

Food Insecurity = “the state of being without reliable access to a sufficient quantity of affordable, nutritious food.”

I believe that Los Angeles' exploding food scene—foodies and the restaurants they love—is the perfect group to address this problem.

The Food Tribe

#JoinTheTribe: With your help, Food Tribe  can develop a connected restaurant review platform + digital gift card program that rewards good reviews—reviews that push the food community forward and drive thoughtful conversation and change—and gives food to the needy.

The Food Tribe will be the first restaurant review site with a cause.

About the Campaign

Here's how you can help: I've partnered with Santa Monica based gourmet cookie shop Cookie Good in order to raise the $8000 in order to design, build and launch The Food Tribe.



 

  • $4800 - Food Tribe Engineering + Development
  • $1600 - Marketing + Promotion
  • $800 - User Testing + Quality Assurance
  • $800 - Design

Caramel Pretzel Chocolate Chunk + Chocolate Chip Brownie Chunk, Oh My!

 

Supporting Food Tribe is tasty! Support the campaign by purchasing a digital gift certificate via the Food Tribe app, currently available in the App Store.

Gift certificates are redeemable for a box of gourmet cookies, brownies, or a mix at Santa Monica gourmet cookie shop Cookie Good.

Cookie Good's Founders, Melanie and Ross, have created a bunch of fun flavors including Caramel Pretzel Chocolate Chunk, Key Lime Pie, and Red Velvet. View their full menu here.

Each Gift Certificate Purchased = 4 Meals to LA Food Bank

As part of Food Tribe's mission to be the world's first restaurant review site to end hunger, we've partnered with the Los Angeles Regional Food Bank.

For every gift certificate sold, 4 meals will be donated to the LA Food Bank. With your support, you can help Los Angeles address its growing food insecurity problem + support a great local organization.

Every $1 Helps

Successful campaigns are made up of donations at ALL levels! If you can only pitch in $1 or $3, please support!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate, no worries! Check out some other ways that you can help support our mission to connect good people to good food.

Share the News - Share Food Tribe’s Indiegogo video to Facebook and Twitter with the following message:

#JoinTheTribe to help end hunger in Los Angeles. Support Food Tribe’s #crowdfunding campaign on @Indiegogo https://igg.me/at/foodtribe

Tap Into Your Network - Personally reach out to 30 friends, family members, or food lovers to donate via Facebook, Twitter, or LinkedIn before May 31st.

Follow Us! - Follow Food Tribe on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram!

About the Team

Terence Latimer

Terence Latimer is a Los Angeles based digital marketer and entrepreneur. A lifelong fan of food, he decided to combine his passions of technology + social entrepreneurship in order to launch Food Tribe.

Follow Terence on social media at @KingTerentius, or his blog at www.tlatimer.la/blog

Knit Marketing

Friend of Food Tribe Knit Marketing is a digital marketing agency that increases exposure to the teen market by empowering a team of young people to produce and manage web campaigns.

The Knit team has been working with Food Tribe in order to get the word out about the campaign.

FAQ 

Coming Soon!

Stretch Goal

Coming Soon!
