story:
Your tax deductible donation goes to support the current federal class action litigation to restore Second Amendment rights to millions of non-violent felons who are now law-abiding Americans.

On March 15, 2016, attorneys Michael E. Zapin and Herman A. Saitz filed a Class Action lawsuit against Loretta Lynch as Attorney General of the United States and Thomas E. Brandon, as Deputy Director and Head of the United States Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives on behalf of myself and millions of others similarly situated individuals.
Michael Zapin, Esq.

Barry Michaels 		I'm Barry Michaels, a candidate for United States Congress in Nevada's 3rd District (www.michaelsforcongress.com) and also a convicted felon. Although my conviction was nearly twenty years ago for a non-violent offense, I am still unable to possess a firearm to protect myself and my family, for fear of prosecution under The Federal Gun Control Act of 1968, a statute which I feel is in part unconstitutional.

Under federal law, I can run for Congress or even become the President of the United States and have my finger on the nuclear trigger, but face a five year prison sentence if my finger were on the trigger of a Colt 45.

To remedy this, I filed a federal class action lawsuit. As most of us know, litigation like this can be very expensive.  For this reason, I'm asking for your help to support my efforts to correct this injustice which affects my life and the lives of millions of others.  While it is true that each of us committed a serious offense, the offense was non-violent  and committed years ago.  We paid a dear price through the loss of personal liberty, however, once being released, we became law-abiding productive members of society.  Each of us has been law-abiding for at least five years.  There are some individuals in the Class who have been law-abiding in excess of 60 years!  After all of this time, aren't we entitled to the same rights and privileges as other law-abiding citizens?

18 U.S.C. 922(g)(1), the specific provision of the Gun Control Act at issue, makes it illegal for “any” felon to possess a firearm.  I can serve in the House of Representatives, the Senate or even become President of the United States, but I cannot own a firearm to protect myself and my family.  Think about it:  as President I can have my finger on the "nuclear trigger" but not on the trigger of a Colt 45. Crazy!!

My lawsuit alleges (g)(1) is unconstitutional since it violates my 2nd Amendment rights and the rights of all other non-violent felons.

According to Department of Justice, there are approximately 20 million felons representing over 8% of our country’s population. Nearly half of them are non-violent offenders who pose no more threat to society, than any other law abiding citizen.

The statute was written in 1968, amended several times, culminating with the Brady Bill in 1993. I believe 18 U.S.C. 922(g)(1) was written too broadly.  Although the purpose was to protect the public from violent offenders, the statute unreasonably captures a substantial number of non-violent offenders, many of whom have never even held a gun in their entire lives.  

The same provision calls for a lifetime ban without the right of due process.  Neither I or any other Class member had an opportunity to present evidence during our trials or sentencing phases to prove that we were non-violent and should not be subjected to a life long ban on our fundamental right to bear arms. 

There's no doubt that this type of life long ban of a fundamental right is cruel and unusual punishment under the Eighth Amendment.

Our Constitution does not have a provision that creates a "second-class" of  citizenship, but that is exactly what Congress has done with this piece of legislation.  "Second-class citizenship"  or "civil death,"  are concepts brought forward from the medieval era and have no place in a modern society.

The new "civil death," permeates areas outside of the Second Amendment too.  It affects felons when they go to apply for a job and have to check the dreaded box, "have you ever been convicted of a crime?"  If affects felons through State disenfranchisement laws that deprive many of them their right to vote.

Quoting former Chief Justice Earl Warren "denationalization as a punishment is barred by the 8th Amendment," describing it as "a form of punishment more primitive than torture" as it inflicts the "total destruction of the individual's status in organized society." 

It makes no sense to be able to serve at the highest levels of government, yet face a five-year minimum prison sentence if caught with a firearm. It makes far better sense to eliminate second class citizenship by making a slight change in the law.

WHY AMERICANS FOR CIVIL RIGHTS?

AFCR was recently created with a mission to help restore fundamental civil rights guaranteed by the United States Constitution to felons.  It received its official IRS approved 501c3 public charity status as of February 2016.   Its aim is to provide felons with opportunities to become productive members of society through education, counseling, employment, small business, networking, technology and civil rights litigation support.

LAWSUIT SUPPORTED BY YOUR GENEROUS DONATIONS

The funding for the Michaels v. Lynch  lawsuit is coming from your generous, tax-deductible donations received by Americans For Civil Rights. 

What causes recidivism?

Recidivism is caused at least in part, by a stigma that attaches from being branded  a felon.   "The felon brand" creates  a second class of citizenship. It is expansion at its very worst.  It limits, and in some cases, eliminates legitimate opportunities for felons to become productive, law-abiding members of society.   Every felon feels the psychological effects.  For some, however, it proves too much.  They return to a life of crime because ironically, they perceive it as a last resort to achieving some measure of financial "success."

Why should we strive to reduce recidivism?

The  life-time felon brand shatters the American Dream for the millions that have returned to society.   That is not just a rallying cry for self-pity.  The consequences to society can be far more reaching, when felons find they have no alternative other than to return to a life of crime.  

Every year, American taxpayers spend billions of dollars for expenses associated with the high rate of recidivism.  According to the New York Times, the cost for incarceration has quadrupled in the last 20 years for the states, costing about $52 billion a year nationally – making prison budgets the second-fastest growing expense after Medicaid in the states.

What about the families of those incarcerated?  Many have no other alternative than to seek public assistance, costing taxpayers additional billions of dollars each year.  Recidivism is very costly.

The "felon pool" is as wide as it is large.  While it is true that all felons made a serious mistake in their lives, it is also true that many felons are extremely smart, extremely talented, extremely entrepreneurial and extremely motivated.   In short, they hold recipes for success that could not only help themselves, but the American economy at large as well.

 Please help us fight this injustice by giving whatever you can afford.

story:
Welcome to Lynx Mountain Guides of Vermont. 

We have been leading adventure trips for over 20 years including: rock and ice climbing, canoeing and kayaking, mountaineering, backpacking, mountain biking, and backcountry skiing. We take outdoor leadership very seriously and work hard to be trained and practiced in the latest techniques in order to keep everyone safe. 

Independently, we have learned that the most powerful part of the trip is often the bonds that participants form with the land and the communities they interact with. Together, we have founded Lynx to offer high quality, professionally-guided experiences with an emphasis on linking the participants to the people and the environments around them. We understand what makes a safe and quality experience, and our focus on responsible business practices will set us apart from other guide services as well as do our part to improve our world.  

Through Lynx, we will show people great adventures in the varied natural areas of the northeast, and we will also work to protect them through educational programs, outreach, service work, community involvement, and responsible & sustainable business practices. We know that protecting the natural world and the integrity of our communities will not occur without first having a relationship with them. We are seeking your contribution so that we can foster these relationships.

We need assistance obtaining initial capital costs: getting the equipment we need to offer these programs. We require $3,500 for climbing equipment (harnesses, helmets, shoes, hardware, and ropes); $400 for general outdoor gear (first aid kits, maps, and guide books); $1,800 for overnight camping equipment (tents, sleeping bags and pads, and cookware). Less sexy, but just as necessary, we need a $1,500 for insurance and $2,500 for marketing and advertising such as web-hosting fees, printed marketing materials, third party advertising fees, and loads of Lynx-branded merchandise (so everyone that sees your backer perk can have their own!).

To say thank you, contributions earn you a gift certificate to our programs for double the contributed amount (up $1000) and some of our awesome Lynx merchandise. We've also partnered with local businesses to bring you additional perks: authentic Japanese ramen (www.misohungryramen.com), Vermont maple syrup products (www.wayeesesfarms.com), fair-trade, organically- grown, locally-roasted coffee (https://www.facebook.com/olddodgefarm), and local Vermont fraw honey (http://www.honeyhillfarmsvt.com).
This summer's operations will proceed regardless of us reaching our fundraising goal; your contributions will enable our inaugural year be a huge success. Keep an eye on our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/lynxguides/) and our News and Events page to follow us on our adventures (http://www.lynxmountainguides.com/#!news-events...) 

We greatly appreciate any help you are able to offer to us. If that can’t be monetary, there are other ways to help Lynx: share this with people you know would be interested; we are seeking clients as well as backers. You may have noticed gear is a big part of our need; if you have gear that we could use in the program, or that we could sell, please contact us to work out the perks of the trade.

We started Lynx Mountain Guides of Vermont to help people experience and forge a connection to the landscapes, adventures, and cultures that Vermont and the surrounding states have to offer. Thank you for your interest, your contribution and spreading the word about this endeavor.  

Sincerely,

Craig Cimmons & Nicholas Ruschmeyer

story:
Summary

After being a stay-at-home Mom for nearly ten years raising our three children, I wanted to start working again but found myself at a loss. I had never finished college and had no marketable skills, so I began working as a farm hand @ Oley Organics picking weeds, turning soil, planting and harvesting crops.


What I began to learn about organic produce like carrots, cauliflower, garlic, tomatoes, beets, cabbage and all the other assorted vegetables was amazing. What I didn't realize until recently was that although I never had a knack for higher learning in college; I did possess a tactile learning skill by immersing myself in a line of work that I loved where education became second nature.

I started learning things, which only piqued my interest for more knowledge, leading me to where I am today. After seven years of working on local organic farms, both produce and livestock, I have struck upon some nuggets of knowledge I would like to share with you.

From Kale to Cabbage, Carrots to Cucumbers and every assorted vegetable I began to realize the incredible benefits in my family's diet. I learned what FRESH really meant; and it isn't what your supermarket calls FRESH.

I wanted to test the market first, so I went back to where I started seven years ago,  my roots @ Oley Organics (no pun intended)  and attended a one day farm stand tour here in the Oley Valley. We sold 45 jars in our first real day of business in October of 2015, just five months ago.

So, I started The Cottage Kitchen to help people realize the benefits of fermented raw, wild foods such as Kimchi, Sauerkraut, Ginger carrots, Beets, 3-C Medley, etc. The benefits of lacto-fermentation are too great to list, but here are a few: Promotes strong gut health to improve digestion and increase nutrient absorption, detoxifying powers and reduction of sugar cravings.

Fermentation also creates good bacteria (probiotics) within the body's ecosystem to fight the bad bacteria of our society's proclivity for fast food. One cannot hope to eat healthy 100% of the time, but the 80/20 rule will certainly increase longevity of life and quality of life!

My husband, Bob, suffered from severe gut pain and digestive problems, so I set out to find a holistic cure through researching the art of fermentation. Voila! Success!

Bob and myself along with our three children are all committed to The Cottage Kitchen and realizing a dream we've had all our lives; to work together as a family to grow a small business and help others get healthy;  To provide others with the organic, raw, wild vegetables nature intended for them to eat and live a life full of nutrient rich foods.

We tried unsuccessfully to raise $15,000 in start-up costs earlier this year to ramp up to seven markets, but the reality of growing a business is that we must prove ourselves to be successful in a small market before expanding regionally. So, we are asking our friends and family to help us raise enough money to pay for:

1) Labels and Jars for the business

2) A refrigeration system to keep our product from spoiling

Thank you so much for watching this video! Won't you please join us in growing The Cottage Kitchen into a viable business that supplies nutrient dense, raw, wild organic vegetables to the tables of families all over the country.

story:
"Toorora o PERK ndjina ondjinda yo $150.00 nokuyandja omatjangero omakahu wena roye otja tjimozeri okutjangwa komira yovatunge ovatenga. Nu tji wayandja kehi yo $150.00 ena roye karina kutjangwa komira" 


Mission & Vision

The overall mission of the project/campaign is to uplift and beautify the Historic sacred grounds at Ovaherero Traditional Authority (OTA) Erf 1755. Site to be known as Ovaherero Cultural Centre (OCC).

Specific Goals & Objectives

•1) erect anti-climb fence to secure the property,

•2) construct a commemorative brick walkway (interlocks with engraved text to reduce dust and pay tributes),

•3) landscape - trees & bed flowers to beautify the area at its best,

•4) construct a VIP/Activity outdoor stage to provide shade and sitting area,

•5) lavatory facilities with a time bound of 24 months.

Goals

The specific desired goals & objectives were stated above, however, the overall strategic vision is to:

•1) erect anti-climb fence to secure the property,

•2) construct a commemorative brick walkway (interlocks with engraved text to reduce dust and pay tributes),

•3) landscape - trees & bed flowers to beautify the area at its best,

•4) construct a VIP/Activity outdoor stage to provide shade and sitting area,

•5) construct lavatory facilities with a time bound of 24 months.

•6) construct track field - horses & troops,

•7) Herero House (HH)- office & dignitaries use,

•8) Ovaherero Museum, 

•9) Multipurpose Community Hall to generate weekly/monthly revue for OTA,

•10) life animal stalls, 11) construct sitting benches,

•12) Heroes Wall for our fallen heroes and heroines, 

•13) statues of our fallen Paramount Chiefs/Chiefs, etc.

Beneficiaries: Community Project By Us For Us

•The project will have positive social and economic impact to Okahandja and Namibia.

•The project will reinvigorate community pride by raising all three community flags plus the national flag, boost unity and increase annual attendees.

•Furthermore, the project will economically create jobs and aid in the fight against poverty.

•The project will beautify the Ovaherero Cultural Centre (OCC) site, the city of Okahandja at its best, and attract tourists to the city of Okahandja, and increase Namibian tourist industry.

Risks and Challenges

The goal is to have an open and transparent system in place to account for community funds. In order to achieve the financial goal each donor's name will appear on this site under backers,  a not for profit trust account is opened, online Namibian banking with instant notification will form part of the check and balances.  A monthly financial statement & quarterly auditing report will be released to the public per financial flowchart.  The diaspora communities agreed that all funds collected  through OCP network will strictly be used towards construction and maintenance of OCC at Erf 1755.

The Three (3) Project Phases

Phase One (1):Resources Mobilization.

Phase Two (2):Implementation/Execution.

Phase Three (3):Project Delivery.

We kick off Phase One (March 1st - 15 August 2016). We need your help to make this vision a reality and to give you a chance to shape the future of your community. 

Individual Pledge/Donation:

1) One time $200 CAD for those in the Diaspora (Canada, USA, UK, Europe, Russia, China, APAC & rest of outside world). Also, one time  N$200 NAD direct FNB deposit (Namibia, Botswana, South Africa & rest of Africa) contribution.  

2) Your NAME as sponsor get enshrined on "FOUNDERS' WALL". 

3) Take a tour every August at Okahandja and showcase family & friends of your positive contribution to the community.  NOW to LEAVE A LEGACY BEHIND AT OKAHANDJA FOREVER".

Deadline: 15 August 2016. The Project anticipated completion date is August 2017

"Ngatu Ungure Ovyetu"

Disclaimer: Donations are non-refundable. All donated funds will be exclusively used for construction and maintenance of Ovaherero Cultural Centre (OCC) at Erf 1755. The donor or his/her heir(s) relinquish(es) future claim of ownership of donated funds or structures constructed with donated funds. All properties on Erf 1755 will be community properties managed or controlled by OTA (OvaHerero Traditional Authority), its leasing agent(s) or successor entities.

story:
If you're here that means you probably love honey, same as we do. However putting honey in your drinks could get very messy, or even annoying sometimes. That's why most people use other sweeteners for their drinks, rather than honey. Our goal is to make honey more convienent for the everyday use, that's the main reason we invented honigo.


What is Honigo?

Honigo is the world's first dried honey sphere, created to sweeten your drinks, and also to make life little easier.

At honigo, we use only natural ingredients and only the necessary basic ingredients to provide the best quality products. We never use artificial colors or flavours, we use only natural options, so you can always be sure that our products are the safest and best for you and your family.


Our Mission

Did you ever get sticky, and everything messy around you after using honey to sweeten your drinks? We know how frustrating this can be, that's why our team reimagined the honey sweetener experience.

We are raising 10000 $ for this campaign. We think it's an awesome, innovative product, and we stand behind it 100%, but we need Your help to bring honigo to life!

Your support will allow us to initiate tooling, and manufacturing, so we can make honigo available to you!


This unique design was inspired by nature, we have spent several months to create the finest holding case for our honey spheres and we got it... It looks just like a honeycomb structure!

Worker bees seal their comb cells for protecting honey with wax, to prevent absorption of moisture from the air. We are using the same principle, but with different materials.

In order to ensure the quality of the nineteen honey spheres, we cover their capsules with golden alu foil. That way to protect them from harmful external effects like; light, sunray, air, and humidity.


Why use honigo?

  • Rich honey taste
  • Quick to use
  • No more stickiness
  • Healthier than sugar
  • Separable capsules

Where Do You Get Your Honey From?


Our honigo products are made with 100% Hungarian Grade No. 1 honey.


Honigo Perfectly Fits Into Your Capsule Holder



What are the benefits of honey?


  • Honey has a long medicinal history of natural soothing properties
  • Honey is a natural sweetener and not refined
  • Honey is lower on the Glycemic index than sucrose and therefore a recommended sugar substitute for diabetics
  • Honey contains 22 amino acids and a variety of minerals essential for metabolism and can assist with weight loss
  • Honey can help to heal many digestive disorders including ulcers and upset stomachs
  • Honey has properties that can help cure insomnia
  • Honey is a source of energy including carbohydrates and is ideal for your working muscles since carbohydrates are the primary fuel the body uses for energy



We would like to expand our honigo selections for you, if we reach the goal!

story:
My wife and I (Team Gopher Broke) quit our jobs in Seattle to buy a crappy car for the Mongol Rally. We set out with 300 other teams on July 17, 2016 in this great motoring adventure.


  • Do you know how you will get there?  Kinda, sorta.  Here's our route.
  • Are we mechanically savvy?  Nope. Duct tape and zip ties ;)
  • Which way is north? Jon: points upwards, Jess: points north
  • Can you drive your manual car? Jon: yes, Jess: still learning


Meet Shalamar Goldie, our 1999 Toyota Yaris 1.0L Manual. All glorious 64hp and no A/C. Bought off a classified ad--just 3 days off of a classified ad after landing in London. We're going for the subtle look. 




Jon:

  1. Quit corporate job
  2. Sell everything, no storage unit allowed
  3. Pack my life into a 34L GORUCK GR2 backpack
  4. Work on my own design projects for a year
  5. Find the best pork belly dish of the world

Jessica:

  1. Quit healthcare job
  2. Donate everything he can't sell
  3. Pack my life into a 70L Deuter backpack
  4. Focus energy on wellness and resiliency for a year
  5. Travel hack like it's hot



What We Need & What You Get

To get clean, safe water to those in need!

- - -

For every $5 donated to charity:water, pick an exercise for me to do every morning of the ~7 week drive.

  • Squats
  • Push-ups
  • Burpees

The $2,000 goal breaks down like this:
  • Minimum of 20,000 squats, burpees, and push-ups and lots of awkward stares while wearing short shorts
  • That's 400 squats, burpees, and push-ups everyday for 50 days
  • If your company matches your donation, let me know and I'll gladly pump out the extra doses of fun.
- - -
Follow my progress as I keep track of it in this Google Doc (*not yet ready) everyday (I'm guessing there's no interwebs in the remote deserts and mountainsides). Better yet, misery loves company--join me in the physical challenge and do as many as you can from wherever you are for the ~50 days. It will be glorious. 



The Impact


$2,000 gets 66 people clean water.

$0 goes to our car/trip.

100% of the money will be used to build clean water projects, and when they're complete, charity:water will send photos and GPS coordinates to see the exact community we help. Updates will be sent to all backers and shown here.

Learn more about charity:water here. Rated 4/4 by Charity Navigator.  



Risks & Challenges

How will your crappy car make it all the way to Mongolia?  

I can't guarantee that our car will make it all the way. I hear teams do not make it all the way every year. All I can offer is the iron will to make it the whole way.

How will a scrawny desk jockey like you be able to pull this off?

I want to eat everything while we travel through these countries.  This will help me have a proper appetite.  As a member of the Goruck Challenge community, I love physical challenges.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Do burpees with me.  Or simply share this with friends and family that will get a kick out of this.

story:
Hello guys,

My name is Denis Dragiev, 21 years old. And the beautiful girl in the picture is one of my closest friends - Elitza.
I am working in restaurants and bars since I was 14 years old. For over 6 years I have developed a lot of skills in all possible positions. I started as a waiter in a summer village, recently I am working as a manager in one of the best developed brands (coffee house) in my country. 
During those years I have gained a lot of experience and I have decided what I want to do!
A couple of years ago me and a few friends had this crazy idea of creating a small company named #davaidavaisasha. We were working very hard over the last few months into pulling the idea out in the world. 
We came up with the name #davaidavaisasha 3 years ago when we were modeling in Milan, Italy. We were at this fabulous models party and it came out like a motto. 
Recently we started to use it as a name of a party upgrade services here in Sofia, Bulgaria. What does that mean? You have a bar, and you are opening the season. We make anything possible so the party is unforgettable. The guests, the music, the service... everything is done beautifully. And after we are done, your sales are increased at least 2 times more than before! So they say:
"-Before Sasha and after Sasha!"

Now we need your help

Our idea is to create a fashion brand under that name. Fashion you wear at parties. Fashion that says "I am at #davaidavaisasha's party, and I am wearing it". 

We will begin with t-shirts in order to save money to expand our industry. We need to turn our web-site into a e-shop. We need good advertising and portfolio presentations as much as we can make. 

One of my friends is a designer and she helps with the clothing part. The other person involved is good with connections and I am good with my communication skills. 

All the money we collect from indiegogo.com are going to be invested reasonably. For paper works and e-shop we need the amount of 1500 euro. After that for our designs we will spend another 3000-8000 euro. Part of the first line will be given to people that are famous in social media, in order to advertise them. The rest of the money we succeed getting will be spent for a strong PR campaign, 

The whole idea is to create a fashion brand that is to express your emotions above your flaws. 

We could do anything! We will do anything! The money is not enough for a whole fashion line but it is enough for a great start! 

Risks & Challenges

Are nothing to fear. We want to start as a small company. We will make anything we can so we put it together and conquer the world.

Unfortunately we are not very good with money. We are all students (Sofia University, National Art Academy, Sofia, Bocconi, Milan). Our families can not help us put our idea into real, and we really need your support! All we make we put it in our education and living expenses and we can't afford to buy even the materials to begin with.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us by giving us a big "like" on Facebook. (https://www.facebook.com/davaidavaisasha/) 

Keep an open mind on the fact that we are very very new, but our ambitions to get BIG are soon to be completed. 

*We also help! Each product we sell we donate 1 euro/dollar, etc. for charity! 

Thank you all,

Best,

Denis & Team

    Risks & Challenges Are nothing to fear. We want to start as a small company. We will make anything we can so we put it together and conquer the world.
Unfortunately we are not very good with money. We are all students (Sofia University, National Art Academy, Sofia, Bocconi, Milan). Our families can not help us put our idea into real, and we really need your support! All we make we put it in our education and living expenses and we can't afford to buy even the materials to begin with.
    Other Ways You Can Help You can also help us by giving us a big "like" on Facebook. (https://www.facebook.com/davaidavaisasha/) 
Keep an open mind on the fact that we are very very new, but our ambitions to get BIG are soon to be completed. 
*We also help! Each product we sell we donate 1 euro/dollar, etc. for charity! 
Thank you all,
Best,
Denis & Team

story:
Euphoric Tendencies is our unique, bold, and blossoming cosmetics company created and run by two young entrepreneurs. 

10% of our end yearly profit will be going back towards the Single Parent Resource Centre located in Victoria BC. 

"The single Parent has helped me in so many ways, I cannot thank them enough. Food was hard to come by and with the help of The Single Parent we had access to bread, school supplies, Christmas Hampers, Opportunities to go to camps in the community and clothing so that we were able to use the money we did have on things like groceries, rent and utilities.  I have always wanted to find ways to give back and this is it!" - Brianna Faith, Co Founder of Euphoric Tendencies Cosmetics.

Our goal is to bring colour back to life!


What do we mean by that?

A high percentage of girls to mature women are too afraid to wear bright coloured lipstick for fear that they may stand out. Some people might find that crazy but our CEO Brianna had that exact same problem and we don't want any one else feeling this way.

Our goal is for everyone to feel comfortable in whatever colours they choose, create new trends, help people be themselves, rock it, and bring back the love for colour to the next many generations!

How will we do that?

Well, we will need some help. We are currently working on finding investors and receiving donations to our Indiegogo account. Once we have sufficient funds we are planning on:

1. Ingredients to make our sample products and packaging.

2.  Funds to take our formula to a manufacturer and to pay for the cost of the manufacturer, tests and legalities.

3. Having a rental space to do all of our business, packaging and shipping from.

We are planning on creating a beginners kit. We can't give away all of the info but the kit will consist of three colours that are designed to help you work your way up to whatever bold colour you would like. Another thing we have going is that we have a few stores in Victoria BC, Canada who are already willing to start selling our products in store, which will make bold lipsticks much more accessible to the general public. Our biggest goal is to start off with lipsticks and to make them as natural as possible and then create other cosmetics. We are hoping to branch out and have our lipsticks all over the world one day!

We HATE labels. Quite often a large amount of people make girls feel bad about wearing bold lipstick or put them under categories and labels. For example; you don't have to be "goth" to wear black lipstick, in fact, it's actually quite classy! Blue lipstick can make an all black or grey outfit POP and orange lipstick can be the perfect touch for the month of October, to spice things up a bit. 

We hope you enjoy our idea. No pressure ;)

XOXO Brianna

story:
Our premiss is simple - each cask of whisky is unique, and each one tells a story. The wood, the previous content, age, temperature, location in the warehouse... Everything makes a difference. Two casks of a distillery filled at the same time and sitting next to each other can taste different because the wood crafts its magic over the years in a subtly distinctive way. This is why bigger single malt brands marry casks in large vats so that the master blender can try to make the taste of the brand consistent.

Chapter 7™, an award winning Swiss independent bottler, is the brainchild of Selim Evin. Selim was inspired by his Scottish grandfather’s passion for whisky and created Chapter 7™ in 2014 .He was taught at an early age that casks (barrels) are not just vessels but they give the whisky its character and soul and thinks that each has its own unique story to tell. So Selim travels to Scotland and Ireland to hand- select single casks from different distilleries. Then he custom bottles each one with its own story. For Selim it’s more than a business, it‘s a passion.

We are actively bottling selected single casks for our trade clients and our editions are recognised by whisky authorities like Jim Murray (Liquid Gold Award by Whisky Bible 2016). More info available on:  www.chapter7whisky.com

What makes us different?

Most independent bottlers are after casks from much-sought distilleries. We act as a spotlight for gems from lesser-known distilleries with exceptional quality and character. Liquid Gold Award (94.5 Points) by Jim Murray’s Whisky Bible 2016 for Chapter 7™ Tormore Distillery 1995 Single Cask Bottling is a good example where Jim Murray expresses his surprise by quoting “Tormore...? Really....? I mean really...???”. Whisky Bible also rated our Allt-a Bhainne, Glenrothes and Glentauchers distillery editions with 91.5, 91 and 89.5 points respectively. Similarly, our Miltonduff Distillery 2008 cask bottled at 65.1% alcohol by vol. received a Silver Medal at C2C Cup in Germany.

Some top distilleries don't want their distillery name mentioned on labels of independent bottlers to protect their trademarks. When we come across outstanding casks from those, we grab and bottle them respecting the brand owner's wishes. You can see the casks we have bottled to date on our website: www.chapter7whisky.com/casks 

  

Product Highlights

We mostly bottle single casks and occasionally we blend 2-3 casks from the same distillery that we think would marry well together for a good drinking experience.  

Our whiskies are cask strength (between 50%-65% alcohol by volume). 

We don't chill-filter whiskies to keep all the elements of the whisky untouched. 

Single casks typically give  between 150 -600 bottles depending on cask type. Small batch editions are usually between 300 - 1300 bottles. 

Some of our casks are from distilleries that don't have own distillery bottling hence are collectable. 

Each of our bottles are hand-numbered stating bottle number and batch total.


Why crowdfunding?

Although we are a successful start-up we need your help to build a delivery system to reach those who can't buy our brand through traditional distribution or who are  in countries where we don't have a reseller. We don't want to disappoint our 7000+ Facebook followers when some ask "where can I get Chapter 7™ in my country?".

To start our Club, we need members! We chose crowdfunding on Indiegogo because we think it is the best platform for exposure and for reaching maximum number of members.

What will you get as a member?

Through our club membership we will offer you:

  • Unique Chapter 7™ whiskies with very limited availability 
  • Rare bottles from other independent bottlers & distilleries
  • Bottler's prices
  • Early cask alerts for early birds to enjoy a fat rebate
  • Whisky sets containing rare stuff
  • Whisky Tasters 
  • Some "members only" editions
  • Special packaging editions 
  • Personal contact with us

Our campaign target

With the exposure and your help, we would like to enrol as many members as possible to our club,  set up the logistics, negotiate delivery rates to your home, upgrade our web-store, develop some limited edition packaging and offer you exclusive membership terms (really, check our perks).

What if we don't reach our target?

There is no risk for those purchasing membership perks since all the products in our campaign are in stock.Our founding members will be our most valued clients and assets. We believe they will help us spreading the word and grow Wanthology Club . If we can't reach our target, we may start from a smaller membership base but still deliver the goodies.

Perks Explained in Detail

49 EUR + Shipping (Membership)

When the campaign ends, we will send you a whisky set containing 5 x 50 ml (50 ml is equivalent to 2 drams). You will also get a lifetime discount code that will allow you to buy any item you like on our Club Website with a discount of 10%.

89 EUR + Shipping  (Silver Membership)

When the campaign ends, we will send you a 70 cl bottle of Chapter 7™ Highland Single Malt from an undisclosed distillery. You will also get a lifetime discount code that will allow you to buy any item you like on our Club Website with a discount of 15%.

129 EUR + Shipping (Gold Membership)

When the campaign ends, we will send you a 70 cl bottle of Chapter 7™ Speyside Single Malt, Glen Moray 25 Years Old. You will also get a lifetime discount code that will allow you to buy any item you like on our Club Website with a discount of 20%.

179 EUR + Shipping (Platinum Membership)

You are paying 179 EUR for 4 whisky sets. When our campaign ends, we will send you a whisky set containing 5 x 50 ml (50 ml is equivalent to 2 drams). And than you will get another 3 whisky sets with 3 months intervals. Say you get your set in June, you will get another one in September and another one in December and another one in March. There will be no automatic renewal on your credit card once we deliver you the last one.

You will also get a lifetime discount code that will allow you to buy any item you like on our Club Website with a discount of 25%. You will be given priority amongst other members and will be informed 4-6 weeks ahead of cask releases to make sure   that you get what you want before limited editions run out of stock.

379 EUR + Shipping (Diamond Membership)

You are paying 379 EUR for 4 x 70 cl bottles of Chapter 7™ single cask or small batch whisky. When our campaign ends, we will send you a bottle. And than you will get another 3 bottles with 3 months intervals. Say you get your first bottle in June, you will get another one in September and another one in December and another one in March. There will be no automatic renewal on your credit card after we deliver you the last one.

It is difficult to foresee a year ahead what whiskies you will get in this perk but we will make sure that our members are happy with what they get in terms of quality and value. If the whiskies are younger than 12 YO than they are either rare or very special.

You will also get a lifetime discount code that will allow you to buy any item you like on our Club Website with a discount of 30%. You will be given priority amongst other members and will be informed 4-6 weeks ahead of cask releases to make sure   that you get what you want before limited editions run out of stock.

1900 EUR "We become mates" membership

You are paying 1900 EUR for 5 x 70 cl bottles of Chapter 7™ single cask or small batch whisky brought to you by us. You chose the location! Your home or your local club, we will be there. Please note that a 70 cl. bottle serves 27 drams (+1 for us) so invite friends and family. This perk is available only in Switzerland, Germany, France, Netherlands and Belgium. 

 "This photo evokes memories of days gone by. Studious men seeking knowledge amongst the chaos. Much like the Malt Masters of old learning their art in the pursuit of whisky greatness, When I raise a dram, I like to think of all great men who have been involved in crafting it. From the cooper to the Malt Master and everyone in between. Slainte." Sam Jones, 11/11/2014, Facebook.

Selim Evin, April 2016

story:
Thanks for taking a moment to check out our campaign.

My grandmother Leona had a small farm in Pocatello, Id for many years. As the crops grew in and it became harvest time throughout the years she would sell her bounty at the local farmers market in town to not only the local people but to the restaurants as well. As a young adult working my way up in the culinary world I had many opportunities to visit and work alongside my grandmother learning the importance of small farms and what they provided to small communities. This would play a big part in where my career path would take me in the future.

I grew up in Virginia for a majority of my life before taking a leap and moving to Washington. My studies in the culinary field started at Johnson & Wales University in Norfolk. From there I have spent the past 16 years working all aspects of the culinary world. Doing Fine/Upscale Dining in places such as The Fat Canary and Prima Bistro; Bar/Steakhouse’s such as The Grate Steak, The Taphouse Hampton, and Lonestar Steakhouse; and rounding out my career with stints at catering companies and working as a dining facility contractor for the Army in Iraq/Afghanistan. 

While I was in Virginia I met my business partner Brittany who has a background in Marriage and family Counseling as well as ran her own successful custom cupcake and cake company in the Washington DC metro area. After a couple years of debate we decided to head west and pursue our dream of opening a little restaurant or food truck. We ended up on Whidbey Island where I took a job at Prima Bistro. After a couple years of trying my partner and I were finally able to get our little Food Cart(Whidbey Farm-to-Truck) going at the local farmers market here at Bayview Corner on Whidbey Island in 2015. We were able to sling out some great food all summer long with a menu that centered on global street foods and farm to truck cuisine. The menu had items such as Cubans, Sliders, Butter Chicken, Chicken Tikka Masala, and our take of street food brunch. We rounded out a great summer and fall market and then took a break during the winter to focus on expansion after our little cart became unavailable to use anymore.

We are now looking at Petosa Roasta, which opened in the summer of 2015 selling killer BBQ. The owner has decided to sell off the Petosa Roasta, and we are jumping on the opportunity. This would make a great choice for us to expand into and provide the community with same great foods we offered last summer and the ability to pursue our other passion of BBQ.

With your help we can reach our goal of $30,000 to help us put a down payment on the business. This will allow us to finance the rest with small business loans and get us up and running by early summer. Once we open we will be able to bring BBQ back to South Whidbey along with an array of daily specials and catering opportunities.

Please take a moment to look at our perks and see which one would work for you. If you aren’t able to contribute, that’s OK too, all we ask is that you share this campaign with as many folks as possible.

Many thanks from the Leona’s Team

story:
Short Summary

For the past couple months people have asked how they can get involved and help with the work Etter Consulting has been doing the families adopting and this is your chance! Through this crowdfunding campaign you can donate and or buy Etter Consulting apparel that helps us raise money to reach these three goals:

● Bring more adoptee focused events to Lancaster  
● Get “When Your Family Doesn’t Look Like You” into potential Publishers hands
● Help us get an official promo video made

Why These Goals? 

  • Bring more adoptee focused events to Lancaster.
    Lancaster County has a large number of adoptees especially transracial adoptees, we hope to bring events that center around the adoptee experience. These event will also be educational for adoptive parents and parents considering adoption. 
     
  • Get “When Your Family Doesn’t Look Like You” into potential Publishers hands
    As many know founder of Etter Consulting, Isaac Etter, is writing a book on transracial adoption and his experience as a transracial adoptee. This campaign help us get his book into the hands of potential l publishers who could get the book into bookstores everywhere.  
     
  • Help Etter Consulting get an official promo video made.
    In the past couple weeks Etter Consulting has been asked to present at multiple conferences and adoption agencies on transracial adoption and our work in family preparation for transracial adoption. We beleive an official promo video will help us market our services to families, conferences, adoption agencies, and colleges. 

The Impact

Over the last 9 months Etter Consulting has had the opportunity to share at several adoption agencies, work with many families, and even at present at Millersville University. Here are what some of the people have to say about their experience with Etter Consulting. 

 

"Isaac Etter is well versed and articulate on the subject matter of transracial adoption. Through his firsthand experience as a black child raised in a white family, Isaac is able to share his journey in a honest, direct and respectful manner. He speaks frankly about the identity issues with which many transracially adopted children struggle. Isaac also brings insight and a thoughtful perspective on a range of related transracial adoption issues."

— Mark Unger, Regional Director- Bethany Christian Services

 

"We had the privilege of meeting Isaac during our foster care training with Bethany Christian Services. He shared his own adoption story with such transparency, authenticity, and vulnerability that made him immediately relatable. His openness to sharing his knowledge, wisdom, and life experience on the topic of transracial adoption makes him a great resource. He is incredibly helpful!"

— McClymont Family

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money here are some other ways you can help:

  • Share this crowdfunding campaign with your friends!
  • Tell your friends who have adopted or are thinking about adopting about Etter Consulting.
  • Tell your friends and colleagues about the work Etter consulting is doing with adopting families. 

Thank you!

Help Etter Consulting get an official promo video made.In the past couple weeks Etter Consulting has been asked to present at multiple conferences and adoption agencies on transracial adoption and our work in family preparation for transracial adoption. We beleive an official promo video will help us market our services to families, conferences, adoption agencies, and colleges. 


The Impact
Over the last 9 months Etter Consulting has had the opportunity to share at several adoption agencies, work with many families, and even at present at Millersville University. Here are what some of the people have to say about their experience with Etter Consulting. 
 
"Isaac Etter is well versed and articulate on the subject matter of transracial adoption. Through his firsthand experience as a black child raised in a white family, Isaac is able to share his journey in a honest, direct and respectful manner. He speaks frankly about the identity issues with which many transracially adopted children struggle. Isaac also brings insight and a thoughtful perspective on a range of related transracial adoption issues."
— Mark Unger, Regional Director- Bethany Christian Services
 
"We had the privilege of meeting Isaac during our foster care training with Bethany Christian Services. He shared his own adoption story with such transparency, authenticity, and vulnerability that made him immediately relatable. His openness to sharing his knowledge, wisdom, and life experience on the topic of transracial adoption makes him a great resource. He is incredibly helpful!"
— McClymont Family
 
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money here are some other ways you can help:

Share this crowdfunding campaign with your friends!
Tell your friends who have adopted or are thinking about adopting about Etter Consulting.
Tell your friends and colleagues about the work Etter consulting is doing with adopting families. 

Thank you!

story:
The IntraAwareness Story

IntraAwareness was created as a way to help people to connect to their resources to live their best life possible. Since 2011 we have been providing clients and community with classes and courses to elevate their lives in all for pyramids of life; Physical, Psychological, Spiritual and Financial. 

After creating a beautiful High Vibration community and tribe by word of mouth experiences and referrals, we are now ready to launch a variety of courses, classes, coaching programs and bodywork in one central studio! 

This community campaign will be used to simultaneously expand and focus our offerings from multiple locations to one central home located in the Uptown neighborhood of Minneapolis. Our first courses in the new studio have begun this summer, with public classes & courses starting Fall 2019. Your contribution will directly support the studio as we build and launch our courses and classes.

All contributions will be received with an open heart and sincere gratitude as we launch into our next phase of consciously raising the vibration of humanity, one person at a time. 
 

Tell Me More About the IntraAwareness Lifestyle Studio

We will be providing the community with weekly classes, courses and community-building events that will nourish a person's Holistic Lifestyle that includes the IntraAwareness 4-Pyramids of life; Physical, Psychological, Spiritual and Wealth.

In addition, the IntraAwareness Lifestyle Studio will offer

  • Dedicated space for personal coaching
  • Massage therapy 
  • Grace & Harmony | Meditation Room
  • Retail storefront with locally sourced high vibe products
  • Career training courses and
  • Fitness classes 

This boutique studio offers the most complete holistic lifestyle offerings in the world.



At the IntraAwareness Lifestyle Studio, we offer the highest quality physical training and recovery, as well as self-care therapy. Our fitness classes and self-care services all revolve around you and your goals. 

  • Personal Training (1-on-1)
  • TRX Fitness Training
  • Core Training
  • Integrated Yoga
  • Dance Classes
  • Massage Services
  • Cupping Therapy
  • Craniosacral Therapy
  • Jade Facial
  • Nutrition Coaching
  • Guided Juice Cleanses


IntraAwareness offers mental coaching training from 1-hour classes to 5-month professional certificate courses. For over 20 years, IntraAwareness has been building and refining our programs to enable you to grow and improve in any area of your life from personal growth and development, leadership and communication to creating/advancing your own career. 

  • Life Coaching (1-on-1)
  • Business Coaching (1-on-1 or Businesses)
  • Individual & Group Hypnotherapy
  • Individual & Group Coaching
  • ONLP™ Training
  • Hypnotherapy Training
  • IntraAwareness Coaching Program™

 

IntraAwareness has cultivated decades of experience, traveling the world, learning sacred ancient esoteric practices and bringing them back to the US to share them here with you.  We provide a safe and sacred space for spiritual growth and personal development.  The spiritual leaders at IntraAwareness will guide you to more peace and balance into your life with these classes:

  • Spiritual Guidance (1-on-1)
  • Guided Meditation
  • Oneness Blessing 
  • Grace & Harmony | Meditation Room
  • Crystal Grid Experience™


IntraAwareness consciously integrates and defines Wealth as the accumulation of Physical Health, Psychological Success, Spiritual Connection, and Financial Freedom. We coach and mentor the integration of  wealth in all areas of life at our in-person and online events and opportunities including: 

  • Wealth Mentoring (1-on-1)
  • Group Wealth Coaching (for Members)
  • Online Complimentary Videos
  • Online Wealth Training
     

What our Students are saying about IntraAwareness

 

Stretch Goal

We are delighted to offer a stretch goal gift in the event that our $40,000 campaign goal is met.  If you've contributed at the Early Bird Membership perk level ($500) and higher, you will automatically receive this backpack.

"This is so fun! Backers of this campaign will receive the perfect bag to stash fitness gear, essential oils, and their most comfortable eye pillows for studio meditations!"

- Amanda Rangel, IntraAwareness Co-Founder

 

Our Giant Leap 

We've signed a 4-year lease expanding to a beautiful physical space in the Uptown neighborhood of Minneapolis, MN and have already invested over $100,000 to get us this far. The contributions from this Indiegogo Campaign will help to accelerate our plans to offer even more classes, courses, and events through purchasing additional equipment & fixtures as well as securing the highest level teachers and trainers in the Twin Cities area. 

We feel incredibly supported on many levels as we’ve made this commitment and are remaining open to overcoming obstacles that come up along the way.  Our team is growing and the number of resources we have available to us is expanding every day, and we believe that our flexibility and willingness to evolve will allow us to move forward gracefully through this process.  Your financial support means the world to us, and we are delighted to be able to provide one-of-a-kind perks to you as an extra special “Thank You” for your contribution.
 

Our Team

Jeremiah Rangel - Founder

Amanda Rangel - Co-Founder

Ian Somerville - Coach and Massage Therapist

Leah Somerville - Coach and Massage Therapist

Nina Potter - Assistant Trainer

Erin Gamache - Marketing Manager

Nick Gamache - Technology Wizard 

Casey Lowe - Studio Assistant

Jordane Lauver - Studio Assistant
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Additional ways your love, energy, and support can be expressed:

  • Share your experience with others about our training, classes or 1-1 coaching with your friends and family.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools for this fundraiser.
  • Spread the word on social media and help us move forward in quantum ways!

_____________________________________________________________

We are delighted to share in this growth & expansion with you! Thank you for your thoughts, prayers, and financial contributions to the success for this project. To learn more about us please check us out on social media.

story:
Who we are

Churn Urban Creamery started as a pop-up in April 2016, owned by a husband and wife team.  Our focus was to provide farm fresh ice cream, a healthier/less sweet option, in our little renegade ice cream cart.

Along the way, we wanted to create and nurture relationships with different farmers so we could get our hands on the freshest and most delicious ingredients.  We even took the liberty of growing some of the ingredients in our humble backyard urban farm.

After popping up all over San Francisco and the Bay Area, working private events, farmers markets and festivals, we are needing a more permanent home.  We are now working on a brick and mortar location.  Contributions to our campaign will help us make the finish line.  And what a perfect neighborhood to bring farm fresh ice cream to, the Portola neighborhood, the Garden District of San Francisco.  And what a perfect space, one that was originally a 1920s sweets shop. 

 

 

Funding

Churn is raising $21,000 to fund aspects of the project.

  • We will be needing 11,000 for a new batch freezer.  This equipment is what freezes the liquid base and adds air to the product to make it ice cream.
  • We will be needing $8,000 to build a custom bar and stools for that old times soda jerk feel.
  • We will be needing $2,000 for a 16 flavor dipping cabinet, the type of display freezer you see at the ice cream parlors.

Reach Goal: $30,000.

Once we reach our initial goal of $21,000 we would like to achieve our reach goal of $30,000 to add in a convection oven to make our special ice cream mix ins, in house.

The Mission

Mission Statement: Churn Urban Creamery’s mission is to provide an egg-less ice cream product through a more sustainable ice cream brand that serves the conscious consumer and supports local businesses and urban farms.  

To focus on sustainability and seasonality is important to our business.  To provide the consumer with the freshest possible fruit, at peak season is the goal.  And to grow many of those ingredients ourselves is the highest goal. 

INGREDIENTS GROWN BY CHURN FOUNDERS  - FINISHED PRODUCT

History

The tallest building in the neighborhood, this old grand movie palace has a place in the hearts of locals from the Portola neighborhood.  It opened in 1927, featuring black and white movies with an entry fee of 25 cents. The main storefront was originally a sweets shop.  Throughout the years, the space has evolved from the sweets shop, to a diner, and finally into Johnson's BBQ.  The theater and the main storefront has been abandoned and decaying these past few years until the summer of 2017 when SF's Office of Economic and Workplace Development and the Portola Neighborhood Association funded a full revamp of the theater facade.

Churn Urban Creamery is looking to renovate the main storefront space and breathe new life into this space that already has so much history.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We thank you for reading through our campaign info.  We would be so appreciative if you would share this with your family and friends to get the word out about Churn's creamery!  Please use the share tools and post on your social media or to send via email.

Thank you, thank you! We look forward to scooping for you!

 

A never-ending thank you to Sergio Rodriguez for capturing, producing, and editing this wonderful crowdfunding video.  We love you to pieces!!!  Original music by Carrie Waye, "All the Wolves" @allthewolves on Instagram.

story:
Who am I?

I'm Todd Burbo, founder of Harrison's. I've been part of Chicago's coffee scene for well over a decade, having represented Intelligentsia, Dark Matter, and Stumptown Coffee, among others. I've helped small business owners across the country build great spaces and serve great coffee.

 

Looking for a different challenge, I moved to Austin three years ago, but Chicago never left my mind- Just ask any Texan I've ever spoken to.

There were so many things to miss, but it was the neighborhood communities that brought me back. These pocket communities flourish in Chicago like in no other American city- That feeling of living among millions, yet knowing every face you pass on the sidewalk? That's uniquely Chicago.

 

 

What your contribution will create:

  • This campaign will allow me to do what I do best (give hot takes while serving coffee; surround myself with talented friends), while giving others a space to do whatever it is they do best. 
  • I'm asking for $15,000 to rehab the existing space and cafe equipment, as well as implement a new food menu. 
  • With the cafe operational, remaining funds will go toward amenities and equipment for communal use by registered clubs. This could be anything from music equipment to art supplies, and I will be taking requests from existing clubs in the future. 

 

The Impact

Aside from getting you a cool t-shirt or poster, your contribution will ensure that the Cup & Spoon space will remain a local, independently-owned business with longstanding ties to the neighborhood. And as Harrison's, the space will incubate positive social change and the creativity of our neighbors!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please share this campaign with those who might! The blue collar mid-westerner in me struggles with self-promotion, so any help spreading the word will be greatly appreciated!

story:
La version française  des PERKS est complètement à la fin du texte.

** ENGLISH VERSION is bellow the french version. 

INTRO VERSION FR. 

Créons le lieu de rencontre parfait à Montréal pour les amateurs de sushis vegan et sushis poisson... Souchi offre une variété impressionnante de 60 sushis vegan & 40 sushis poisson. Grâce à deux cuisines indépendantes, nos sushis vegan seront préparés à part des sushis poisson. Nous sommes tellement occupés présentement dans notre petit restaurant, que nous devons déménager dans un plus grand espace afin de fournir à la demande, tout en gardant une qualité exceptionnelle de nos produits. Avec un local 5x plus grand, nous pourrons accueillir 36 clients à la fois. Nous offrirons également l'expérience culinaire de sushis vegan à volonté tous les mercredis et dimanches, pour seulement 30$ par personne.      

 

VOTEZ POUR SOUCHi...

The Sushi Artist (anciennement connu sous le nom d’Alex) est le créateur d'un menu des plus impressionnant au monde, avec la plus grande variété offerte : 60 sushis vegan et 40 sushis poisson.  «  HEIIINNN??! Il y a plus de sushis Vegan que de sushi au poisson? », ET OUI !

Maintenant que nous avons votre attention, c'est le temps d'aller droit au but.  

Nous avons besoin de votre support pour la survie de la “Souchi race". Nous devons absolument agrandir pour pouvoir rester sur le boulevard Monk. Présentement, notre emplacement est beaucoup trop petit pour notre achalandage, nous sommes victimes de notre succès ;-)

L’espace restreint nous empêche de nous développer et risque d’éteindre notre « race ».. Pour préserver “the Souchi race”, et nous donner l’opportunité de vous accueillir de la meilleure façon qu’il soit. Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour nous permettre d’investir dans un local plus grand.

Avec 25 000$, nous pourrons ouvrir à un nouvel emplacement d'ici Février 2019. Le nouveau restaurant sera au 6615 boulevard Monk, et il pourra accommoder 36 clients tout en ayant 2 cuisines indépendantes; une 100% vegan et l'autre non-vegan. Nous pensons qu'il ne devrait pas être difficile de profiter d'un bon repas entre amis et famille, c'est pour cela que nous travaillons fort pour créer le lieu idéal de rencontre gastronomique.  

Un plus grand local nous permettra de réduire l'attente en général, “faire le come-back” de nos sushis dessert, d’obtenir notre permis d’alcool, d’aménager notre restaurant de façon chaleureuse et spacieuse : 26 places aux tables, 10 places au bar. Celui-ci nous permettra également de rendre tous les mercredis et dimanches 100% vegan.
Les sushis vegan & poisson seront tout de même disponibles à la carte du Jeudi au Samedi.

Si vous n’êtes pas dans la mesure de nous aider monétairement, vous pouvez grandement nous aider en partageant cette campagne sur les réseaux sociaux et en parlant à votre entourage.

Un GROS MERCI de la part de toute l’équipe de la “Souchi race” & The Sushi Artist.

 

 

VOTE FOR SOUCHi...

The Sushi Artist (formerly known as Alex) is the creator of the most impressive & diverse sushi menu in the world, with over 60 vegan sushi & 40 piscivore sushi. I know this is what you must be thinking now.  "WAAAAAAAAAT.... you have more Vegan sushi than Fish sushi?"  

Now that we've got your attention time to get serious.

We need your support for the survival of the "Souchi race". We have to expand in order to survive on the Blvd. Monk. Our current location is getting too cramped and this is problematic because we can’t generate any more income out of this location because of the limitation. 

With 25,000$ we will be able to get the new spot ready for February 2019. The new location at 6615 Blvd. Monk can accommodate 36 guests at a time and have enough space for 2 independent kitchens, one 100% Vegan and one Non-Vegan. We believe that eating out with your friends and family should be easy. This is why we are working on creating the perfect hangout spot for everybody. 

With a larger location, we will reduce overall waiting time, bring back sushi desserts, get our liquor license, 26 table seating and 10 bar seating, making Wednesday and Sunday 100% vegan. Fish & Vegan sushi will also be available à la carte from Thursday to Saturday.

This will help us to be more efficient and allow more customers to enjoy their experience at Souchi bar.

Let's create a positive impact in the world because we will prove that having a sophisticated vegan and fish menu without compromise on flavors or taste is possible. We will be the only restaurant in the world to offer an Vegan sushi with 60 choices with the options for All you can Eat on Wednesday & Sunday. But don't worry we also serve Fish & Vegan sushi à la carte from Thursday to Saturday.

If you are unable to help us with money you can always help us by Sharing this Campaign via Social Media and talk about it to all your Friends. 

A big thank you from the team of the "Souchi race" and The Sushi Artist.

 

PERKS VERSION FRANÇAISE.

SUPA-VEGAN PERK 250$ | SUPA-VEGAN

Vous payez seulement 25$ au lieu du prix régulier de 30$ pour les Sushis Vegan à Volonté tous les mercredis et dimanches.

Vous avez aussi un crédit en magasin de 200$ pour tous achats.

* Le prix fixe de 25$/visite est seulement pour les mecredis et dimanches.
* Cette option est seulement disponible sur Indiegogo, c'est maintenant ou jamais!!!
* Pourboire et taxes ne sont pas inclus dans le crédit de 200$.

CACTUS PERK 100$ | CACTUS

Pour chaque don de 100$, nous allons ajouter un cactus à notre restaurant.

Obetenez 2 Billets pour les soirées Sushi Vegan à Volonté.

Vous allez pouvoir nommer votre cactus et vous en occuper ( arrosage mensuel ). En plus, vous avez un rabais de 10% tant et aussi longtemps que votre cactus est en vie.

Nous allons offrir un environnement favorable pour tous les cactus.

 

SUPA-FISH PERK 250$ | SUPA-POISSON

Vous avez un rabais de 10% à vie sur tous les achats.

Vous avez un crédit de 200$ en magasin.


* Pourboire & les taxes applicables ne sont pas inclus dans le crédit de 200$

ALL YOU CAN EAT VOUCHER 30$| A VOLONTÉ

Vous recevez un Crédit pour nos soirées à Volonté Sushi Vegan.

* Crédit utilisable les mercredis et dimanches.
* Réservation obligatoire. Veuillez mentionner le crédit de Indiegogo.
* Utilisation unique.

* Pourboire et taxes ne sont pas inclus.

WHERE'S My TABLE? 250$ | OU EST MA TABLE?

Ton rêve est d'avoir une table à ton nom ?

Tu peux réaliser ton rêve, nous allons nommer une de nos tables en ton honneur.

Toi et tes amis avez un rabais de 10% à chaque fois que vous mangez sur votre table.

Lorsque tu veux reserver, nous te donnerons la priorité pour ta table.

Une plaque avec ton nom inscrit dessus, fait spécialement par The Sushi Artist.

I GOT THE BIG TABLE 500$ | J'AI LA GROSSE TABLE

Nous allons nommer la Grosse Table en ton honneur.

La table fait 10 pied de long et peut accommoder 10 personnes.

Toi et tes amis avez un rabais de 10% à chaque fois que vous mangerez sur votre table.

Lorsque tu veux reserver nous te donnons la priorité sur ta table.

Une plaque avec ton nom inscrit dessus fait spécialement par The Sushi Artist.

Tu as le contrôle sur la TV, PlayStation for Netflix, Crunchyroll & PS4 games.

 

1 YEAR OF FREE VEGAN SUSHI 1000$ | MANGE GRATUIT PENDANT 1 AN

Pour 1000$ tu manges les sushis végans gratuit pendant 1 an complet sur place seulement.

Les amis qui t'accompagnent, payerons seulement 25$ pour manger les sushis végans à volonté.

*Renouvelable à 1000$ par année.

* Pourboire et taxe applicables ne sont pas inclus.

* Breuvage et Alcool ne sont pas inclus.

* Aucun take-out 

 

20$ DONATION 20$ | DONATION DE 20$

Merci pour vôtre donation!
story_txt: La version française  des PERKS est complètement à la fin du texte.** ENGLISH VERSION is bellow the french version. INTRO VERSION FR. Créons le lieu de rencontre parfait à Montréal pour les amateurs de sushis vegan et sushis poisson... Souchi offre une variété impressionnante de 60 sushis vegan & 40 sushis poisson. Grâce à deux cuisines indépendantes, nos sushis vegan seront préparés à part des sushis poisson. Nous sommes tellement occupés présentement dans notre petit restaurant, que nous devons déménager dans un plus grand espace afin de fournir à la demande, tout en gardant une qualité exceptionnelle de nos produits. Avec un local 5x plus grand, nous pourrons accueillir 36 clients à la fois. Nous offrirons également l'expérience culinaire de sushis vegan à volonté tous les mercredis et dimanches, pour seulement 30$ par personne.       VOTEZ POUR SOUCHi...The Sushi Artist (anciennement connu sous le nom d’Alex) est le créateur d'un menu des plus impressionnant au monde, avec la plus grande variété offerte : 60 sushis vegan et 40 sushis poisson.  «  HEIIINNN??! Il y a plus de sushis Vegan que de sushi au poisson? », ET OUI !Maintenant que nous avons votre attention, c'est le temps d'aller droit au but.  Nous avons besoin de votre support pour la survie de la “Souchi race". Nous devons absolument agrandir pour pouvoir rester sur le boulevard Monk. Présentement, notre emplacement est beaucoup trop petit pour notre achalandage, nous sommes victimes de notre succès ;-)L’espace restreint nous empêche de nous développer et risque d’éteindre notre « race ».. Pour préserver “the Souchi race”, et nous donner l’opportunité de vous accueillir de la meilleure façon qu’il soit. Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour nous permettre d’investir dans un local plus grand.Avec 25 000$, nous pourrons ouvrir à un nouvel emplacement d'ici Février 2019. Le nouveau restaurant sera au 6615 boulevard Monk, et il pourra accommoder 36 clients tout en ayant 2 cuisines indépendantes; une 100% vegan et l'autre non-vegan. Nous pensons qu'il ne devrait pas être difficile de profiter d'un bon repas entre amis et famille, c'est pour cela que nous travaillons fort pour créer le lieu idéal de rencontre gastronomique.  Un plus grand local nous permettra de réduire l'attente en général, “faire le come-back” de nos sushis dessert, d’obtenir notre permis d’alcool, d’aménager notre restaurant de façon chaleureuse et spacieuse : 26 places aux tables, 10 places au bar. Celui-ci nous permettra également de rendre tous les mercredis et dimanches 100% vegan.Les sushis vegan & poisson seront tout de même disponibles à la carte du Jeudi au Samedi.Si vous n’êtes pas dans la mesure de nous aider monétairement, vous pouvez grandement nous aider en partageant cette campagne sur les réseaux sociaux et en parlant à votre entourage.Un GROS MERCI de la part de toute l’équipe de la “Souchi race” & The Sushi Artist.  VOTE FOR SOUCHi...The Sushi Artist (formerly known as Alex) is the creator of the most impressive & diverse sushi menu in the world, with over 60 vegan sushi & 40 piscivore sushi. I know this is what you must be thinking now.  "WAAAAAAAAAT.... you have more Vegan sushi than Fish sushi?"  Now that we've got your attention time to get serious.We need your support for the survival of the "Souchi race". We have to expand in order to survive on the Blvd. Monk. Our current location is getting too cramped and this is problematic because we can’t generate any more income out of this location because of the limitation. With 25,000$ we will be able to get the new spot ready for February 2019. The new location at 6615 Blvd. Monk can accommodate 36 guests at a time and have enough space for 2 independent kitchens, one 100% Vegan and one Non-Vegan. We believe that eating out with your friends and family should be easy. This is why we are working on creating the perfect hangout spot for everybody. With a larger location, we will reduce overall waiting time, bring back sushi desserts, get our liquor license, 26 table seating and 10 bar seating, making Wednesday and Sunday 100% vegan. Fish & Vegan sushi will also be available à la carte from Thursday to Saturday.This will help us to be more efficient and allow more customers to enjoy their experience at Souchi bar.Let's create a positive impact in the world because we will prove that having a sophisticated vegan and fish menu without compromise on flavors or taste is possible. We will be the only restaurant in the world to offer an Vegan sushi with 60 choices with the options for All you can Eat on Wednesday & Sunday. But don't worry we also serve Fish & Vegan sushi à la carte from Thursday to Saturday.If you are unable to help us with money you can always help us by Sharing this Campaign via Social Media and talk about it to all your Friends. A big thank you from the team of the "Souchi race" and The Sushi Artist. PERKS VERSION FRANÇAISE.SUPA-VEGAN PERK 250$ | SUPA-VEGANVous payez seulement 25$ au lieu du prix régulier de 30$ pour les Sushis Vegan à Volonté tous les mercredis et dimanches.Vous avez aussi un crédit en magasin de 200$ pour tous achats.* Le prix fixe de 25$/visite est seulement pour les mecredis et dimanches.* Cette option est seulement disponible sur Indiegogo, c'est maintenant ou jamais!!!* Pourboire et taxes ne sont pas inclus dans le crédit de 200$.CACTUS PERK 100$ | CACTUSPour chaque don de 100$, nous allons ajouter un cactus à notre restaurant.Obetenez 2 Billets pour les soirées Sushi Vegan à Volonté.Vous allez pouvoir nommer votre cactus et vous en occuper ( arrosage mensuel ). En plus, vous avez un rabais de 10% tant et aussi longtemps que votre cactus est en vie.Nous allons offrir un environnement favorable pour tous les cactus. SUPA-FISH PERK 250$ | SUPA-POISSONVous avez un rabais de 10% à vie sur tous les achats.Vous avez un crédit de 200$ en magasin.* Pourboire & les taxes applicables ne sont pas inclus dans le crédit de 200$ALL YOU CAN EAT VOUCHER 30$| A VOLONTÉVous recevez un Crédit pour nos soirées à Volonté Sushi Vegan.* Crédit utilisable les mercredis et dimanches.* Réservation obligatoire. Veuillez mentionner le crédit de Indiegogo.* Utilisation unique.* Pourboire et taxes ne sont pas inclus.WHERE'S My TABLE? 250$ | OU EST MA TABLE?Ton rêve est d'avoir une table à ton nom ?Tu peux réaliser ton rêve, nous allons nommer une de nos tables en ton honneur.Toi et tes amis avez un rabais de 10% à chaque fois que vous mangez sur votre table.Lorsque tu veux reserver, nous te donnerons la priorité pour ta table.Une plaque avec ton nom inscrit dessus, fait spécialement par The Sushi Artist.I GOT THE BIG TABLE 500$ | J'AI LA GROSSE TABLENous allons nommer la Grosse Table en ton honneur.La table fait 10 pied de long et peut accommoder 10 personnes.Toi et tes amis avez un rabais de 10% à chaque fois que vous mangerez sur votre table.Lorsque tu veux reserver nous te donnons la priorité sur ta table.Une plaque avec ton nom inscrit dessus fait spécialement par The Sushi Artist.Tu as le contrôle sur la TV, PlayStation for Netflix, Crunchyroll & PS4 games. 1 YEAR OF FREE VEGAN SUSHI 1000$ | MANGE GRATUIT PENDANT 1 ANPour 1000$ tu manges les sushis végans gratuit pendant 1 an complet sur place seulement.Les amis qui t'accompagnent, payerons seulement 25$ pour manger les sushis végans à volonté.*Renouvelable à 1000$ par année.* Pourboire et taxe applicables ne sont pas inclus.* Breuvage et Alcool ne sont pas inclus.* Aucun take-out  20$ DONATION 20$ | DONATION DE 20$Merci pour vôtre donation!

story:
DEEP CUTS envisions a venue offering a wide range of workshops and opportunities aimed at highlighting the talents of aspiring artists and musicians. My goal is to transform a wholesome, daytime deli into a nighttime artists’ sanctuary showcasing bands, movie screenings, and art shows whetting the appetites of a diversity of artists and clients. DEEP CUTS aims to create relationships between the local community and artists in a common milieu where the products of food, music, and art continue to satisfy a growing audience.

 

It takes a lot to start a space like this, which is why I’m looking to raise money for the following:

 
  • Basic operating costs for 6 months (commissary rent, liability insurance, utilities, etc.)
  • Hourly practice rooms (PA system, lockers, drum kit, amps, etc.)
  • Build out/Renovation
  • Kitchen Equipment (deli slicer, sandwich prep station, walk-in/freezer, etc.)
  • Dining Area (tables, chairs, plates, silverware, glasses, etc.)
  • Licenses and Permits
 

Please help me get the word out by telling your friends about this and sharing this Indiegogo page on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and all that.

 

I really appreciate you taking the time to read about my vision, and hope you consider making a contribution. With your help, we can make DEEP CUTS DELI a reality.

Show Love:

http://deepcutsdeli.com

https://facebook.com/DeepCutsDeli

https://instagram.com/deepcutsdeli

https://twitter.com/DeepCutsDeli

story:
To learn more about Rose City Book Pub:
 
https://pdx.eater.com/2018/9/20/17883544/rose-c...
 
https://www.wweek.com/bars/news-bars/2018/09/25...
 
https://www.oregonlive.com/dining/index.ssf/201...
 
https://www.shelf-awareness.com/issue.html?issu...

 

Fundraising Goals:

Our two biggest costs in getting set up are the built-in bookcases and replacing the bar top.  Lots of wood, lots of labor, and I've hired expert builders who are going to make them beautiful as well as functional. 

Risks:

None!  The Book Pub is definitely happening: we're in the place and ready to go.  I have the money to fund these projects, but it's through a bank loan, and I'd like to fund as much as possible through pre-sales.  If we raise $10, I'll still build bookcases and replace the bar top and open a Book Pub in a few weeks.
